39415526.review:
Some view this as the best Shantae game, others are more open to debate. SatPC is a metroidvania style game with fantastic pixel art, catchy music and everything you'd probably love about an old-school game of this style, and all the caveats that come with it.

Some of the puzzle solutions are incredibly obtuse, and the blend of high resolution UI elements with pixel art aesthetics isn't the greatest, but the fact that those are the worst slights against this game speaks volumes.

The items are fun to use, the characters are quirky, and if you are part of a certain demographic, they managed to squeeze a lot of jiggle into a very small sprite.

A worthwhile purchase if you're into the metroidvania genre, but it also comes with the caveats of that title.

39414686.review:
A great metroidvania.  Lighthearted and fun, with a steadily climbing challenge in level design.  Shantae herself will feel far more powerful as you gain abilities.  Bosses are unique and surprising but can usually be overpowered with consumable power-ups. Multiple levels to explore filled with interesting characters.

Some levels can be downright difficult.  Sometimes the game isn't clear where you need to go next, and you'll have to backtrack and experiment to find the path.  Set save rooms mean if you die you may lose a big chunk of progress.  Not the longest game at around 10 hours.

I very much enjoyed this game and would recommend it to anyone.

39350747.review:
I think the biggest problem I have with this game is too much backtracking. The "Metroidvania" aspect people gush about is basically just getting a new ability then going back to another level to backtrack through it and find a brick that you need to break or something. It's excessive padding to an already fairly short game. It just wasn't that interesting. It was short enough that I was able to grit my teeth and just finish it, but I wouldn't recommend it that much, unless it's really cheap. There are much better 2D "Metroid" style games out there that do progression much better.

Also, the last level of the game is total BS and straight out of something like Super Meat Boy. Good luck with that if you ever play this. It almost made the entire game that much worse. It's literally cancer.

39223669.review:
[h1] Esta es la mejor entrega de la saga de Shantae. [/h1]
Shantae Half Genie Hero fue como conocí esta serie, posteriormente conseguí la forma de jugar el primero, luego Risky’s Revenge y por último Pirate’s Curse; sin duda me divertí mucho con todos pero este es el mejor.

[b]Lo bueno[/b]
+Como siempre excelente soundtrack
+Divertida y mejor historia que todas las demás entregas
+Excelente variedad de niveles
+Personajes divertidos y con un estupendo diseño de arte
+El cambio de usar transformaciones a objetos piratas le sentó muy bien
+Muy buena jugabilidad

Claro que tampoco es perfecto y sigue conservando algunos de los inconvenientes que siempre han estado presente en la saga:
[b]Lo malo[/b]

-En general es un tanto fácil si no te interesa hacer speedrun o sacar todos los logros
-Duración escasa. A excepción del primero, absolutamente todos los Shantae al terminarlos me dejan con ganas de más :/
-Puede resultar un juego un tanto simple en comparación de otros grandes metroidvanias

Como siempre Wayfoward nos entrega un juego de Shantae de muy buena calidad, tiene un reto intermedio a fácil, aunque con una buena sección que pondrá a prueba tus mejores movimientos. 100% recomendable, este es un metroidvania super disfrutable sin tantas complicaciones.

39168394.review: Once again Shantae comes with a fantastic soundtrack, while reusing past songs, new songs come in strong. The animation is brighter than before and the backgrounds are just as well detailed as ever. This game suppliments the connected overworld of the pervious titles for a multiple world systems. For the most part this is an improvement as it gives a greater sense of variety. However, on the flip side, it introduces worlds that just felt disappointing in comparison, like Mud Bog Island, which its only unique trope was how overfilled it was with enemies. A lot of the new powerups also felt unique and I love how well the story of this game connects to Risky's Revenge. The results of that game have consequences in this one. The story is still cheesy but well carried enough to be enjoyable. The dungeons and bosses found unique ways to utilize that areas given item. And while I won't spoil anything in detail, the final dungeon is an excellent test to your skill in using every tool you have achieved up to that point. 9.0/10

The skills involved in this level have very little to do with the rest of the game &, even though everyone despises this level, the creators refuse to fix it even though people who loved the game up to this point have uninstalled it & never played it again.

38600469.review:
There are quite a few things I would say are positive about this game. 
Controls are tight and responsive.
Music is catchy. I wouldn't say that I've been humming it to myself yet, but it fits the theme of the game well.
Spite work and character art is good. Art is subjective, but I found the portraits of Shantae that appear while she talks to be nice to look at as well as amusing.
The writing is good, I find it impressive that they've managed to keep up with continuity since their first game. Everything fits together and you get a feel for who the characters are and why they are the way they are. Humor is also well done, as certain parts made me break out laughing. 

If there were one thing that I would critique negatively, it would be some of the level design towards the end. They throw you into these segments where you either get through in one go or die to insta-kill spikes. I don't mind insta-kills when used in moderation, but that's practically all you get towards the end and it's very frustrating. It's not a game breaker, but it's not much fun to fail instantaneously and repeatedly to these traps.

Overall though, I liked the game. Been playing them in reverse order it seems, so I've got high hopes for the next Shantae game I play.

38565860.review:
Me in the beginning of this game:
Whoa this game is good. I'll probably play this until like 3AM.

Aaaaaaaaaand it's 7AM. I'm not even feeling tired.

I just wish the game was a bit less forgiving. In most situations you can just "drink your problems away" - literally - using HP potions or eating food to restore health mid-combat. Powerups that protect you from projectiles or boost your damage (up to 3x) are also insanely strong. Of course, the game would a bit disappointing or shallow if you play a half-genie yet don't have any powers, I just wish the devs had balanced the game around these powers. 

Music is awesome btw. I wish I could buy the OST.

I got this game in a humble bundle and didn't play it for about a year before I saw it again and thought "well, I've got it. Might as well check it out." I watched a playthrough of Risky's Revenge and liked it, so I installed Pirate's Curse. Let me tell you: Wow. This game was fantastic. It felt like I was playing one of my old NES games, but way better and not crazy difficult. 

This game had the right balance of puzzle solving and combat, and the story was fun as well. With a bit of searching, I was able to find all but one of the cacklebats on my own. The bosses were fun, and Squid Baron is officially my spirit animal now.

If you liked NES games and want one with a modern touch, I highly recommend this and any other Shantae game on Steam.

Finished it in 9 hours with 100%, but I enjoyed it.

Pro:
+ You'll get easily aroused
+ Animation and Character design is simply amazing
+ Level design
+ Controlls
+ Music is amazing on some levels
+ Sound
+ Humor

Cons:
- Story: a good story is whats keeping you in the game. I will not joke around, it was mostly the gameplay and the character design that kept me comming back. The Story was funny, but nothing else.
- It's not a game that got me hooked. When I had to go somewhere, i wasn't like "just this one more level".. I just went, and came back later to carry on. But I wasn't rushing or anything, its was just "..meh, might as well"

No body will read this line, but I will write it anyway: 
all-in-all it was a good game. Nice platforming action, and the enjoyment of collecting things, although I must confess that I'm bored of the "before you head on over to this level, find this and that, and talk to this and that". If the story is bad or none existing then I will just look up everything and not backtrack, to find out where I should need to go.

Side note to devs: HOLLOW KNIGHT!!! Now thats how you write a story. It doesn't need to be dark, as even a funny story can be a good story.

36554204.review:
After discovering and falling in love with Hollow Knight, I just thought "Wow, metroidvanias are cool".

However the difference between the two is just too big. I fell in love with HK's detailed world and somewhat hard difficulty, and I wasn't ready for a total change.

I can see the fun in Shantae games with the jokes and simple gameplay, but it really feels like I'm playing a "low budget" game. The part that really got me out straight off is the rigid gameplay, wich I find really awkward for a action-platformer.

In the end buy this if you want to have light hearted fun, buy Hollow Knight if you want a deeper plot and some actual challenge for a lower price.

I have made my choice, but yours is only up to you!

36059788.review:
Its a good blend of platforming and adventure.

The gameplay takes place on different islands, which acts as different "worlds" - a collection of various interconnecting platforming rooms. Worlds are revisitable, and necessarily so for story progression. New areas (previously inaccessible) naturally open up as you learn new abilities. "Metroidvania", in a way.

Music is good, characters are charming, and the level design is TOP NOTCH.

The difficulty is somewhat conerning, however. Some not-so-talented players may find themselves saying "Screw this!" and not finishing the game after you start reaching more reflex-demanding portions of the game. Likewise, with more thought-provoking parts of the progression, where you're stuck not knowing where to go or how to progress. I'll stress this again - this game makes you think! Remember who you spoke to, revisit them, including random travelers, they typically can tell you something vital.


Overall, I really enjoyed it. I like challenging games and this one delivered. I just got two pieces of advice for you:
1) Remember who you speak to. You'll get lost/stuck otherwise.
2) Don't waste your money on that $400 "Mighty Kick" nonsense. Your basic attack will always be better.

相较于前作，本作的整体素质提高不少。（当然前作也很优秀，没玩过推荐玩玩）
人物缩小了占屏比，没有前作那种拖屏杀的尴尬
虽然有不少前作的敌人，但大幅改变了系统，不会觉得和前作太像

取而代之的是各种海盗道具，可以滑翔、冲刺、三段跳等。
虽然这些系统似曾相识，比如冲刺就很银河战士，刺刀让人想到唐老鸭2的拐杖。不过现在2D游戏能也很难有什么革命性的创新

以及里面的剧情、人物都还是挺欢乐的。
缺点嘛
仍然缺乏提示，卡关只能满世界找攻略，偏偏又不好找。好在B站有人发了流程视频，可以参考

以及有些地方真的恶意满满。
总的来说，仍然是当前复古像素风2D平台动作游戏的优秀作品

35081438.review:
Jouer à un Shantae, c'est entrer dans le pays des bimbos cartoonisées. C'est passer plus de temps à mater le design olé olé de tous les personnages féminins plutôt que de lire leurs dialogues. Et pour un premier contact avec la série de la gentille génie (devenu humaine suite à la perte de ses pouvoirs dans cet épisode), j'ai été surpris de voir que même les femmes plus âgées sont bien entretenues ! Merci chers devs de prendre soin de vos milfs !

Je dois avouer qu'au départ le gameplay ne me plaisait pas du tout. À part sauter et fouetter les ennemis avec sa chevelure en tortillant son petit cul, on ne pouvait rien faire d'autres. Mais metroidvania oblige, quelques améliorations de son personnage son éparpillées sur notre chemin au cours de l'aventure et rendront le gameplay très agréable et maniable. Et bon point pour toi Shantae, c'est que ce large panel qui étoffera les possibilités se maîtrisera aisément parce que le jeu est assez ben foutu pour nous apprendre à utiliser l'amélioration acquise, puis de la combiner avec une ancienne, etc.

Je dois évidemment parler de l'humour du jeu. Sûrement ce qui m'a vraiment fait apprécier le titre. Tous les personnages sont bêtes et font de l'auto dérision. Ils n'hésitent pas à dire des conneries, vous prendre pour un con et à raconter leur vie alors qu'on s'en fout royalement. J'ai par exemple beaucoup aimé le Squid Baron lorsqu'il parle de ses vacances de rêve et qu'il veut voir des jolies filles en petite tenue sur la plage du désert. Il y a quand même quelques moments sérieux bien sûr, sinon la quête pour anéantir le méchant pirate ne rimera à rien. Je trouve quand même dommage que les personnages ne sont pas du tout attachant, ils sont drôles, en forme (pour les nanas ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)) et... c'est tout.

Chose assez relou par contre même si tout est coloré et que l'aventure nous emmène sur des îles fort variées avec ennemis et ambiance différente, c'est qu'au fil de l'histoire il faudra trouver des objets de quête pour avancer. Des quêtes plutôt simple ma foi, mais la où c'est chiant c'est qu'il faut souvent (pour ne pas dire tout le temps) se taper plein d'aller retour d'une île à l'autre et croyez moi que c'est pénible surtout quand on doit chercher dans tous les coins et revenir 20 fois sur ses pas quand on loupe quelque chose. Heureusement qu'il existe un objet pour revenir instantanément au début de l'île, mais je pensais jamais à l'acheter et je perdais inutilement mon temps. Ce n'est pas vraiment à classer dans les "points négatifs" du jeu, mais ça reste à souligner.

J'ai vu que beaucoup de gens parlaient de la facilité. Oui c'est facile quand on joue juste comme ça sans se prendre la tête. Moi qui veut les succès sur steam, j'ai galéré à quelques passages lorsqu'il faut par exemple battre tous les boss sans se faire toucher ou même terminer le jeu en speedrun. De la re-jouabilité il y en a, mais il faut aimer persévérer.

35038301.review:
11/10 soundtrack ( when scuttle town was under construction why did the music change D: ) Dialogue in this game is actually hilarious at times and the pace of the game is fairly consistent. The gameplay was surprisingly more interactive then in riskys revenge. Going from transformations to pirate weapons in my opinion made the game feel more enjoyable. With transformations you have to sit there and wait to transform into a very specific creature to do a very specific job, and then u revert back to ur human form when the deed is done. With the pirate weapons you can do more then just hang on walls or swim in the sea. You have ur boots to speedrun through the level. Pistol for long range attacks. Hat for gliding across areas or avoiding grounded enemies. (Scimitar wasn't too interactive imo since I only used it to break blocks and that's it.) The difference between pirate weapons and transformations is that you are always using pirate weapons on the fly all the time, where as transformations were just there to get past a certain obstacle and that's it. You could even combo ur weapons like speeding up with the boots and using that momentum to fly across the level with ur hat while keeping ur self in the air by boosting urself with the cannon. With all this in mind it made the gameplay very creative and fun to mess around with. 

There r times when the game makes huge jumps in difficulty without warning. For example, Tan Line Island was meh in difficulty only being the third island but the one right after is insane compared to Tan Line. 

Overall I gave the game a 8.5/10 and would recommend this game to anyone looking to play a metroidvania style game.

34370204.review:
An amazing soundtrack that I can't get out of my head even after a few years, which the composer sells for whatever you give him for it.
A great platformer which introduces mechanics along the road, opening new ways for you to reach new areas.
An adorable, well-animated female protagonist who I can't get out of my head as well.
A storyline which has good humour and doesn't take itself (too) seriously.

Yeah, I think it was worth it buying the game more than once.

Just run before it takes over your life as well.

34363909.review:
A satisfying metroidvania for both casual and hardcore gamers looking for something refreshing. Although the game is a piece of cake in comparison to other metroidvanias due to the amount of consumables the game throws at you, the final boss (the true one) will still pose a good challenge (especially if you're not using consumables). The upgrades you obtain from beating each world build upon each other and every single one of them continues to be useful throughout the game (unlike in Risky's Revenge); Each upgrade feels very responsive to use, activating immediately and allowing the player alot of freedom in approaching different situations. 
As always, Shantae's regular gameplay of beating down enemies with your elastic ponytail is satisfying. I can give this a strong recommendation to anyone who likes the general aesthetic of this game; artstyle or gameplay-wise.

34263098.review:
Metroidvania with wonderful graphics and funny dialogs and scenes.

Music is nice and lively. Many scenes have a humour twist and this makes the characters comedy like. Character animation is cute and great.

Shantae hits people with her hair and powers it up buying shampoo. Some items are crazy and original, as a cannon for triple jumping while shooting into the ground. There is also plenty of grabs for recovering life, defending yourself and raising attack damage.

Maps have some secrets. Maybe one point down is that many of these secret areas are needed to advance in the game, making them not-so-secret and more like you-can-now-jump-there. Should have been less linear.

Difficulty is medium like. Boss battles are frenzy but doable. Bosses require you to use the item you get in each dungeon, which is an intelligent choice.

Maybe last dungeon is crazy but it can be done after some (or a lot of) trial and error.

Also, I won't even try to do the no hit while killing bosses achievement. This is madness.

This game is a classic platformer to its core. The humor is childish but makes you smile. The combat is satisfactory with items instead of spells. If you’ve played the earlier games this will make them feel slightly more important, but only because you see more of them. 

If you like platforming games and don’t mind that it isn’t for Linux, then this is a must buy.

My complaints are few but of existence. The items you use instead of spells are basically the same as before (except they’re items). This means that they have the same flaws as earlier. Some items are clearly better than others. The game is a bit too easy and the only way to make it harder is to go for the achievements. These achievements however, go fast to become only for the most hard core of gamers. 

This game is clearly aimed for younger audience than myself, looking at the characters, easy gameplay and childish jokes. Still they have an extreme sexualisation of all the female characters in the game. This is a problem from the older games that has been blown up to new heights here. For example, the better you beat the game the “sexier” the end picture will be. This is slightly disturbing and does bring forth the usual problems unnecessary sexualisation brings.

33682780.review:
<Audio>
Let's start by saying when I saw "Jake Kaufmann" in the credits for the music, it all made sense. Shantae has some incredibly catchy tunes. Each island (seven-ish of them) has at least 2 completely different tracks, and most of them are extremely well done. I first learned who Jake Kaufmann was after I heard the amazing Shovel Knight soundtrack, and his work is just as good in this game. Where Shovelknight sounded more 8-bit, nintendo-y, this game has a bit more 16-bit era (sonic-ish?)  sounding tunes. Really great stuff.

<Art>
The art is colourful and cheerful, even in the desolate regions of the game. The main character, and many other supporting characters are basically made to be "waifu" material. It lays the suggestive themes on thick, and is unapologetic about it. Curvy/busty females are plentiful, and the game has fun with it. Whatever the "first" game did, this one has more, and again, I'm fine with that. Not every game needs super serious/realistic characters all the time. I don't think a single character in this game isn't some sort of caricature (stupid, goofy, scary, sexy, playful, etc) of something.

<Gameplay>
Another improvement on the first game, but don't expect a deep/complex game here. The game does enough to differentiate the gameplay, with different enemies/obstacles for each island to keep it playable. The level design is fairly plain, and overall the difficulty is relatively low. The boss fights bring the most spice to the games, but each one is "megaman"ish where they have 2-3 attacks/patterns that you'll learn, figure out their weakness, and exploit it. Pretty standard stuff, and it's done well. It's good, not great.

The difficulty spikes from 2-3/10 to 8/10 at the end with some challenging, precise platforming. I would've appreciated some of that challenge throughout the game, as the game has a lot going for it. The devs are fairly competent, and I think they have it in them to make this game go to the next level, and have created a good IP. I think what's lacking for this franchise to be great is to expand a little on the level design, add some items/rpg elements maybe... something. It's an enjoyable experience with alternate endings etc, but for me it stands as a "Good" game, not particularly a "Great" one... perhaps by design, as the game is ported from the Nintendo arcade? (3ds? wii-u?.. one of those), so perhaps they were trying to keep the game more "digestible". Comparing this game to something like Shovel Knight (this game is a bit more "open", but it's not exactly a metroid-vania), you'll know exactly what I mean by "simple levels".

<overall>
So ya, if you want a campy, fun platformer that isn't too too long, this is worth getting. Great music, "fanservice" artwork, and good platforming overall -- just not quite in the same echelon as shovel knight, and now, Hollow knight (different styles of games, but fair to compare overall quality to).
It really is an intellectual property that I think has a lot of promise. I hope they decide to make one of these games with a bit more breadth to it.

33651080.review:
I decided to finally complete last Shantae game available on PC - Shantae and the Pirate's Curse. And it was such a blast! It's like all my complaints about previous entries were listened to! With that being said, I'll jump into list of pros and cons!

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
  [*] Very good powers' progression. All of the powers feel useful even late in the gameplay, and none of them feel superfluous, like spider in HGH.
  [*] Great stage design - it compliments how the powers work, and there are a lot of very cleverly hidden secrets to find!
  [*] The length is much better than the other Shantae games - it took me about 10 hours this time to get 100% run without guides. It's much better than previous entries which were completed in about 6.
  [*] Graphic is very good - it's much better version of pixel art than presented in Risky's Revenge. And characters' pictures are also very good, almost on HGH level!
  [*] Cast of characters that take part in the story are fun, diverse, and great looking.
  [*] Sound design is ok - soundtrack does it's job. I think it's on similar level to the other Shantae games.
  [*] This time they attempted to do something different with the bosses - they aren't always just meat bags to beat. Sometimes they require something more, which is what I wanted from them in my previous reviews. Plus, they are challenging when attempting "don't get hit" achievements! Definitely best bosses in the series.
  [*] It is the most challenging game from the series when attempting a speedrun - it's not "impossibly hard", but it was the most interesting challenge posed by a Shantae game.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
  [*] This is basically the only one bad side for me - I missed some more interesting story. It's very barebones. And while characters are colorful, well designed and fun, story itself is very basic and forgettable. I think it was the only factor missing to make the game truly special.
[/list]

This game is a very good pseudo-metroidvania (there is split to stages similar to HGH). One of the better ones I've played! This is definitely the best entry in the series and the one I would recommend to newcomers - to see Shantae at it's best! I don't think story is important enough to make missing parts from Risky's Revenge a big deal. With that being said, my final number score is [b]9/10[/b]. The game is amazing, very well designed, I had a lot of fun with it and length was just ok for this genre. It missed some special factor to make it higher though, something memoriable, like a better story. Still, it's one of the better games I've played this year, and one of the better metroidvanias overall! If you want to play Shantae, I think this is the entry to check out!

On a final unrelated to score note, I think this game sets perfect ground for some sort of Risky's Spinoff - I'm not that much fan of her character, but the moveset established in this game is almost perfect, so it would be nice to have a continuation or expansion of it with another game where Risky as anti-heroine goes to hunt for some treasures akin to Wario... I think it would make a better game than making tons of transformations where only half of them is truly useful, like in Half-Genie Hero.

33651050.review: Questo titolo è metroidvania a tema comico, con una particolare caratterizzazione dei personaggi femminili dalle curve ben vistose ed una colonna sonora veramente spettacolare. A prima vista potrebbe sembrare un semplice platform a scorrimento laterale, ma come un buon metroidvania che si rispetti, sarà fondamentale fare del backtracking per avere il completismo totale, sia per soddisfazione che per utilità. Backtracking che difficilmente sarà lungo e noioso, dato che la maggior parte degli oggetti nascosti è tutto sommato ben visibile, unito al fatto che la musica di gioco vi entrerà in testa come fosse un tormentone estivo, ma positivo. Informandomi in giro ho letto che è sconsigliato giocarlo come primo capitolo della serie, ma personalmente l'ho comprato in bundle. Considerando tutto ciò ed il fatto che è un genere che ho provato assai poco, consiglio il titolo a chi vuole tornare nel passato con delle vecchie meccaniche, ma con uno spirito decisamente vario.

33599290.review:
La saga de Shantae vuelve con una edición que marcaría su regreso triunfal a la escena de los videojuegos, con hermosos rediseños muy bien ilustrados.

Empezando desde donde terminó la entrega anterior, Shantae ya no posee sus poderes de genio, y ahora deberá enfrentarse a sus enemigos con habilidades que irá adquiriendo en su camino y puede accerder con un simple botón, en lugar de transformarse tras una secuencia de baile. En este aspecto Shantae and the Pirate's Curse se diferencia de sus predecesores.

A pesar de ser un "metroidvania", el desarrollo es extremadamente linear. No hay lugar para la exploración abierta. El Shantae de Gameboy Color disponia de un mundo más abierto.

Hermosos sprites meticulosamente animados y una excelente banda sonora.

La curva de dificultad sube en pícada a la mitad del juego, como si los programadores hubiesen visto que el juego era muy corto y decidieran meter partes que no hcen más que retrasar al jugador.

Los jefes es extremadamente dificiles, pero se convierten en un chiste con el uso de objetos, pero no por mucho. De cualquier forma no creo que alguna vez podría derrotar alguno sin ayuda de un objeto especial.

La traducción en español es un tanto bizarra, tanto como traducir la palabra "key" (llave) como "clave", o usar el nombre "Sequin Land" la mayor parte del juego y luego traducirla como "Tierra Lentejuela" en pleno jefe final.

El juego es increiblemente accesible para aquellos con PC de bajo rendimiento. (A pesar de tener ciertos bajones de FPS al entrar y salir de una habitación, y toda una habitación del segmento final del juego tenía un claro ralentizamiento)

El control es excelente (si se usa controlador), cada función está asignada de manera accesible sin causar dolor a largo plazo en las manos.

El contenido de Shantae puede ser un poco inapropiado, ya sea con los voluptuosos diseños de los personajes femeninos y situaciones un poco incomodas, pero no deja de ser una aventura cargada de humor para toda la familia.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es una gran aventura.

33469874.review:
最早是看谜之声直播的时候看到的这款游戏，理所当然的被立绘吸引了2333
  然后就关注了这款游戏 乘打折入了。最近从别人手里收了一个手柄后决定就来玩玩这个游戏[strike] 舔立绘	[/strike]
当时看直播的时候觉得画风糙，但是自己玩起来的时候觉得其实还蛮不错的，作为像素风游戏。人物做的不错 特别是shantae的动作部分 比如 跳舞 扭屁股2333，看了看初代视频也是被gbc上面的shantae跳肚皮舞惊到。一直不动 shantae会撩头发，蹲下来会扭屁股 ，吸灯会跳肚皮舞。  

 " 我可以在城里看上一整天的肚皮舞"——？？？

  游戏本身的内容还是一个比较正经的卷轴跳台游戏，boss战前的3段跳台对我这种手残党简直是噩梦，不过死多了手感就记住了，完全靠感觉过去的- -。然而比起跳台内容 其实更有趣的是剧情，小故事挺多的，感觉打下来记住了不少人，ammo男爵手下的两个妹子手下(舔)，亦正亦邪然而又具有魅力的risky boots(舔)，元气系僵尸妹rottytops(舔 尸体？),绝对好姬友sky（舔）和她的男(？)朋友 wrench(鹦鹉?)， 百合大作233 cp太多了 sky，rottytops，riskyboots 各个的人设都一级棒 可舔[spoiler]神殿里的space princess的服装贼好舔 那段逃脱的苦受的值了	[/spoiler]。值得一提的是很多任务内容都在对话里 跳过了就很麻烦，毕竟没有任务提示系统，就得看攻略了。
 难度的话。。如果你以前通关过无数gba fc上的跳台游戏的话 这个应该是小case了。如果是萌新的话，有些关卡还是有点难度的，主要体现在跳台上。。拼硬实力。 而且存档点很关键 死了就会回上一个存档点 其他地方不会帮你存档。有时候浪死了特别心疼。对于正常人来说就是大部分还好 有时候有点挑战。boss感觉大部分都还好 就是那个龙的boss有点随机性，当时搞了我一会。
关卡设计的其实还是比较有意思的，当然我也是对比而言，比起那些纯跳台的解谜小游戏，就是隐藏我比较头疼，还是找攻略收集全小蝙蝠的。 

  游戏的音乐 能和立绘媲美了。完全不会厌，感觉这游戏内容虽然比较普通但是因为有这个音乐伴着让我觉得跳台也不会显得那么无聊。我比较喜欢 主城，rottytops和 bossbattle的bgm，主城波斯风音乐贼好听 再跳上一段肚皮舞 啧 我土猫收兵。话说挺多曲子就是gbc时代就有了 主城 和 bossbattle的曲子就是改编的 原来8bit的风格也特好听。这一作的音乐也是主要电子但又有点复古掌机游戏风的感觉，不过本来就是nds上移植过来的，有那种掌机音乐的感觉也挺正常。最近玩完了也是去YouTube上找remix 有个rottytops的remix贼魔性 最近洗脑循环中。

玩这游戏又让我回到了以前玩fc 的时候，插上卡带 ，坐在电视机前，拿着只有上下左右 ab键的手柄 疯狂受虐。 [spoiler]虽然好像本来就是掌机上的游戏	[/spoiler]

总体来说 我觉得是一款艺术享受高于游玩体验的游戏，然而说到底游戏本来就是艺术分割开来可能就不会有那么好的化学反应了。
好像特惠的时候经常会打折， 打折的时候值得一入，建议手柄游玩。

Cons:
- Could have been longer
- Some bosses are too easy
- Some achievements are hard to obtain
- [spoiler]Shantae cannot transform or use magic due to events in the Risky's Revenge[/spoiler]

Do I recommend?
If you're into old-school 2D platformers, yes. If you played and liked the previous Shantae game, Risky's Revenge, definitely yes.

VerdicT: 7 / 10 - Good 2D platformer

33257062.review:
I definitely recommend this game to anybody, especially fans of the Metroidvania sub-genre of platformers. The pros certainly outweigh the cons here.

Pros:

- The graphics are incredible; wonderfully detailed environments and characters, fluid animations, and many parallax scrolling layers. In addition, character portraits in cutscenes are well drawn.
- THE SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING!!
- Gameplay is fast and fluid; the pirate equipment is a blast to use, while keeping things moving.
- In-game currency is plentiful, allowing you to stock up on items which can help you. However, you don't feel like Gems are being dumped on you.
- Dungeons will test your abilities, but they aren't too overwhelming. They strike a good balance between Metroid-type exploration, and Zelda-esque combat and puzzle solving.
- The bosses are huge and daunting, but fun and well designed, putting your pirate gear to good use in their strategies.
- Encourages replayability with Heart Squids, Cacklebats, and Pirate Mode (starting the game again with all of the pirate equipment - a speedrun mode of sorts).
- Don't like backtracking? Pirate Flares can eliminate most of it, and they don't require too many Gems to buy.
- Lots of secrets and hidden stuff.
- Funny and memorable dialogue and character interactions. Shantae is known for having lots of humor, and this is no exception.
- The game puts the pirate gear to good use in the boss fights and they are required to beat the game so they don't feel underutilized.
- Like mentioned before, the game absolutely encourages exploration and it's fun exploring and finding secrets in the world, like walls you can break through.
- Over the course of the story, quite a few characters get a big dose of character development.
- With things like puzzles, you actively have to figure out the solution, testing your smarts and problem solving skills instead of the game pointing out what to do.
- Platforming is decently challenging, putting your skills to the test, and this is complimented by buttery smooth controls. I always felt like falling into a bottomless pit was my fault, not the game's.

Cons:

- Some areas, like the first part of Mud Bog Island, go wayyy overboard with their enemy count.
- There are a few random difficulty spikes like the aformentioned Mud Bog Island and the Pirate Master's Palace (although the latter is the final level; it's supposed to be hard).
- The game puts items and gear you find to good use. However, a few items, such as the Bubble Shield, still manage to feel underutilized.

The characters are charming and play off each other really well as they are familiar with eachother from the past games. The game doesn't overstay its welcome and has a very enjoyable level of difficulty which is engaging yet manages to avoid becoming a frustrating experience. All in all, it's a great game that I'd highly recommend to anyone that is a fan of or interested in 2d platformers.

32903762.review:
an all around great, insanely underrated game.

 the characters, story and world are all charming. the characters have comedic and distinct personalities, with evolving dialogue and interactions throughout the story. each map feels fresh with new mechanics and enemies, and the bosses are a lot of fun. also each map has a completely different setting and feel. there is some returning to previous cleared areas which make the world feel less linear, and there's one town you'll likely be returning to often which adds some charm. and there's plenty of learning new abilities which adds variety to the gameplay and makes navigating through the world easier, while also opening up new areas in previously cleared maps. the music is nostalgic and the graphics are gorgeous.

the gameplay and difficulty is reminiscent of DKC for me - a lot of fun with occasional frustrating sections that take a few tries and feel satisfying to complete. there are also two different possible endings which i found unique in a platformer. i'm not any kind of completionist who has ever put effort into getting achievements, but i found myself doing that with this game.

i hear complaints about the last dungeon and its difficulty. it is hard relative to the difficulty of the rest of the dungeons, but it's nowhere near as hard as i thought it would be after reading the discussions.

32894954.review:
From my view, it has their good and bad sides. and some of them are a matter of opinion. 
It's only too bad that the game didn't fit well to my opinion. But the game is worth the try.

I'm overall neutral about this, And I'm very two-sided to give it a positive or negative response. 
But I decided to give it a positive view as my opinion differs from the others.

It's however worth pointing out the next things before you buy:

Pro's:
- Great animations, I've really enjoying them, especially Shantae herself.
- Great Soundtrack. They're really fitting to them, some of them are arabic, and sometimes it fits even Castlevania.
- Every character has pretty much their own full body render art during dialogues.
- It has their humor, mostly classic humor. 
- Fanservice. That's pretty much the game's main point. There are busty ladies with bra's and bikini's everywhere. Now combine it with the full body renders and you've an anime visual novel in a platformer game. 
However, I'm not a visual novel fan, When I'm playing a game I prefer the gameplay over the artwork, and honestly I think it would have been fine enough for me if it were just head pictures. I can't take my time to look at their bodies if they might have something important to tell. Maybe appealing for other people. just not for me.

Cons:
- The controls are ... weird, I guess you'll get used to it, but it's weird for me when everything is assigned to a different button. An example: Attack, talk and confirm has 3 seperate buttons, while it would have been more user-friendly if they mixed it into one. This also takes away a bit of the combat flow.
- Difficulity spikes, The game feels too easy at the start. but later on the game turns out to becomes harsh. (The final area is a huge twist compared to the overall game.)
- Fullscreen seems a bit buggy sometimes when using alt-f4. 
- Lack of animations, sounds a little ironic as I also said that they've great animations. But sometimes I've noticed that it looks like only halfway done. Causing a bit of a quality break. It sometimes feels like there could have been some extra animations here and there: The idle animations looks the same every time despite their artworks shows different expressions, it's a bit odd to me as the standard idle animation doesn't really fit with the situation sometimes. 
And sometimes when I expected to see an unique animated cutscene by an event, the screen goes black instead. It's a little bit easily done in that term and that's a bit disappointing. Because the animations does look good and I could have certainely see that potential.

My own opinion: 
I think this game differs too much from what I'm used to with Metroidvania's. And there have been parts that I don't find logical to happen. I do have played the game untill the end though, including the secret ending as I was pretty close to that. But in all honestly, there has been parts that rather takes me away from replaying it. The game didn't really fit my style, but that doesn't make it a bad game. It also has their good sides, as there were several music, animations, mechanics and upgrades that I've enjoyed.

Overall, I've been really trying to love the game, but it didn't really fit at my end.
The real question is where your interests are at, because for me, it's really hard to tell to which audience this game is really meant.
- If you want to play the game for the difficulity and 'Metroidvania' level design, Then I find the game is on the easy side. Despite the insane difficulity ramp at the end. It does have the Metroidvania feelings though, but I find it done rather simple.
- If you want to play the game for the art design, go ahead. The animations, music, art and most character cast design were enjoyable for me. Just be aware that you'll get a really hard time finishing it.

That's it for Pirate's Curse, It didn't fit my style, but I don't hate it, hopefully 1/2 Genie Hero gives me a better experience what Shantae is about.

32754522.review:
I have initially played this game on a Nintendo 3DS screen, so a lot of my experience will be based off that and not the PC Version. However, I would state that both versions play basically the same.
Story: Shantae has been stripped bare of her magic and Scuttle Town is now under the iron treads of Ammo Baron. On the other side of the sea, a terrible evil threatens to rise back up to send Sequin Land to a lifetime of darkness and death. Only through a team-up with Shantae's archnemesis Risky Boots can they both save Sequin Land from this evil. As a game plot, it's basic and slightly cliche'd, but it's still good enough to keep on playing. 8.5/10
Controls: Unlike most other games, where you use WASD to control your character, Shantae actually uses the arrow keys and ZXCASD, which could confuse users more used to WASD. Overall, it would be preferable to use a controller, though unlike its older brother, Super Meat Boy, it's playable with just the keyboard. 8/10
Graphics: As a whole, the pixel art style cannot get any more better than this in sheer quality. And while there are some peeople who may be bothered by how anime-like Shantae and her friends appear, it's still all good and gives people some eye candy. And don't worry, He-Man is there to balance out the waifu scale. 9.5/10
Sound: Both Music and general sound effects are here. Music-wise, Jake Kaufman does amazing job as the composer. (11/10) Sound-wise, we do get to hear how Shantae and Risky sound through their occasional spoken line, though most of the sound is through fighting. The sounds do lend themselves pretty well to their designated objects, though certain sounds don't satisfy the feeling we all have. (7.5/10) Overall: 9/10
Overall and other mentions: This game is THE definitive Metroidvania platformer, where you have to collect new power-ups to go into different areas where you couldn't go before, and go out of your way to get 100% or rush the game to complete it under a designated period of time to get a payday, if you will. This game gets a 9/10, since a lot of the less good elements do get drowned out by the best of quality entertainment. To end it, this game is most certainly NOT for kids, grandma and soccer mums everywhere. Or people who get offended real easily, to be fair.

32638243.review:
in my opinion, one of the best shantae games for a lot of reasons. this game differs a bit from the others as shantae has lost her "genie half" in the previous game, so ability progression is not based on dances that transform you but in pirate gear that's a bit similar to metroid abilities (if that makes sense). 

great art, writing, sprites, and music, so right on the surface this game looks and sounds great. the "dungeons" and their bosses are really well made and the island-based map system solves the previous game's (risky's revenge) issues of the confusing/hard to navigate map.

in terms of controls and fluidity of play, the pirate gear abilities mesh really well with the levels, and it keeps the simple damage/attack speed upgrades that risky's revenge had minus the weird requriement of magic jelly. though this game also draws from metroid's habit of ability-locked secrets that require backtracking (whether that's good or bad is up to you).

lastly, if you feel an indescribable need to unlock all achievements in games you buy, then be ready. amongst the hardest are doing bosses without taking damage, speedrunning, finishing a notably difficult platforming and enemy avoiding sequence without dying, and completing the game without any health upgrades (that means with *two* health!) of course, achievements are exactly that, and it's not like you're being forced to do these asininely hard tasks.

all in all, very very good game, I've bought it on several platforms (I actually think it's a bit better on the 3DS) and do not regret it. definitely a 10/10 to me.

32631437.review:
What do you look for in a video game? A rough challenge? A great cast and story? Enjoyable gameplay with solid controls? Well with Shantae and the Pirate's Curse you'll get at least 2 out of three.

The greatest asset this game has it's it's cast and story, even if this is your first Shantae game (it was for me). The only 2 characters that were glossed over durin the game are actually new to this title: the blond-haired duo of Twitch and Vinegar (you never even get their names). The rest of the cast, from enemies to allies, all have their own quirks, personalities, and even worries, ranging from finding a husband, turning orphanages into cannons, and dealing with post-boss syndrome. You know, normal video game problems. The story follows our title character joining forces with the previous titles' main baddie, the pirate Risky Boots, to stop the return of her old master from the grave. As with any good rivalry, plenty of bickering and comraderie awaits.

Gameplay is as resposive as you'd want out of an action-platformer. Shantae can use her hair and a variety of sub-weapons to deal with foes. As she clears the game's dungeons (called Dens of Evil) she'll find Risky's missing equipment, each helping her either fight enemies or explore more areas (often both). The game really opens up once you collect all five, as 3 of them (Hat, Boots, and Cannon) can be used in conjuction to speed through areas and past enemies, and it's at this point that the level design really begins to shine as WayForward obviously designed with this in mind. In fact, the game plays equally well, albeit sufficiently different, between Normal and Pirate Modes (NG and NG+ respectfully).

The one area the game will lack during an normal playthrough is challange, as collecting all the power-ups, Heart Squids (for extra health), and healing items mean that you're never at any real risk of dying outside of a couple boss fights. You could easily by circumvent this by skipping all these things, but it'd been nice for there to simply be a mode where the difficulty is set by the game and not the player.

Overall this is easily one of the most replayable games I've played in years. Pirate Mode is such a pleasant way to play after a Normal game, and the cast and music will always bring a smile to my heart. There's a reason it's a fan-favorite in the series.

PS: If you're interested in getting into speedrunning, then this game also makes a great introductory game if you're new and has a nice Discord community as well.


Score: 9.5/10

32529289.review:
Wow. This game shocked me with how good it was.
I DEFINATLY reccommend you play it!
BUT!
This is not a game to start Shantae with! The mechanics are different and it's not a good idea of what the series is.
Beyond that, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse takes place directly after the events of Shantae: Risky's Revenge. If you haven't played Risky's Revenge first, then you should because it will cause some confusting moments in Pirate Curse.

Pros:

- Amazing Graphics
- You constantly feel interested in the game. There's never a moment where you feel bored or want to take a break.
- Just like all Shantae games, there is backtracking, but the other thing about Shantae games (excluding Half-Genie Hero)      
   is that the backtracking never makes you feel sick of the areas. With the new pirate gear you obtain during your time in 
   the game, after virtually every world there is things to do in all the previous ones.
- There are a ton of collectables
- The game is NOT linear. This game encourages exploration and has the best use of collectable hunting I've seen in my 
   years of gaming. You have to go off your path and utillize your arsinal in creative ways to find hidden passages in walls 
   or hidden rooms to find them. You don't even have to find said collectables and that really helps them feel like goodies 
   rather than chores like many recent games do.
-  This game gives you NOTHING on a sliver platter. Sometimes I feel I'll be hunting for a secret or a collectable just to find 
    a key in the chest I found. The puzzles aren't simply laid out in front of you, they require dedication and smarts. This 
    really protects the game from being too easy and definatly ups the enjoyment levels.
-  Amazing character development. The story is great, all the characters have lovable personalities, you just remember 
    them all and very few are just one-offs.
-  The game also brings some of the trademark Shantae humor to the table which is always greeted with a warm 
    welcome.
-  Fantastic soundtrack!
-  Just straight fun platforming
-  You actually use your items to fight bosses. You don't know how many games render items useless by not doing this!
-  Gems weren't jsut coming at you in heaps.
-  Platforming wasn't too easy.
-  REALLY good final boss fight!

Cons:

- Items that you had to purchase and upgrade in RR amd HGH were turned into one-time use items.
- Some items like the Monster Milks and the Bubble Shield I felt were useless.


Just buy this game and Risky's Revenge at the same time and you'll have a good few weeks.

If your monitor is 144hz, this game can't be played because the physics are based on the frame-rate and the frame-rate is based on your monitor refresh-rate (with no way to change that in-game).  You literally need fps-limiting software to make the game playable.

It's been a known issue for years, and the developer has shown no indication that they intend on fixing it.

What is this, 1990?

31957126.review:
Ver.1.03にて初週100％クリアまで約9時間、ダラダラとプレイして全実績解除までは20時間程度を要しました。アクションゲームは好きな方で人並み程度の腕前として読んで頂ければ幸い。前作Risky's Revengeもプレイ済みです。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]レスポンスの良い操作性
[*]可愛らしいキャラクター達と明朗快活なシナリオ
[*]取り逃しが分かる収集要素の明示
[*]テンションが上がるサウンドトラック[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]切替が面倒なインベントリとマップのUI
[*]現在の目的を見失いやすい
[*]形骸化されている一部のスキル[/list]

[h1]前作から大きく遊びやすさが向上した良質の2Dアクションゲーム[/h1]

　Wayforward開発のShantaeシリーズ3作目。持ち前の行動力と運動能力を武器に、飛んだり跳ねたりの冒険を繰り広げ、ゲーム進行に伴って能力が解放されて活動範囲が広がるタイプの2Dアクションゲーム。主人公であるShantaeはジーニーと人間を親に持つ半魔人として魔力を受け継いでいましたが、前作での成り行きにより今作では魔力を失っています。しかも今回はひょんなことから敵対していた女海賊のRiskyと手を結び、島々を渡り歩くこととなります。

　前作と比較して今作の特徴として大きく目につくところと言えば、[b]移動速度とレスポンスが向上している[/b]点です。アクション後の硬直時間が全体的に短めとなり、高速に移動できる手段が増えたことでゲーム全体のテンポが速まっています。機敏にキャラクターが動くので操作しているだけでとても楽しいです。エリア間が連なっていた前作に対して島ごとにエリア区分されており、[b]VirtことJake Kaufmanのサウンドと相まってよりエリアの特色が出ている[/b]のも特徴です。まだ行くことのできない島が最初からシルエット表示されており、収集要素も島ごとに初めから明示されているので、[b]全体のボリュームを把握しやすくなっている[/b]のも好感触。何気にABボタンの決定、キャンセルのデフォルトが変更されているのも嬉しい。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=917802318

　解像度はフルHDに対応していないものの、ビジュアルも大きく強化されています。特にキャラクターイラストには日本人のイラストレーターKOU氏を迎え、前作のトゥーン調より取っつきやすくなったのではと思います。ドット絵は本当によく動き、アニメーションを眺めるだけでも楽しめます。[b]ランプを掲げて無駄にクネクネさせたのは絶対に私だけでは無い[/b]筈です！kawaii。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=673418269
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=673418251

　リプレイ性もあります。周回時は最初から全能力(装備)解禁されるため、初周プレイでは行えなかった大幅なショートカットが可能でありプレイが苦になりません。飛び道具を無効化するアイテムだったり攻撃力を高めるアイテムを駆使すれば、エリアボスですらパターンの一巡内で倒すことも可能です。そのようなショートカットなりボス瞬殺の攻略方法を見つけるのも周回プレイ時の楽しみと言えます。

　そこまで大きな問題ではないのですが、私がプレイしていて気になった点についても述べて(ボヤいて)おきます。初周プレイ時などマップを見つつインベントリも使用する場合に、ページの切替が面倒臭く感じられました。ワンボタンで目的の画面を表示できたらいいのになぁ…。あと、ゲーム進行はちゃんとテキストを読んでおかないと迷いがちです。島と島の間を行き来するので、メニューのどこかに目的を常時表示してくれると嬉しいなぁ…。そして、お店で買えるスキル系。あえて使うメリットが無いのです…。マイナス点はこのくらいです。


　2015年以降になって旧作含め日本語版リリースが増えてきている経緯から、少しずつ国内での知名度も上がってきているのかも。登場するキャラクター達が明るく活き活きとしていて操作感も良好です。Steam以外のプラットフォームでは定価が4000円であることから定価であってもお買い得です！アクションゲームが好きならどうぞ～。

The best Shantae game by a pretty long shot, okay it may not be that impressive considering the rest of the series is kind of 6/10 or 7/10 material but the pirate's curse is a genuinely amazing game.

But let's be real here, the gameplay changes with the pirate gear taking the place of the old transformations is what makes this game special and a total beast, they're so practical and fun to mess around with and each of them are used well troughout the game not to mention unlike the new half-genie hero, this game has a rather good difficulty curve. another great thing about Pirate's curse is how ever changing it feels and I'm not just talking about the beautiful levels, im talking about all the different "mini games" you have to do, if you want to call them that. in one stage you have to sneak around guards undeteced and in the next you're carrying Rottytops around which leaves you helpless, there were others too but my memorys a little lazy right now.
Honestly the only real issue with the game is that the backtracking is still a bit irritating but other than that I feel like this game is on the same leauge as the likes of some of the best 2D indie platformers like Shovel knight and Freedom planet, an extremely fun experience from start to finish. There are so few games now that hold my attention for very long, but I simply could not put this game down. I even went for the 100% achievement, where usually I just want to complete the story and nothing else.

The visuals in this game are beautiful, from the sprite work to the full 2D character drawings. Environments are varied and well designed and the enemies are cute too. Wayforward has some of my favorite character design in their original IPs, and I love the designs in this game.

There are small bits of voice acting here and there, but they sound really great. The music is catchy, although occasionally repetitive, but that is to be expected in this genre of game.

Controls are tight and work well. I personally finished it using a Steam Controller and I liked it very much.

The gameplay itself is truly excellent. It is [i]slightly[/i] on the hard side but I'm pretty used to that kind of thing from my childhood. If you really want to 100% the game, it will take a bit of work and occasional frustration. I was actually slightly disappointed by the final boss. I found him surprisingly easy to beat, especially with bubble shields and auto-potions equipped. If I had known he would be so easy, I would have probably tried to beat him without any items.

Overall, this game is quite a gem and you should absolutely buy it. Wayforward is a great company that makes great games that are better than many AAA titles, but with 1/10th of the staff and budget. They deserve your love and money.

9.5/10

31692954.review:
I've been playing this game for about a week.  For the most part, it's been an enjoyable ride, but the game has a fatal flaw.  That is the final dungeon.  I find myself totally unable to get past the first spike room as the switch timing and all the spikes makes it nearly impossible for all but the most skilled players to pass with any degree of success.

The massive spike in difficulty that comes with the final dungeon totally ruins my enjoyment of the game and makes me feel cheated that I ever bought it.  Due to the difficulty of the dungeon, I will likely never complete the game and it will remain unfinished.  I feel like I wasted my money with this title.

The final dungeon has a difficulty so great that it feels like it belongs in a different game.  Had I known it would be as difficult as it was, I never would've made the purchase, which is a shame since I enjoyed Half Genie Hero.

On the other hand, it does seem like Wayforward Technologies learned their lesson in this regard as the follow up title had less of a difficulty spike with its final level.  When designing games, there should be a more even increase in the level of difficulty as you progress through the game.  For the most part, this is the case with Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.  However this lesson is forgotten with the final level.  I find the level almost totally impassable, which makes me both frustrated and incredibly angry,

I would ask for a refund, but the game is functional and works on my P.C.  The fault isn't with the game not working but in the fundamentally flawed level design of the final level.  I regretfully must recommend against purchasing this game for all but the most skilled players with the best reflexes.

This. This is the [i]Shantae[/i] I've always wanted. Every misstep from its predecessors cut clean, left only with the best parts and then some.

Fabulous art and music always. Reworked character portraits? Absolutely adorable. The controls are improved, more fluent, and the pirate gear significantly expands Shantae's toolset while never feeling tedious nor neglected as with the past game's transformation spells.

There's a challenge present in [i]The Pirate's Curse[/i] unseen prior -- a fair one with just the right amount of annoyance factor. The stages are wonderfully varied, but never too long; any larger would be to the detriment.

Then there's the story. For the first time in the series, I'm interested in Shantae and her friends. Where they're headed? I genuinely curious to see.

A masterpiece of throwback platforming; that's what [i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is.

31349932.review:
*Full disclosure* - I own this game on Nintendo 3DS and purchased a Steam key for this game through Humble for a buck. Keep that in mind while you read this review.

If you like Metroidvania-type games, you should definitely play Shantae and the Pirate's Curse (henceforth PC). While it doesn't have the slick HD graphics of Shantae: 1/2 Genie Hero, it has far more exploration and item hunting that HGH does. If go into PC understanding that this is a port of a 240p game from severely underpowered handheld hardware, you'll be just fine. Wayforward has redrawn the portrait art and menues as those would have looked horrid on any modern PC monitor.

Graphically, PC, like all Shantae games is a colorfull 3D side-scroller with lots of cute girl characters and art. Look for screen shots to get a better idea, but don't go in expecting DOAX or Senran Kagura.

Anyway, rather than a tradition Metroidvania structure where all areas are interconnected, this game has one "hub" island and another 4 (5?) islands which you travel to via a scrolling menu. I would have prefered interconnected worlds, but the menu makes sense with the game's ship/pirate theme.

Most Shantae games see the main character using her genie powers to transform into various animals which grant powers such as block crushing, wall climbing, swimming, and the like. In this game, Shantae instead gets her powere from Pirate Gear like a hat that lets you float/fly, a pistol that allows, long distance hits, etc.  Like most fans of the series, I feel like the Pirate Gear results in better, more seamless gameplay than Shante's genie transformations.

The game has a very fair difficulty. You may die here and there, but you should learn from you mistakes and be able to movbe on quickly. The exception is one sequence near the end of the game. I won't well you what it is, but you will know it when you get there.  

This isn't a long game. Most players should be able to finish in 10 hours or less at 100%.

If you like colorful, mid-difficulty exploration games with cute girls and light story, PC is probably for you. if you're looking for a Dark Souls-level challenge, a 100+ hour game, deep story, or are triggered by cute, somtimes scantily-clad anime-style girls, you might be best served to look elsewhere for you gaming needs. 

Highly recommended.

31249119.review:
This is a fun platformer game. 
It feels like playing an updated version of the old Aladdin game that was on the Sega Genesis.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
You start in a town where you can save your game, buy items, and talk to people.
Then you choose which level you want to play.
Only one level is available initially, but more levels are unlocked as you progress.
Each level has a special item that gives your character new abilities.
The new abilities allow your character to reach places that were inaccessible before.
The game is pretty linear overall, but you will backtrack after you get new abilities to obtain powerups that were previously beyond your reach.

The game is not difficult in general but there are parts that can be challenging and frustrating.
Most of the bosses are of moderate difficulty but one or two of them are hard.

[b]Other[/b]
The characters in the game are likable and the dialogue is fun and light-hearted.
It seems like the story is a continuation of some previous games, but I'm not familiar with this saga.
The graphics and animation are good, though some of the animations are rather strange.
The character portraits are done well.
The different plot-lines you encounter in the levels are often funny but the storyline is pretty simple and straight-forward.

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
Overall, it definitely a fun game that is worth checking out.

31172756.review:
I must say I'm a fan of the Shantae games after my brief encounter with Risky's Revenge. And by brief I mean that that game was too short. Shantae, her hair and endearing cast of characters come at you strong in this game making for a fun platforming adventure.  This time you have a new unseen but ever present foe in the Pirate King, whose presence is felt in the different locations you travel to and as a big bad baddie after revealing himself.

I would say this game features platforming at it's best with every stage being slightly more challenging than the last. Even though you don't sport magical transforming genie powers in this game you still have a number of accessories that help you along the way in the guise of Risky Boots' old pirate gear. Another big change being she's now part of your quest traveling entourage shipping you off to each new destination in Sequin Land.

The graphics, while very reminiscent of the previous game have an updated look and feel making it familiar yet fresh. The in game UI has improved so that it's less cluttered with usable items separated from the questing ones. Some of Shantae's side moves, like her backdash and recovery jump are added as purchased moves but overall felt less necessary than before. The one roundhouse kick move I all but forgot about most of the time as your primary weapons and accessories are more than adequate for dispatching foes.

The platforming though is where this game shines. There's some areas near the end where you'll have to think a lot about how you're going to traverse the area, especially the last stage on your way to defeat the Pirate King. Level design was challenging without being punishing. Bosses had patterns that were easy to figure out but also utilized any new item you picked up in the dungeons well. I would say this game was maybe twice as long as Risky's Revenge and definitely worth your time if you're into Metroidvania type games even if you're not it's just a lot of fun playing.

30936503.review:
The music works so well in this game I have to call it out first. It's fun and upbeat and exotic, and sets the tone, pace, and rhythm of the entire game.

The platforming is great. It flies by quickly, matching the beat of the background music. Not quite as challenging as other platformers out there, but there are plenty of very satisfying moments, especially when discovering upgrades. The final stage does introduce a decent amount of challenge.

Varied and satisfying boss battles. Still not too difficult compared to other games. The Steam achievements surrounding boss battles sound insanely difficult, for anyone seeking more.

Likable characters and fan service abound. The dialog feels fresh, jokes not overdone.

The length of the game is just right. 8-10 hours for experienced gamers. Again, it flew by, and I was left wanting more, yet satisfied with the experience- if that makes sense.

Downsides:

- The beginning of the game (first 30-60 minutes) feels easy and boring. It picks up after that.
- A couple of the collectibles are obscure if you don't clear a room the way the developers intended. This makes backtracking/exploration tedious in a couple areas. The majority of collectibles make sense though.

Overall a fantastic and highly satisfying game. Pick it up!

30863987.review:
I got this game in a humble bundle and had seen a couple of videos of the game previously. I was interested in the game before I tried it out and the game exceeded my expectations. On the surface, it's a cutesy anime-inspired looking game with more fan service than I would have liked and with a lot of humor and fourth-wall breaking. It may seem like a game to not take seriously, but the gameplay is Metroidvania-esque with hard platforming, items, puzzles, hidden objects, secrets, difficult but interesting bosses, etc. It holds up with hard platforming games like that on the NES or SNES, but it's also modern. The controls are fluent and very responsive and movement it sastisfying. Attacks are mostly hair-whipping but you can unlock a powerful kick and when you get items like the cannon, the scimitar, and the boots then you can use them as weapons as well and even do so combos. You go to different islands which each have a boss where you get an item after. Each island gets increasingly difficult. Spiderweb Island is kinda annoying because of the zombies that come out of the ground. The ghosts are BS because they will randomly appear within damage distance to you and you won't see them coming, often times knocking you back off of platforms, and they can be hard to line up hits against. Mudbog Island is the most annoying for me because every other steps an enemy suddenly appears when you're close enough to get damge from them. These weird tar globs pop up from the ground, strange gloop monsters poke from the ceiling so when you try to jump over the tar globs, the ceiling gloop guys slap your face. Then the slime ghouls that bounce around are just stupidly irritating. It's not a hard level, just one where you get sick of it quick. Some bosses feel almost impossible until you figure out what you need to do and what item you need to use. The Squid Baron gave me a real run for my patience and I died many times until I figured out how to weaken him and how to dodge his patterns. The dragon boss was weird because I wasn't sure if I was doing anything right or if I was hitting him and suddenly I won, but I'm probably alone on that one.
There are places that seem excessive to me, and perhaps not for the better. In Spider Web Island, you have to carry someone through a forest and you have to dodge enemies and obstacles because you can't attack and one hit kills you. And this part feels like it goes on forever. Everytime you think that was the last section and you relax your muscles, wiping the sweat from your brow, there's more. Also, the final level going through the palace was impossibly hard and incredibly tedious, adding so much more stages than I feel they should have and not enough checkpoints. I would get to a part in a stage where I thought there was a checkpoint, then I make a small mistake and I'm all the way at the beginning, forced to face the last deathly impossible challenge. I actually had to do a jump shortcut to skip the palace in order to save my sanity (this is the video that helped me https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X2oO17qvy34&t=13s ) Maybe you'll have a lot more patience than me. And the final boss took a longer time than I expected too. Everytime I thought I was close, I was far from it, and then he'd change things up and you'd have to defeat this stage of him. But once that final cutscene started, my heart soared to the heavens and I screamed in passion, "YESSSSS!!!!" It felt good. The rewards were worth the challenges. It looks like a game that will be average, but instead is tough and looks at your outstretched hand and says "I ain't taking your hand you little baby." It kicks your butt, it gives you false security, it then let's you know just how bad you are. It's a good game, and even though it can be a little cryptic at times, it's worth playing.

This game is WAYYYYY too much fun.  As a fan of mostly shooters, it was fun to go to another gametype, and [b] oh boi did I choose a great game [/b]. 

So, I guess I need to break it down like this then. 

STORY: I really do like the flow of this story, it starts you off from what I belive is Risky's Revenge. However, the story is so flowing that not only do you not need to play the other games, but you'll feel like you have played the other games even though you didn't. [i] It actually feels like an adventure, go figure[/i] xD 9.5/10

GAMEPLAY: I can't really talk about this game play too much without spoiling a 10 year old game (it's totally not 10 years old lol). Starting out, it feels like a typical platformer with a standard melee, fair stuff. But [i] ohhhhhhhhhhh boi[/i]. When you get dem "upgrades", boi oh boi, that's when this game gets REAL GOOD. JESUS. Not only does it get more fun with "upgrades", it does get challenging as you progress. 10/10

MUSIC: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUoYI0cXIUw] Bruh,[/url] it is the best game music I've heard in a while. It can be funky as fuckle when you are in an easy going part, and then [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vGW1aF5cAyg&index=3&list=RDhImbUtLJT04] ominous and spooky [/url] when need be. It is a FANTASTIC soundtrack and I want to kiss Jake Kaufman for making doing so well (... well maybe not kiss, but you get the point; I'm very appreciative of his work).  15/10 I don't give a fuck.

Minor Gripes: Some things are a little cryptic while other times they stright up tell you what to do with an item. Items can be hidden in the weirdest of places (I'm lookin' at you, Scuttle Bat #20. :V) Really, my only complaint.

Overall: If you can get this in a humble bundle or if you get this- JUST GET THIS. PLEASE. IT HAS FULL XBOX CONTROLLER  SUPPORT AND IS JUST A GREAT GAME. PLEASE. 

This game has changed my outlook on life. That's how good it was. I [i]was [/i] suicidal. Now, I'm going to make a life of myself just because I played a game.

30135045.review:
Nos encontramos ante la tercera entrega de Shantae cuyo personaje debutó en 2002 en la consola portátil de Nintendo la Game Boy Color y que actualmente está disponible para el Nintendo 3DS (exclusivamente). Una vez más es un juego de plataformas en 2D (side-scrolling) pero que ahora agrega mecánicas de los juegos de Metroid (Metroidvania/Igavania) por lo que es mucho más extenso que Risky's Revenge. A pesar de eso sigue siendo un poco corto y algo fácil porque el juego apenas ofrece reto, ya que los niveles a pesar de estar bien diseñados son pequeños y no hay mucho que explorar. Los acertijos de los laberintos son muy fáciles (por no decir muy obvios) y los jefes de nivel tampoco son la excepción, no obstante, sigue siendo muy divertido y satisfactorio.

Gráficamente me decepciona porque si lo comparamos con la versión de 3DS (original) los sprites y escenarios están demasiado pixelados y no tiene soporte de filtrados como bilinear o trilinear como mínimo y es que algunos gráficos se distorsionan bastante haciendo que la versión de 3DS sea muy superior visualmente.

La música es excelente pues es de Jake Kaufman quien ha trabajado anteriormente en juegos como Shovel Knight, Mighty Switch Force y la serie de Shantae propiamente. El diseño de personajes es muy original y esta vez fue el equipo de Inti Creates (Mega Man Zero y Azure Striker Gunvolt) el que se encargó del arte.

En el apartado técnico no me puedo quejar de nada porque el juego no tiene bugs o al menos yo no tuve dificultades, soporta mando para aquellas personas que no están acostumbradas al teclado (yo jugué con los dos) y no parece tener problemas de rendimiento o compatibilidad.

En conclusión Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un juego muy entretenido pero que es un poco corto y algo fácil, no obstante, tiene a su favor una historia muy divertida, personajes carismáticos, buena música y en general un buen diseño.

Calificación:

4 de 5

答案是否定的，并不是说一款游戏没有动作就不能有趣
桑塔是由多个独立的动作组合而成，每个动作都是在其他的动作游戏中的常见招式

30044805.review:
Antes que nada, no he jugado los otros Shantae y, en mi opinión, esa es prueba suficiente para demostrar que el juego por sí solo es bueno, dejando de lado la-que-sea la historia que quiera contar.

A primeras el juego no llama la atención, es un plataformas de más pensamos... O cuán insensato fui.

Shantae tiene unas mecánicas muy sólidas adaptadas correctamente a los niveles y según qué partes del nivel, si desbloqueas un nueva mecánica lo más seguro es que puedas usarla otra vez en alguno de los mapas ya visitados, favoreciendo y recompensando la exploración.
Los enemigos, aunque muy diferenciados en diseño (apartado donde pongo un sobresaliente), no se diferencian entre sí, pues la mayoría atacan cerca, con arrojadizas (rectas o en curva) o simplemente caminan para hacer daño.
La banda sonora es muy destacable, perfectamente adaptada al momento y la jugabilidad: Rápida, rítmica y pegadiza.

El diseño ¡oh el diseño! Fabuloso PixelArt llevado a cabo con un cuidado increíble, no solo en los sprites estáticos o fondos del mundo, sino también en las animaciones.

Juego muy recomendado, al menos como obligado durante las rebajas.

29873955.review:
跟前作 Shantae: Risky's Revenge 相比進步了很多
劇情上的時間點延續前作，人物雖會提及過去事但不會多提，但在了解前因後果的情況下會更有趣


本作的 Shantae 因為劇情關係無法變身，但還是有她那頭強韌的頭髮XD
也因為與系列作勁敵 Risky Boots 合作，可以使用各種海盜裝備，收集齊全就會變身成海盜！ (最好)
前作原本預設就有的向後滑步不知怎麼改成要從商店購買，但既有靴子，何用滑步呢


本以為有個超強大魔頭劇情應該會比前作嚴肅，沒想到比前作還歡樂爆笑
湖邊玩水、囚禁公主、前頭目的大反擊，講太明白就不有趣了，有興趣的玩家請自行體會
還有選擇島嶼畫面根本不像要拯救世界，反而是像要跟 Risky Boots 約會 (褒意)


前作主角好友戲分過少的問題在本作也有改善，而且搶戲程度不輸Shantae，不再是劇情提醒用NPC
Bolo 是個迷糊鬼，Sky 是心靈與物質上都很支持你的好姐妹，Rottytops 是個愛捉弄人的小惡魔
讓我大感意外的是城鎮裡還有人提到前作的多話廚師，製作組該不會很愛這個角色吧......


前作因劇情關係在相同兩地往返移動的乏味過程，在本作也能感受到製作組試圖改善
譬如在某島上設有快速直達列車，也有能夠直接回到接駁點的道具可以使用，移動起來方便不少
破關後以海盜模式重新體驗，更能感受到地圖是有用心設計過的，好多捷徑可以抄，第一輪玩得好苦XD


另外 Shantae 原地不動的時候會撥頭髮，血量過低時會露出疲態，
使用油燈扭來扭去的樣子特別有魅力，像素圖刻得這樣生動，能感受到美術的愛


真要說缺點，應該是觸碰到尖刺即失敗重來的關卡後期會比較多
尤其是後期爬向天空或爬塔，可能會讓不擅長的玩家好不容易前進一點之後又立刻崩潰


方便入戲用的前作大劇透，觀看前請三思：
[spoiler]1. 市長因情況不得已把小鎮賣給 Ammo Baron，本作一開始就是債主來取貨
2. Rottytops 三兄妹在最後關頭與 Risky Boots 合作，導致 Risky Boots 的計劃得逞
3. Risky Boots 用魔法油燈吸走了 Shantae 的魔力，並用那股魔力來對付 Shantae
4. Shantae 最終破壞了由自己的魔力形成的實體，卻也沒了魔力，變成了普通人[/spoiler] 


最後附上破關後四張圖片的獲得條件：
[spoiler]1. 不限條件純通關
2. 完成度100%，不限時間通關
3. 不限完成度，2小時內通關
4. 完成度100%，並在3小時內通關
（收集到 20個 Dark Magic、32個 Heart Squid，不強制熔成愛心上限、商店裡能強化 Shantae 的物品要全買，若以上都有做到，最終頭目戰前存檔進度會顯示為97%）[/spoiler]

29852409.review:
This game has a lot of stuff going for it: Cute artstyle, descent platforming, fun gameplay overall. But the overwhelmingly positive score is misleading. 

The game is far from perfect.

The game possessed a number of frustrating bits/design flaws, that really spoiled the engagement.

1) I will start of with the worst: In order to get the true ending (which you definitely should strive for) you need to find all cacklebats (type of secret). Problem is, sometimes they are so well hidden that is seems almost impossible to find them without luck. For example, in one area you have to hit a wall while charging, and the cacklebat drops from the sky. There are no markings on the wall whatsoever and it you can't hear or see the cacklebat. How am I suppose to know that will happen?

2) Enemies appear when they are off screen for 2 seconds. Why? Why can't they appear again once I leave the area? Some enemies work that way, but others don't for some reason.

3) Enemies appearing at the same spot you're at. You're just trying to jump from one branch to the other and a ghost appears right in front of you, giving you no time to react. This isn't a huge problem, but it's just unnecessary design.

4) They don't always introduce new mechanics in the best way (apart from gear). There are some platforms that you can shoot and they will do something. Uhm, since when does this happen? There is nothing indicating that something should happen if you hit them.

5) Backtracking. Remember the small rock in the corner that prevented you from going in that direction? Well now that you have the gear, 2 hours later, you can and must go there. You don't remember because you took a break for a day? Tough luck. Some characters do point you to the island you need to go, but this problem could've been tackled much better.

6) Bog island first 3 screens :P

The positives outweigh the negatives, and some type of frustration is good to have if it makes you get good at the game. But these are mainly design flaws that take away from the experience which makes it a good platformer, but not very very good one.

그래도 요즘 해본 게임들 중 가장 재미있었다.

This was my introduction to the Shantae series, and I'm loving it so far.

It's a high quality metroidvania with platforming and tight controls to fit.

Featuring a pixeled art style, with impresive animations.  Many of the characters also have full art pop outs that come up when you talk to them.

I've been playing with a controller, which is supported natively.  I do wish you could change the controller config in the game though.

The writing and story is above average for a game like this.  It's entertaining enough to not be pointless.  It also seems to have callbacks to previous Shantae games for fans of the series.

There's also a fair amount of replayability, if you care about achievements.


Pros
*Great environment to explore
*Fantastic animations
*Enemy diversity
*Native controller support
*Keyboard controls make sense and can be changed


Cons
*Some of the collectables seem too tough to get to, but they're not required to beat the game
*No option to change controller config


9.5/10
