29746302.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a medium-length (ten hours or so) action-focussed 2D platformer with discrete levels gated by unlockable abilities. Whether it's strictly Metroidvania is arguable; I see it more as part of a tradition of Genesis, SNES and GBA side-scrolling platformers like Aladdin or Duck Tales. It has bright, colourful pixel animations, with hand drawn art which highly sexualises womens' bodies for dialogue scenes. The soundtrack is Jake Kaufman digital studio work. The main game is easy for platformer players, apart from the last level, but there are lots of extremely difficult achievements.

The gameplay is polished. By time spent, there is as much combat as platforming. There are dozens of enemy types, and traveling to your destination normally means killing three or four of them over and over while moving from left to right. The odd fetch quest and minigame are thrown in too, including one very memorable sequence in which you carry a manipulative undead woman through screens of one-hit-KO hazards. The bosses are huge, and generally involve a simple puzzle, which reveals a small hitbox. Defeating them without being hit (except for the first one) is phenomenally difficult. I found the game unchallenging, but fun. Risky's affects give Shantae several abilities which meaningfully empower the player's movement through physical space, so you start to feel superhuman by the end. The final level is bereft of enemies, and doubles down on tight platforming. I began playing games on the SNES in the early 1990s, and this was my bread and butter. I loved the last bit of this game. I just wish it had gone on a little longer.

The plot is a MacGuffin. Shantae teams up with her old nemesis, the malevolent purple pirate, Risky Boots. Her ability upgrades are not genie powers, but Risky's piratical affects, which have been stolen and hidden around a bizarre archipelago. It has genuinely sweet moments, but it's mostly a network of gags. Games in this genre are frequently weighed down by mountains of stultifying lore, so it's a relief that Shantae gives you the bare minimum and lets you play. Worldbuilding and atmosphere are instead provided by the music, gorgeous art assets, and pleasing animation.

The music is full of bangers. I don't think there are any bad tracks. For a platformer, you mostly want upbeat, high-tempo music to keep you motivated and give you momentum, so the songs are fitting. I have found myself humming them while driving or working.

This game was mostly made by men, and it mostly stars half-naked women with body types which straight men usually find appealing. Men in this game are caricatures, and their extremely diverse bodies are not sexualised (with the possible exception of a cyclops, whose undress is played for laughs, and who receives no sexual attention). A couple of animations (and the entire spritesheet of Risky Boots) aside, the sexualisation exists mostly in the art which accompanies dialogue scenes. I found that I was never entirely comfortable with this part of the game. For what it's worth, the strongest suggestion of sexual interest or romance is between Shantae and another female character, and it is written very innocently.

I also don't feel great about the co-option of Arabic folk religious tradition in the Western trope of the 'genie', although that battle was probably lost shortly before my birth, with the publication of the Arabian Nights in 1706. Thankfully, the trope is not very intrusive here, although Shantae's hometown resembles a pop cultural imagining of Arabia, circa 1200. I'm white, and not best placed to say how harmful this depiction is.

I had fun running around in this world, and I intend to pick up the next instalment.

Debo admitir que cuando obtuve este juego, aunque me llamó la atención, no esperaba gran cosa de él más allá de pasar el rato y echarle no más de una horita; no obstante, grata fue mi sorpresa cuando al empezar la partida no sólo me encontré con un Soundtrack muy bueno y personajes carismáticos, sino además una jugabilidad más que sobresaliente y un nivel de dificultad adecuado, algo que hace rato no veía en un juego de plataformas y lo cual hizo que no descansara hasta finalmente terminarlo (aunque no aún al 100% ni con el ‘final verdadero’).

 

La historia, sin ser una maravilla, atrapa lo suficiente como para que te intereses en avanzar y ver lo que sucede; los enemigos se sienten variados y acordes a cada isla que tienes que atravesar, los jefes finales son interesantes (unos más sencillos que otros), los gráficos pixelados aportan un interesante aire retro y sobre todo, esos hermosos sprites de las muchachas súper bonitas que anhelas por ver en full detalle durante las escenas de diálogos son excepcionalmente geniales.


No sobra decir que a pesar que Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un videojuego bastante divertido, peca en que es corto pues se puede pasar en 7-9 horas dependiendo de qué tanto explores cada mapa y, en mi opinión, no ofrece muchos incentivos para rejugarlo (aunque ofrece un nuevo modo '+' para iniciar el juego con todas las armas y artilugios desde el principio).



Sin lugar a dudas un excelente juego, muy recomendado para los amantes de las nenas monas y de los juegos de plataformas.

I thought Shantae Risky's Revenge was a very good game, this one made me want to speed run every game.

A Metroid + Megaman Fusion, a very fun platformer, it has adventure, action, exploring, lovable characters and a very funny story. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is the sequel to Shantae Risky's Revenge and the third game to the series (first game not avaliable). 4th Game is Shantae Half Genie Hero which is also on steam and the sequel to this one as far as I know.

I enjoyed a lot my first playthrough, it had some exploring to do and was well worth it. I never felt there was too much back tracking just enough only to keep you playing. Some of the collectibles required a lot of try but none were impossible, maybe a couple gave me a headache.

The game + brings a ton of replayability, (No spoilers) since the game let's you start a new game with every ability it turned my 10+ hour first playthourgh in to a 2 ~ 3 hours of speed running which I enjoyed a lot. 

Getting all the achievements were a blast and a challenge, unlike the previous game only like a third are none missable, and the "hard ones" are speed running the game with any or 100% + killing all the bosses without taking damage, it made me play another 3 times to get everything and it never bored me down.

The game has it's difficulty and you will feel your progress throughout the playthrough.

I can't recommend this and last game enough, a no brainer if it's on a 50% sale (I got it this way).

If you liked the previous installment of the Shantae series you're gonna love this one. The changes that have been made to the gameplay mechanics are perfectly fitting, since Shantae lost her genie powers at the end of the previous chapter, but they keep intact the fun and the challenge of the previous games. The story is a lot better than Risky's Revenge, I loved seeing Shantae and Risky work together to defeat the Pirate Master and I think that the overall quality of the characterization has improved a lot. I also loved the new art style used for the character design, Risky in particular has been splendidly redesigned.

The only complaint I honestly have about this title is the addition of the "no damage" achievements for the boss battles. Most of them are easy, but some are just insane. I'm a completist, I like to unlock everything in the games I play and frankly I always thought that this kind of challenge is just not fun. The speed runs were already difficult enough, I didn't feel the need for more pointless tasks. That aside, this is a lovely game and I recommend it to everyone.

29579642.review:
[h1] Shantae's Greatest Adventure [/h1]

[i] Note: Purchased and played on New 3DS XL [/i]

[b] Shantae and the Pirate's Curse [/b] is Shantae's best adventure.  [b] Half Genie hero (HGH) [/b] is fun, but it can't reach the heights of greatness that [b] Pirate's Curse [/b] did.
This is probably the last really great Shantae game, wrapping up the story of the first three games perfectly.  

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
-The pirate moves fit perfectly into gameplay in a way that the transformation moves never could (and still don't in HGH).  The move away from the Metroid/Vania style I was weary of at first, but in this case it just makes the game all that more enjoyable.  Where Risky's Revenge saw Shantae traveling back and forth over only a small handful of areas, Pirate's Curse is structured more like a level based game, with mini worlds to explore.  The gameplay and flow is sooo much better for it.  Unfortunately they took this approach way too far in HGH and we were left with a linear level based game ALA DuckTales remastered.  Pirates curse was the perfect mix of both styles.  Pure platforming bliss.
[b] Risky's Boots / 10 [/b]

[h1] VISUALS [/h1]
-Just absolutely beautiful and pitch perfect. Gorgeous hand drawn/painted backdrops with plenty of animated elements immerse you in the locals of Sequen Land and beyond. Bright and eye popping pixel art in the foreground is used for characters.  The sprites are pixle perfect and the animations are fantastic, best in series by far.  We can't forget the beautiful character portraits shown during speech, drawn by the team at Inti Creates this time.  They are teh best they have ever been, and likely ever will be now that HGH has changed the art style so drastically.
[b] Rotty's tank topp / 10 [/b]

[h1] MUSIC [/h1]
-The best it's ever been in the series, still infused with those chip sounds that got lost in HGH.  Remixes of old favorites as well as new additions make the soundtrack really hit the spot. You'll be belly dancing along the entire adventure!
[b] Bolo's Bandana / 10 [/b]

[h1] Story [/h1]
- Just perfect.  If you've played the first two games you won't be disappointed.  It has just the right amount of callbacks to make long time Shantae fans grab hold of it right from the get go.  It really is the most well crafted story of all 4 shantae games.  The characters are used to their full potential and you really get attached to them like you never have before even in Risky's Revenge.  
-I just can't praise the story enough, it's the best part of the whole package. Especially when you consider the fact that Wayforward elected to alienate long time fans with HGH by doing a soft reboot to try and draw in new fans.  It's really nice to see a proper Shantae story to wrap up the original trilogy.  While HGH does still fit into the chronology as the fourth game, it pales in comparison to Pirate's Curse in this regard.
[b] Sky's Cowlick/ 10 [/b]

[h1] TLDR / Overall [/h1]
Pirates Curse is the greatest Shantae game of all time, and it looks to stay that way if the games progress in the direction HGH is taking them.  One last fantastic adventure with Shantae and friends.  If you're even a little bit of a fan of the series, you MUST play this game.
[b] Shantae's belly / 10 [/b]

29488685.review:
[b]MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD[/b]
[b]Note: I try to speak about the shiet nobody else talks about, and go more in detail from a completionist point of view.[/b]

[h1]Concept[/h1]
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is the continuation of "Risky's Revenge" where our half genie, all girl and all walking rule 34 bait hero, lost her powers. This time you'll be pairing up with Risky on your quest to defeat a common enemy, this is where the fun starts. Unlike every other Shantae title that revolves around her dances to get around, this one you'll be using [spoiler]Risky's pirate gear,[/spoiler] earned as the story progresses. Each piece of gear has its use and since they act more as moves you'll never go without using one; but more importantly they allow you to speedrun the living hell out of the game which is really fun if you are into that.

[h1]Playthrough[/h1]
The playthrough is about 7-8 hours if you go in blind and take your time to do everything. The story is enjoyable, the dialogue is funny and clever as ever, the levels have awesome art direction and simple yet fun layouts, and the drawn sprites really pop out making it a rather enjoyable playthrough. The game sadly lacks on the boss department, bosses aren't really challenging and I can't say I had fun with them, I just felt neutral.

[h1]Completion[/h1]
The 100% in game is rather easy, since it's a metroidvania type of game you'll do some back and forth but nothing too extreme. The game has two collectibles: Squid Hearts, that are used to improve your health, and the Cacklebats, [spoiler]which are needed to get the true ending of the game.[/spoiler] Thankfully this doesn't feel like a chore and for me it happened naturally, since I always search every quarner of the levels as I play this type of game. I've seen a handful of people crying about the last level and the boss, but it isn't all that challenging (more about him on Achievements). After you finish the game once you'll unlock Pirate Mode, which allows you to play with all the gear from the beginning, and this is where speedrunning makes an appearance...

[h1]Steam Achievements[/h1]
[b]Summary: Speed and Precision[/b]
To obtain all of the game's achievements it's where I believe the biggest portion of fun actually exists, they provide some challenge to a rather easy game so for me it's a welcoming gift. If you don't like speedruns this isn't the completion you should be hunting down. One of the Achievements is to finish the game with any percentage in less than two hours and the other one finish the game 100% in three hours. A lot of people struggle with these, but they are doable if you use a Youtube speedrun as a guide. Personally I achieved the 100% in 1:18 of in game time, but it actually took me about 5 hours. 
The other challenging ones will have you defeating each boss without getting hit, something rather simple to do, only the final boss can be of trouble. Personally I had issues with the final boss due to not being able to dodge his [spoiler]cannonball[/spoiler] attack, but after many failed attempts I took my time to see their pattern and I found a way to easily dodge them. Since that was the only challenge in that fight, it quickly became easy to achieve. The only other two achievements that may provide a headache for some is to clear the [spoiler]"Run Run Rottypops"[/spoiler] portion in [spoiler]Spiderweb Island[/spoiler] without getting hit, that one is just a matter of patience. And the other one is to finish the game with all the Heart Squids but without using them, so basically finish the game with your starter health, if you do this in Pirate Mode it should be "easy". All of the other achievements will come naturally and/or are simple to get but missable like "Fool me once...".

[h1]Steam Badge[/h1]
Having leveled it up to max I can safely say the Steam Badge for this game, it's not worth getting, the emojis you'll get are "meh" (if you get any, all I got where 4 Shantae Smile and 1 Shantae Relax) and the same goes for the Backgrounds. You can go to my profile where I'm using the rarest one, if you like it and want a shot at it then sure have a go at the badge.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Shantae and The Pirates Curse was a fun game that I genuinely had fun playing and completing. While I would recommend [b]anyone[/b] to play it, I wouldn't recommend it to Achievement Whores like myself.

This game gets:
8/10 and my Dark Seal of Approval
5/10 Achievement Whore Score (More means easier)

29482679.review:
[b]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a challenging and fun plateforming game, closer to Castlevania or Metroid than any recent Castlevania or Metroid game in the past few years was.[/b]

I played and completed Half-Genie Hero before The Pirate's Curse and I remember feeling somewhat disappointed by how easy Half-Genie Hero was. When I bought The Pirate's Curse, I expected a similar experience. Boy wasn't I surprised.

Much like Half-Genie Hero and other Shantae games, The Pirate's Curse focuses a lot on a few set of levels which you can re-explore in pure Metroidvania fashion in order to find new hidden collectibles thanks to the new abilities you regularly acquire. Unlike Half-Genie Hero, The Pirate's Curse is a genuinely difficult plateformer that will test, frustrate and reward you all at once.

Some of it is somewhat unfair (off-screen enemies? really guys?) but most of it is a fair assessment of your abilities and how you decide to use them, while further upgrading said abilities will make revisiting levels that previously appeared as challenging much easier and thus much more pleasant.

The music is once again amazing, the humour is ever present and enjoyable, and the visuals are just what you'd expect from what was originally a 3DS eShop title while still remaining pleasing to the eye. The only gripe I have is with how poorly the UI was designed, but once again, this is a 3DS eShop port that had to suffer some sacrifices. 

All in all, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a legit plateformer that will put your patience and skills to the test and feel immensely rewarding when you complete it. [b]9/10[/b]

29474647.review:
I'm a huge fan of Metroidvanias, and Shantae and the Pirate's Curse definitely hits the mark.  It's very reminiscent of Aladdin on the SNES visually, while it plays like Megaman X with a dash of Super Metroid.



The graphics are fun, bright, and gorgeous pixel art that recalls the 16-bit era of gaming which the soundtrack matches perfectly.  Dialogue is witty, story is fun, and the game takes place over many different locales.  The "stage select" is very reminiscent of Megaman which is suiting because the game controls similarly as well.  The changes of scenery are nice and help keep the game fun between zones.  The pacing at which the game gives out new mechanics that allow you to advance is pretty well done for the length of the game as well, and there are a variatey of items that are paired in fun/funny ways with the new abilities.  A great example is that you get the ability to "double jump" from a cannon that you shoot below you.

The boss fights are not too challenging, but make up for it by being fun, patterned bosses, often with multiple phases.  The game has a good 8 hours of play time the first play through if you take your time to explore all the nooks and crannies.  Time can easily extend past that with a game+ mode and speed running.  The game controls very smoothly and in manner that allows you to improve over time.

I only have a few gripes which some may not agree with on account of preference:
-i prefer more exploratory Metroidvanias--this is not that type of game.  while there is a little bit of revisiting old zones, the game is failry straightforward in how it progresses.  i also felt this was a shame because of how many zones there were and how different they were--it would've been nice to spend more time in them.
-the bosses are a tad easy.  i personally don't mind this if the boss fights are engaging (and they are!), but some people might be bothered with this.  the game makes up for this a little bit with multiple achievements being tied to fighting bosses without being hit or in unique ways.
-i felt the characters took up too much room on the screen.  it wasn't terrible, but it could've been a little better as well as the game was built around how much realestate there was available on-screen.  this keeps you from being able to play and react more strategically to your environment.  so while the character sprite wasn't quite Sonic-level of taking up screen space, it wasn't exactly Super Mario World either.
-the dialogue character art is a little too "sexy".  to the point where i could see some parents keeping this game away from their kids.  i get that it's supposed to be anime-ish, but i found it distracting at best and uncomfortable at worst.


Anyway, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is one of the better offerings in the Metroidvania space, and is well worth the money.  Highly recommended.

There are already plenty reviews pointing out pretty much everthing about this game, so I'm gonna keep this one short.

I honestly don't know how a platforming game with some metroidvania-style elements could get any better. It's been some time since I've had that much fun with a game. I liked it even better than Shantae's newest installment, Shantae: Half-Genie hero, even though that one is also a pretty solid platformer and Pirate's Curse doesn't feature it's fancy HD graphics (would be a very nice optional texture pack though... I wish it were possible. ;D)... I felt it just had a little more depth to it, with it's neat dungeons, light-hearted dialogues, excellent platforming mechanics and hillarious take on humor. 29468346.review:
This is the best Shantae game by far (until I beat Half-Hero Genie I can't judge the last entry) and outplays the original Shatae and Risky's Revenge in every single aspect of the game.

The gameplay is faster and it's brilliant: the lack of transformations (while being VERY sad) gives Shantae new equipment that has unique abilities in the whole series. The music is awesome and the Scuttle Town theme is one of my favourite tracks of all videogames.

The backtracking is also very good and light, making the game non-linear and adds a few hours of exploration. The length of the game is correct, pretty much like others platform games. My first run was 8:30h, but Shantae is very replayable, and I'm sure you'll want to do 3-4 runs at least.

The game has a lot of charm, and the characters and the NPCs (and their dialogues) are lovely and hilarious. This is what makes Shantae great and this is why I absolutely LOVE all the Shantae games.

If you like Metroidvania games and want a refreshing experience, you'll enjoy every second of Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.

29456804.review:
不知道是不是对Shantae系列要求太高了，这部依然让我感到失望。游戏整体素质比前作Shantae: Risky's Revenge有所提升，但并没有提升太多，某些方面还出现了倒退的迹象。

-首先，地图还是不够大，不够大！尽管乍看游戏画面很丰富，但由于比例尺较大，很快就会发现，一屏场景所呈现出来的内容是很有限的。有了冲刺技能后，跑图成了分分钟的事，更加凸显了这个问题。以后还是不以“类银河战士恶魔城”要求这个系列了，当成普通的平台动作游戏玩可能好一些。

-其次，前作中最吸引我的——女主变身为动物的能力，尽管与战斗系统结合得不够好，在这一部里，干脆就消失了！Shantae成了一个普通人，以人类的武器和道具进去战斗，不得不说是游戏特色的一大损失。不过变身能力似乎在下一部Shantae: Half-Genie Hero中回归了，这是第三次踏进同一条河流的节奏？

-卖肉。这一点见仁见智吧，我反正看不出来给四位女角色安排一场丁字裤秀除了讨好死宅还有什么必要。

+情节和人物刻画水平有很大进步，Shantae与Risky的互动值得玩味。

+音乐和操作手感维持了优秀的水准。

总评：7.5/10

29453012.review:
Este juego es un metroivania con mucha personalidad y encanto que es divertido la mayor parte del tiempo pero extremadamente frustrante en algunas, sobre todo el ultimo nivel.

Lo bueno:
+Increible soundtrack, honestamente planeo comprarlo, asi de bueno es.
+Animaciones y artstyle buenas, no voy a decir que son lo mejor que he visto jamas, pero cumplen su funcion y en juegos como estos lo que interesa mas que nada es el gameplay.
+El  gameplay y los controles son cumplidores, nada del otro mundo, pero en general es fluido, los controles responden bien y rara vez una muerte es por culpa de ellos.

Lo malo:
-Cuestionable desiciones en el diseño de ciertos niveles, el mapa de la isla de las almas perdidas y el ultimo nivel en especial, el de las almas perdidas porque tiende a sentirse muy "cheap" el posicionamiento de algunos enemigos "ocultos", usualmente estos juegos tienden a darte una pista de peligro, pero aqui esta pista se confunde con el entorno y es realmente dificil saber si hay peligro o no, rompe por completo la fluidez de la experiencia... Y el ultimo nivel es exponencialmente mas dificl que el resto del juego, es como pasar de jugar el primer nivel de super mario uno de los ultimos niveles de super meat boy en menos de 30 segundos, esa curva de dificualtad aparece de la nada. Comprendo que los ultimos niveles deben ponerte a prueba de ahi la satisfaccion de ganar el juego, pero dios, si es dificil el ultimo nivel, probablemente soy solo yo, pero es algo que talvez a alguien mas le pueda afectar a la hora de jugar, por eso lo menciono.

Sobre todo, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un juego decente con sus fallas, lo recomiendo a personas que realmente adoren los metroivanias y no les moleste jugar uno que al inicio parece casual, pero al final termina siendo super meat boy.
Es un 7 de 10 en mi libro, bueno, pero nada extraordinario.

29417932.review: Classico platform vecchio stile, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse mi ha tenuto occupato per una decina di ore o poco più e alla fine mi ha lasciato soddisfatto. Livelli vari e colorati, nemici fantasiosi e una spolverata di backtracking (lieve se si vuol soltanto completare la storia, un po' più corposa se si va a caccia di collezionabili) legato all'acquisizione di nuove capacità da parte della protagonista, ne fanno un gioco che può tranquillamente ricoprire il ruolo di passatempo, senza stressare troppo il cervello e strappando anche qualche sorriso (la trama non è che sia 'sto granchè, però alcune battute dei personaggi mi hanno fatto ridere). L'unica pecca, da giocatore anziano, è la scarsa difficoltà del titolo, che soltanto nelle battute finali mi ha fatto sudare un po' e quindi dopo l'eliminazione dell'ultimo boss non mi ha lasciato quel senso di appagamento tipico dei vecchi 2D. Ad aumentare il livello di sfida, per chi volesse cimentarsi, ci sono però determinati Achievement, che ne prolungheranno la longevità ma obbligheranno comunque a rigiocarci da capo. Si tratta in conclusione di un gioco sfizioso che, dai 3€ in giù, non vi farà pentire dei soldi spesi!

29415780.review:
Heckity heck this is a great game. The controls are awesome and never did I feel like I died for anything other than my own fault. The story is engaging and you dont need to know anything about the Shantae story to enjoy this game. Every island, while not all of them are exactly original, all feel geniunely like their own world and that gives this game an astounding level of immersion and depth within the story. 

The story itself is not incredible but its not boring either, and the gameplay and exploration are so fun that this game would still be a perfect 10 without a story. The story is not a focus of the game but rather a framework, and a believable and engaging framework at that.

The art in this game is top notch. All the characters are ridiculously fun to look at and theyre all designed excellently, even the side characters. The pixellated gameplay artwork is clear and very well done, never is there any confusion in what is being displayed and the enemies are never hard to see. The backgrounds and level design are highly effective in creating a sense of atmosphere that instantly communicate what kind of environment you're exploring.

10/10 game, absolutely would reccomend to anyone willing to give an awesome retro-style metroidvania a try.

29411733.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a lighthearted (but not light difficulty'd) romp as the titular half-genie, jumping around various islands, killing monsters, saving the world. Stuff like that. If you've played a Metroidvania game before you've played Shantae and the Pirate's Curse. Does that mean it's a game you should skip though? Oh no. 

While it is a straightforward game, Shantae is a world full of lively creatures to meet and pummel complete with their own animated pixel art and animation. Really it's a joy for the eyes at all times. Which is good as you'll be running back and forth between the various islands again and again, getting whooped along the way. But this isn't a bad thing, the difficulty is a steady increase, enemy monsters drop gems you can use to upgrade your weaponry and grab items for tough fights, and a rocking soundtrack keeps your blood pumping from one end to the other.

While what Shantae does has been done before, it still stands on its own two legs very well because the elements it does use are polished. There are things to find, places to explore, and you'll be engaged from beginning to end. So if you are looking for a game that takes standard Metroidvania concepts and pushes a little further, that's not Shantae. But Shantae is still a good game and thus is worth a full recommendation. Maybe wait for a sale if you're on the edge, but the game goes for relatively cheap anyways.

La primera mitad del juego es fantástica: plataformeo ligero, personajes super-entrañables con diálogos divertidos, música estupendísima... todo muy disfrutable.

Sin embargo, en la segunda mitad, el juego se vuelve super hardcore, con enemigos que aguantan mucho daño y dan unas bofetadas que flipas, saltos calculados al píxel y una cantidad de backtracking que te va a hacer sacar la guía cada dos por tres, parando el ritmo de juego en seco.

No me importa que un juego sea difícil, pero que pegue un salto tan brusco, y que suba la dificultad más por frustración con la cámara o los controles que por exigir precisión al jugador es algo que me resulta difícil de tolerar. Cuanto más me acerco al final, menos me apetece seguir jugando...

29403077.review:
Overall experience:
Pretty nice music and art, though my favourite thing is probably the characters and the humour. There's quite a decent sense of adventure, and often you have to use intuition to figure out what to do next. Sometimes it's a bit too much to figure out, but using a guide is no problem.
The game might seem very hard at first, but once you get more hearts it's a lot easier! The abilities you get are pretty nice (charge, triple jump w/ bomb dropping, paragliding....).

Initially, the checkpoint system really annoyed me - but later on, it wasn't really a problem. Basically, you talk to some mages who are dotted around to save - so you don't get as much control as, say, in Ori and the Blind Forest (play that game too!)

Pretty recommendable for a couple bucks, if you like this genre of game. Some parts of the game are a bit BS, but they're pretty doable.

Este juego es una carta de amor para los que les gustaban juegos plataformeros con algo de RPG tipo castlevania o megaman de las viejas consolas(PS1, GBA, NDS), las animaciones son perfectas y muy fluídas, el pixelart es un dulce para los ojos(eye candy) digno de apreciar junto a las imagenes vectorizadas de los personajes, la música ambiente va muy a tono con las áreas y la tématica media árabe del juego, el gameplay es bastante sencillo y posee un poco la díficultad de los viejos plataformeros donde en algunas ocasiones te quedas pegado sin saber donde ir por que no te lo dicen o te dan una vaga pista, debes explorar y averiguar ciertas cosas por ti mismo/a pero que ciertamente se te es recompensado.

Todos los objetos importantes que te ayudan a mejorar tu movilidad para desbloquear nuevas áreas se sienten útiles, ninguno de ellos se sienten como relleno o ínutil. La única habilidad que encontré poco útil fue la tecnica de la patada que a pesar de que pega 10 es muy poco y es lento en comparación a la velocidad con la que puedes tirar el ataque básico.

También si sabes íngles, es preferible que lo jueges en ese idioma, ya que la traducción en español en cierto punto se nota que es mala por los errores evidentes(confusión de generos más que otra cosa y la útilización quizá excesiva de modismos de español de españa más que un español de españa neutral) y te pierdes o no entiendes algunas bromas que hacen los personajes.

Lo recomiendo si te gustan los juegos plataformeros.

29353663.review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse to trzecia odsłona mniej znanej serii z konsol przenośnych Nintendo. Mamy tutaj do czynienia z klasyczną platformówką z tzw. gatunku metroidvania. Gra jest stosunkowo prosta, porównując ją do innych platformówek tego typu. Całe szczęście nie wpływa to na przyjemność płynącą z rozgrywki. Tutaj nie tyle walka jest ważna, co eksplorowanie otwartych poziomów, zbieranie różnych ulepszeń itp. Trudność można sobie podnieść odblokowując wszystkie osiągnięcia Steam, które wymagają od gracza solidnych umiejętność (choć nadal stosunkowo łatwe). Shantae and the Pirate's Curse to gra bardzo ładna. Pixelartowa grafika wygląda dobrze na większych ekranach, a muzyka, która towarzyszy nam w czasie zabawy wpada w ucho. Jednak najważniejsze jest to, że Shantae and the Pirate's Curse wciąga. Jest tutaj ukryty ten czar platformówek 2D, choć gra nie jest powiewem świeżości, czuć wtórność. Jeśli chodzi o wady, to taka największa warta wymienienia to wygląd postaci płci żeńskiej podczas prowadzenia dialogów. Jeśli miałbym dodać tag na Steam do tego produktu, to pierwsze co przyszłoby mi to głowy to... cycki, wszędzie cycki :D No kompletnie nie rozumiem, czemu autorzy mają takie ciśnienie na eksponowanie kobiecych piersi. Totalna przesada. Na początku mocno mnie to irytowało, ale później machnąłem na to ręką. Gra przez to ma oznaczenie PEGI 12 (Violence, Sex) co też chyba średnio pasuje do kolorowej platformówki. 29327867.review:
tldr: not quite good enough to make me want to do any back-tracking like I would in other metroidvania games, and a insane amount of unnecessary dialogue padded into every conversation that makes me want to rip my own head off and throw it across the room every time I have to talk to anyone.

The graphics and design are easily a 9/10 but everything else is around a 6/10 at its very best, including the very simple combat and basic gameplay. It feels like a flash game albeit a very good one. The problem is its reliance on its back-tracking metroidvania style. It doesn't work for me in this game. It's not a bad game by any means, it's just that it has such a basic indie flash game feel that I just want to get through it and not have to put any extra time into back-tracking because it isn't fun for me in this game. It just makes it all feel like one big tedious chore. That and the game has a insane, brain numbing amount of mostly pointless dialogue that feels like it rivals even the amount in the Mass Effect games. It feels like I spend more time pressing the button to get through all the dialogue than actually playing the game. I mean they really went overboard padding conversations with a huge amount of pointless extra dialogue that makes all conversations ten times longer than they need to be.

I'm in the extreme minority though so pick it up and considering it has a large amount of 'overwhelmingly positive' reviews you will most likely enjoy it where I didn't.

29289599.review:
I've never played a game in this series before. Based on the preview images, the sexualization of the characters made me suspicious the game was using that to lure in gamers to compensate for poor quality. And, while there is a lot of sexualization (take that for what you will), this ended up being one of the best platformers I've played in years. Definite must play for anyone that enjoys the classic Metroid and Castlevania games. To start off with the sort-of negatives, there really isn't any character development at all for the most part. By the end, I could hardly remember any of the characters names or anything about them. I found the story also pretty forgettable (at least to someone who's new to the series, like me). The end of the game left me feeling indifferent towards the characters and the world because of that. 

That said, this game managed to keep me hooked all the way until the end despite the above. The art design for the characters, enemies, and world is great and takes me back to my Sega Genesis days as a kid. The characters, while pretty two-dimensional, do remain charming when they do speak. But, the real reason to play this game is for the platforming. And the platforming is really, really good with a controller. The controls are tight and responsive and the game introduces new platforming mechanics at a regular interval that keeps the game fresh and encourages the player to revisit previous levels. You start off feeling like the game is pretty slow. But, by the end, you'll (literally) be flying through the levels at crazy speeds. 

The platforming mechanics in this game are just so much fun I never ended up caring about the neglected story or character development or how much of a BS difficulty spike the last level was (seriously, it's like something out of Super Meat Boy). It took about 10 hours for me to complete the game 100%, but it feels like a game I will want to replay later on and I'm really looking forward to playing Half Genie Hero.

29269795.review:
[h1]My Opinion[/h1]
[i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is an amazing platformer and, in my opinion, the highpoint of the [i]Shantae[/i] series. Dispite missing one of Shantae's main features, her magic, it is replaced with Risky's pirate weapons, which are quite nice and feel natural with Shantae. It was not only fun to play through the first time, but also the second, and so far for the third. The quirky characters, nicely designed dungeons, humorus dialog, and beautiful pixel art all come together for a game that is almost perfect in every way.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Fast and fun gameplay that kept me attached to my computer
+Amusing dialog that kept me laughing throughout the story
+Great storyline that keeps true to the original 2 Shantae games but also forges a new path
+2 Endings that create different feeling within the player
+Challanging bosses
+Heart upgrades are hidden in both plain sight and way off to the side where you wouldnt expect them to be
+Rewards for beating the game under certaint times, getting a certain ending, or beating the game with certaint percent completion
+Had amazing character development throughout the story
+Fun to playthrough multiple times
+Great Boss names

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Terrible Keyboard controlls
-The final Area isn't the most difficult, rather 3 islands before it is
-Rottytops has a few Really Bad puns... like really bad
-Final bosses true form with full heath is easier then a boss close toward the middle, at least in figuring out what to do. Dor killing them the final boss is a tad bit more difficult.

[h1]Final[/h1]
[i]Shantae and the Pirates Curse[/i] is a great game to play. The game has the perfect mixture of evcerything to make it so good and fun to play. There is a reason this is one of my favorite games afterall.

29268147.review:
It's an old school mascot based action platformer, like Sonic, Mario, Kirby, and the like.  It's self aware and quite funny, causing me to laugh out loud at times.  The controls are tight and the art is well done.  

That being said, the game constantly tries to get me to give it a bad review.  There are some absolutely intolerable sections involving one hit kills for no reason, a forced stealth section where you have to start the entire thing over if you're detected, poorly explained unneccesary backtracking, and, oh yeah, if you die the game restarts you at the last save point, even if it was ages ago, there's no autosave or checkpoint system.  It only came out in 2014, it's not like it's from decades ago.  The difficulty curve is nonsense thanks to an extremely generous item system that allows you to fully heal multiple times in combat, as well as double or triple your damage and shield yourself.

However, I'm still going recommend it.  Just know what you're getting into and don't expect the moon.

29262561.review:
Pros: 
-Tight mechanics allow for very precise movements with a decent array of tools and weapons you unlock that increase the complexity of your traversal of new areas. 
-The game will present you with interesting mini-games, like having to run a bunch of levels without getting hit once and stealth levels that change up the way you play, keeping the game from getting stale. 
-The visuals are fantastic and the soundtrack is amazing. The visuals are bright and colorful even in darker areas of the game while the music is fast and bouncy. Together they create a great atmosphere for a great game.
-Fanservice can be good or bad depending on your taste.

Cons: 
-The game is cheap, meaning it will place enemies in places you need to step or land on to move forward, forcing you to take damage. This will set up an environment that, unless you’re super careful, you will jump on a hidden monster which takes a large chunk of health.
-The in game economy is terrible. You need to grind if you want to have both the upgrades and items such as potions. Going for a 100% run I barely made enough money for all the upgrades. 
-Third game in the series. Characters interact and have history with each other. It’s not hard to follow but you are jumping into an ongoing story. 
-Fanservice can be good or bad depending on your taste.

General Thoughts: 
	Shantae is a good game with small flaws. You will be immediately greeted with astounding visuals and sounds which will be followed by tight game play and with all of them working together you will be sucked in, that is until you hit a few of it’s flaws. The game places cheap opponents in positions that will hit you even if you are careful, taking away large chunks of your life. Requiring you to memorize enemy positions in areas if you wanna move between them without taking massive damage. Thankfully, it’s not hard to overcome these issues, but it is frustrating dealing with them in an otherwise good game. The game’s story is good enough for what it presents and the addition of character models will either pull you in or put you off as they involved a good amount of fanservice from the main character and the supporting cast. The game is by no means perfect but it is one of the better 2D platformers with metroidvania elements to come out.

29261238.review: This game and the soundtrack were great!  I have never heard of games categorized as Metroidvania games before today but I understand what it means now.  It's a nice throwback in that area.  The only thing that I didn't like was the lengthy interactions for the purpose of the story line.  Other than that it was pretty damn fun.  The entire game was pretty easy which by contrast caused the final level seem to be virtually impossible.  It was VERY frustrating.  Never-the-less I would wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone of any age who likes Metroid or Castlevania.

29260023.review: Don't be fooled by the 32-bit pixel graphics or if you're offput by the waifubait anime artstyle, this game is a MASSIVE improvement in every conceivable way to Risky's Revenge and a superbly done 2D metroidvania game. It is difficult to put exactly into words why but it addresses almost every problem, from a MUCH better map, to MUCH less confusing maps, to much faster movement which goes SUPER fast once you get the boots, to much more manageable hidden collectibles, to much less boring, droning music; EVERYTHING is better, like geez. However, if you're looking to jump into the Shantae series from this game, it is not exactly the ideal spot to start, since this IS indeed a direct sequel to Risky's Revenge, story-wise and you'll be left scratching your head, and this game does not use the traditional shantae gameplay of using transformation dances, and instead using these pirate equipment you acquire and can even upgrade to a certain extent. This is probably the BEST shantae game overall, but definitely not the place to start for newcomers, even though it's just so good and fun to play.

29239454.review:
I don't know how i never knew about this game. It's a great platformer with a decent story. The aesthetics were great and each level had a different atmosphere. You knew going into the 4th island mod bog was going to be tough just going through the first screen. The animation is awesome everywhere; Even down to the smallest of enemies. The enemies were balanced pretty well, with the exception of the wolves doing 1 1/2 hears of damage. They were annoying, but had relatively low health compared to other enemies in the area. Two of the bosses didn't seem to be balanced very well though. The dragon (dagron) was quite random with it's pattern and sometimes just went way too fast while the other unbalanced boss the ice slug (I'm not looking up the name) was extremely easy and slow.

In my first couple play throughs, i had a tough time finding out what i was supposed to do (i'm not much for trying everything to complete a puzzle), but after that first time it was a breeze the other play throughs. It especially got fun when you unlock pirate mode (new game with all weapons from the start). Dashing through the easy levels and finding shortcuts in the early levels was very fun and i think I'm going to help make a guide for the 100% and any% speed runs.

And lastly the achievements were challenging. 100% speed run, 2 heart challenge, never get hit... All challenging, but doable when you learn the game enough. All in all I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a action platformer.

29210420.review:
Trecho do meu review original no meu site: [url=https://modostealth.wordpress.com/2016/11/14/shantae-and-the-pirates-curse-review/] Modo Stealth Reviews[/url]

Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse” não é o primeiro game da franquia Shantae , mas foi o primeiro que joguei. Conheci por acaso, pesquisando sobre algumas alternativas de games “metroidvania” e me surpreendi com o game.

Os diálogos são muito bem escritos , os personagens possuem personalidade bem definidas e o humor do game é “spot on”. Gargalhei demais em algumas cenas e também gostei muito da arte dos personagens.( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

O Game possui gráficos bem bonitos em pixel art , os sprites possuem muitos frames e são muito bem feitos. 

Algo que curti muito no game , é que a cada fase que você passa (ilhas no game) , você recupera algum objeto de Risky e o utiliza ao seu favor , e durante o gameplay é comum você encontrar baús e “Heart Squids” (4 Heart Squids expandem sua vida máxima em um coração) em locais inalcançáveis , e conforme você progride você pode voltar nesses locais com a habilidade para alcançar os itens.

Esses objetos acabam dando um ritmo interessante no game pois o tempo todo você está aprendendo e usando sua nova habilidade para progredir na fase. E as fases são muito bem projetadas para explorar todas suas habilidades novas e antigas. O tempo todo você precisa usar suas habilidades e isso torna a experiência bem natural. Uma curva de aprendizado muito interessante.

A jogabilidade é muito precisa e responsiva , como todo game de plataforma deve ser [strike](todo game deve ser na verdade…)[/strike]  Não é um game fácil , os inimigos começam a ficar bem desafiadores.

É importante explorar ao máximo todas as fases , mas não se preocupe , na tela de seleção de fases (ilhas) você tem a indicação de quantos “cacklebat” você precisa coletar e quantos Heart squids você coletou.

Na época que escrevi esse review , joguei na plataforma 3ds , porém , tive a oportunidade (via humble bunndle) de adiquirir quase de graça , a versão para steam.  Com a prática e com um controle melhor , tive uma experiência mais agradavel ainda , além de agora conseguir obter achievments. Porém , o game usava a segunda tela do 3DS para o inventario e mapa e isso é um ponto forte da versão do 3DS , porém , essa versão está incrível também.

Minha única queixa com essa versão , é que os gráficos durante os diálogos ficam pixelizados , mesmo em tela cheia ou em modo janela , algo que não me atrapalhou mas esperava mais.

"É um game simples , mas ainda sim é uma experiência bem sólida. Bem humorado , bem animado e muito bem desenhado. Um game que possui uma dificuldade bem ajustada. Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse  é uma “jóia escondida” que merece mais reconhecimento. Super Recomendado!"

29196115.review: i've literally bought this game twice and I'm aiming for a third

29193675.review:
8 heures de jeu et poubelle.

Rien à dire de particulier sinon que ce petit jeu est une purge qui commençait comme un très sympathique et kro meugnon jeu de plate forme très légèrement mâtiné de metroidvania mais qui se termine en sirop de boudin frelaté.

Petit jeu excessivement facile certes, mais qui avait tout pour être une petite aventure agréable de bout en bout. Seulement au milieu du jeu (pile, la troisième ile sur 5) le jeu se transfiorme en bouse ennuyeuse et gonflante pour cause de dev sans inspiration qui tombe dans le cheap et la maniabilité aberrante. L'exemple le plus atterrant de cette pauvreté d'imagination est leur utilisation du dash: depuis la nuit des temps le dash se fait avec une double pression de la croix directionnelle (droite droite pour rusher à droite). Seulement eux ont eu l'idée incroyablement débile (et déjà utilisée sans succès dans d'autres jeux) de faire un dash où tu dois perdre ton temps à courir dans une direction donnée. 

Ça a déjà été fait, ça a toujours été une idée à la con, vouloir la ressortir est inéluctablement une aberration de game design qui dénote complètement du reste du jeu (un peu comme les boss de de Deus Ex Human Revolution avant l'édition director's cut). Et ça donne, entre autres, un combat de boss incroyablement chiant. Pas dur, pas stressant, pas demandeur de skill, seulement c.h.i.a.n.t. et très énervant. 

Ceci concerne la quatrième ile, celle où j'arrête parce que j'ai eu ma dose, mais dans la troisième ile (celle où tout commence à parir en vrille donc), il y'a aussi son petit lot d'idée à la con comme les sables mouvants+un truc qui roule à peine repérable ou le boss pseudo comique qui tente l'autodérision et la mise en abime sur sa propre nullité/placement "parce que faut mettre un boss là" et qui tombe horriblement à plat (pour être poli ... dire que ce perso était très rigolo jusque là, quel gâchis).

Vraiment dommage ... grosse déception, au début du jeu j'étais prêt à choper les autres shantae mais en voyant que wayforward ne sait pas être constant et/ou ne sait pas finir ses jeux je préfère carrément m'abstenir et passer à autre chose. :/

29132045.review: Лучший платформер с элементами метроидвании. теперь Ори и Шантэ для меня лучшее что сделали в этом жанре. Первое это музыка. Обожаю когда в игре отменная музыка. Для меня это так же важно как и наличие отменного геймплэя. Если после прохождения ты добавил себе в плэйлист музыку из игры, значит композитор постарался на славу. Уникальные мелодии с элементами восточных стран. Чуть ли не весь ост слушаю от сюда, это вообще редкость для новых игр. дальше супер очеровательная главная героиня, хорошо прописанные диалоги с хорошим юмором, вот реально к каждому NPC подходишь и читаешь всё, ибо чуть ли не у каждого будет шутейка или что-то забавное. Просто уникальный случай когда ты ничегошеньки не пропускаешь. Пример для всех игр КАК нужно делать диалоги! Дальше. Отличный геймплэй. Чертовски разнообразный и не даст заскучать даже с учётом того что пару раз мы будем возвращатся к старым локациям (метроидвания и все дела). Ну и шикарный визуальный стиль.Великолепный пиксельарт с чертовски живой анимацией всех персонажей и врагов. Люблю когда пиксельарт сделан красиво, со стилем, а не как в Мазэр Раша Блид например. Единственный минус наверно, это хотелось бы чуть чуть посложнее чтобы было. Совсем чуточку почеленджэвее. Как под конец. Там включили такой неплохой хардкор, что аж пальцы потели. Это очень понравилось. Вообщем всем кто любит подобный жанр без промедления брать! Да думаю даже тем кто далёк от него. Идеальный платформер!

29099176.review:
If Risky's Revenge was already really good, this one improves in pretty much every aspect. The gameplay feels smoother and more responsive, great tracks have been added to an already great soundtrack, thought has been given to both the map design and the level design, which have improved significantly. The art work is obviously subjective, but I think it's safe to say it has changed for the better. The pixel art has been stylized, and the drawings for the conversations are now more anime-like, solving the weird faces problem they had in the previous game.
Overall, a great sequel for a great game.

Del mismo modo que el anterior Shantae (Risky´s Revenge) no jugué a otra cosa hasta terminarlo, la verdad es que estos juegos me han enganchado cosa loca y es que la pega que le puse al anterior (Formato de pantalla 4:3) aquí la solventan, así que cero pegas; vas a encontrar todo lo del anterior mejorado, el cambio más importante es la distribución de los niveles ahora son más accesibles ya que se encuentran divididos en islas a las cuales accedes directamente, no es un sólo mapa como es común en los metroidvania, esto puede fastidiar a los puristas del género pero me pareció un cambio más que acertado ya que a veces recorrer todo el mapa para buscar un ítem olvidado puede cansar… aquí accedes directo a la zona dónde hayas dejado algo o quieras explorar las nuevas habilidades para encontrar secretos; tal vez lo único que extrañaré del anterior son las transformaciones de Shantae ya que en éste las habilidades se basan en los objetos que vas adquiriendo ( Adiós a la danza sexy :( ).

29027664.review:
It's a game that is fun #1 for the characters and stories.
While they are certainly pleasant on the eyes, they also have fun personalities and some witty dialogue.
The gaming itself is not quite as tight as Donkey Kong Country (probably the closet equivalent), but it's still fun enough to make you want to play through and see the whole story.
I bought Half-Genie Hero to keep on supporting WayForward & Shantae, because who could possibly dislike her?

29022800.review:
Easily the best game in the series. This is the standard every Shantae game should strive to meet.

PROS:
-Faster, more fluid gameplay than any other Shantae game (though partly due to the lack of transformations, a very traditional part of the series).
-Gorgeous art style. Whoever Wayforward hired for this one did an exceptional job. I even prefer it over the new HD chibi art style in Half Genie Hero, personally. I also prefer pixel graphics generally when it comes to platformers.
-Extremely detailed animations. This is something Wayforward nails perfectly most of the time. When a character turns around for instance, rather than just mirroring the sprite, there might be an animation where they blow their hair over the other eye (heart squid lady). The attention to detail is insane.
-Difficulty curve: Every island/dungeon is a little harder than the previous, with the exception of the frostbite dungeon.
-Challenging and plentiful puzzles. I actually had to look up the solutions to a few of them.
-Story was the better one of the series so far IMO.
-Jake Kaufman does it again with the soundtrack. Absolutely amazing, there are more tracks I like in this soundtrack than HGH.

Cons:
I'd really have to nittpick to find fault with this game. The only thing I can think of right off the bat is this: The lack of transformations means also a lack of upgrades to find, which the game conpensates for by replacing heart containers with heart squids which you have to find multiple of in order to expand your maximum health. There's plenty of stuff out there to find, just very little variety in what you find.

All in all, if you like these sorts of metroidvania open-world platformers, you won't regret Pirates Curse in the slightest. I only regret beating the game 100% because now the adventure is over and I have to hope a future Shantae game can match what Pirate's Curse has achieved.

29009137.review: The best of the three Shantae games on steam at the moment. It may currently be priced the same as the new release, but its more worth the 19.99 than Half Genie Hero. Pinnacle of the series so far!

I do like a challenge, but not some stupid die in the same spot for 30 minutes crap. 

Other than this, this game is fun, and I love the Shantae games.

Rottytops makes up for some things.

28835089.review:
샨테: 리스키의 복수에서는 재밌기는 했으나 추천할만큼 잘 만든 게임은 아니었습니다
근데 샨테와 해적의 저주에서는 전편에서 제가 느꼈던 모든 단점을 싸그리 커버하고 나왔습니다

[h1] 이제는 괜찮은 ui와 인터페이스 [/h1]
: 전작에서는 지도를 보려면 인벤토리를 열어 방향키를 다섯번정도 누르고 확인버튼을 눌러야만 지도를 확인할 수 있었습니다. 하지만 이번 작에서는 버튼 하나만 누르면 바로 지도를 볼 수 있습니다! (이 차이가 얼마나 큰지는 직접 해보셔야 느낍니다)

[h1] 합리적인 지역 디자인 [/h1]
: 이런 류의 게임이 항상 갖고있는 요소인 '재탐험'을 이번 작에서는 잘 살렸습니다. 재탐험이 좋은 요소가 되려면 능력을 얻음으로서 더욱 더 지역을 돌기 편해져야하며, 능력이 없을 때도 저기에 무언가가 있을 것 같다라는 눈치 정도는 채게끔 살짜쿵 보이지만 못먹게 해두거나 정도인데 전작에선 그 모든것이 맵에 이곳저곳 사혼의 조각마냥 뿌려져있어서 따로 메모를 해두거나 그 거지같은 지도를 켜서 생각을 되짚어보지 않는 이상 모든 월드를 한 바퀴를 돌아야만 템을 먹을 수 있었습니다.
 물론 이전 리뷰에서도 써두었지만, 전작은 스토리 진행이나 능력을 얻기위해서도 이 짓을(커피 모으는거라던가) 시키고, 얻고나서도 이 짓을 또 해야지만 숨은 템을 먹을 수 있었어요. 하지만 이번엔 지역이 섬으로 나뉘어서, 각 지역당 못먹은 비밀들이 월드맵에서 음영처리가 되서 나타나기 때문에 수집과 재탐험이 너무나도 편해졌습니다.

[h1] 매끄러운 퍼즐 [/h1]
: 마을의 앤피시들이 앞으로의 진행에 있어서 필요한 요소들을 간접적으로 힌트를 주기 때문에 훨씬 괜찮아졌습니다. 가령, '궁전 밑에 있는 하수구에서 무슨 소리가 들리는 것 같지 않아?' 라던가, 'ㅇㅇㅇ가 필요한데, 그나저나 대체 얘네들은 '궁전'에 가서 도대체 언제 돌아오는거야!?' 같이 진행상황에 따라서 플레이어가 어디로 가게끔 유도하는게 조금 더 프로페셔널 해졌다고 할까요.
중요한 부분은 노랑색으로 하이라이트해서 대문자로까지 알려주니 놓칠래야 놓칠 수가 없습니다.

[h1] 아케이드 요소 [/h1]
: 이 게임이 정말 잘만들었고 재밌다고 하고 싶었던 가장 큰 이유중 두개가 있는데, 로티탑을 안고 집으로 데려다주는 미션이랑, 모래섬에서 공주옷 입고 잠입게임마냥 경비를 피해서 돌아다니는 플레이였습니다. 적과의 교전이 아닌 색다른 경험을 중간에 절묘하게 넣어주어서 되게 꽉차게 플레이한 기분입니다.

[h1] 스토리? [/h1]
: 뭐 이런 가볍디 가벼운 게임에 스토리가 크게 중요하나만은, 아무리 예측가능한 엔딩에 권선징악 스토리일지라도 전편과 이어지는 설정과 등장인물들간의 연속성이 뛰어납니다. 나름 되게 헉 했던 스토리도 있어서 가볍게하다가 감동받은 부분도 있는. 
한 마디로 전편에선 그저 병풍이였던 캐릭터들이 이젠 제대로 캐릭성이란걸 갖추고 튀어나옵니다. 아주 맘에 들어요.


전편을 재밌게 하셨었더라면 이 게임은 더욱더 재밌게 하실 수 있고, 전편이 다소 아쉬웠던 분들도 요건 만족하며 하실 수 있습니다. 잘만들었네요 정말로.

28781245.review: Great Metrovania Platformer. The artstlye and soundtrack are especially c00l. The pirate upgrades are a nice change to the transformations from the first game, allowing for some really fun mechanics to play around with.

28763947.review:
If you like platformers, good music, good writing and cute girls doing cute things in between making monsters explode into gore and/or bones, you're probably going to like Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.

Until the last dungeon. When you reach the last dungeon it's pretty much 50-50 on whether you're going to destroy your controller or just swear a lot. It's incredible that such an otherwise competent game could have such a bad final dungeon.

Outside of that, the only critique is that Wayforward tend to flub their boss battles a good bit. They often rely on mechanics that you don't really have to use anywhere else, so sometimes it takes a while to get any idea how you're actually meant to hurt the boss, and it's usually easy to end up getting juggled or stunlocked. But, despite that, the boss battles are usually relatively short, and tend to manage not to detract from the game itself because of that, you're unlikely to get stuck at them, because you're probably not going to be hurting for consumables that'll let you just brute force them.

I certainly don't regret getting the game.

Though there was a moment during the aforementioned final dungeon where I flipped off my screen and had to alt-tab out to cool down because I was seriously getting pissed at the game in a way no game's ever gotten me angry before.

讲道理，虽然是西方人的作品，但是这里面的女孩都设计得很符合我这个东方人的审美，
这里面的女孩都很卡哇伊，而且顺着链接看了看前作，人设比前作漂亮了不少。

游戏细节不错，比方满血的时候女主的站立动作会很活泼，血不满时就不那么活泼，
血量不足1心时就会变得没什么活力，然后只要把血加满又立马跟打了鸡血一样，
很是有趣。

音乐方面很有节奏感，个人很是喜欢。

操作方面比较意外，一般类似的平台跳跃游戏，要把握住操控性还是不容易的，
很多类似的游戏手感都会比较飘，本作也稍稍有那么点，但是完全在接受范围内。

游戏性方面，虽说标签上是类银河战士恶魔城，但是讲道理，推动游戏进程的能力成长
也好，关键道具也好，和游戏本身的衔接并没有那两者那么优秀。同样是依靠关键技能，
关键道具推动游戏进程和扩展，但是本作又是关卡式，和恶魔城，银河战士那种大图探索
比起来，这种推进方式就显得有些累赘，直接像洛克人那样简单明了不失为一种选择。
当然，如果不愿放弃这种游戏推进方式，那也可以往2D沙盒的方向考虑考虑，我觉得或许
会是个不错的方向。

培养要素有目前看来些鸡肋，完全可以在大胆些，升级，技能，法术，被动什么的，
都可以来嘛。

最后还是要说，个人真心觉得本作的人设十分卡哇伊。

28740108.review:
Nice looking graphics and colorful music are the best parts about this game. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is basically an action platformer game, at times it feels like it makes attempts at being sort of a metroidvania, but the game is far too linear  and there is too much grinding for money to really ever be a true metroidvania.

Every single female character appears to have giant, perky breasts and for whatever reason all of them are wearing skimpy clothes, if I didn't feel like the developers intended for this to be a selling point of the game it wouldn't be a problem, but it is. 

The lag in controller response isn't acceptable at all. I play many PC games with controllers and I rarely, if ever have any problems with controller lag, this game is just awful with it. It makes many of the platforming elements very difficult to play. 

I am sure many people enjoy this game, but I had to ask myself if I'd ever buy any of their other  games in the franchise and the answer is "No", ad as a result, I can't really recommend this game.

28650878.review:
Totally agree with the 90%+ rating of this game.
Fun and engaging platformer!

I've just completed main story (no 100% or anything) and had\having a blast. 
Few things to note:
+ vibrant and colorful game world (really loving the character art and sprites)
+ simple yet engaging story backed by quirky characters and funny dialogs
+ solid game mechanics and pacing
+ awesome music\sound (in fact I bought this after Shovel Knight which also has an amazing score written by the same guy - Jake Kaufman)
+ challenging! [Though sometimes it's too forgiving: pitfalls\spikes - IMO most frequent death-dealers - only cost you quarter of heart; it felt they should take more, like a whole heart. I ended up with ton of healing items unused] 
+ bug-free


My only issues are quite miniscule:
- controls mapping. Because this is a port, it has some awkward control gimmicks: separate inventory pages buttons, shoot\talk single button, Hat button instead of 'hold jump', scimitar instead of 'down while in air'. In case you own a controller just use that!

Overall, great game for 2D-platformer folks

28491367.review:
Figure I should get a short review out before Half Genie Hero comes releases since this game rightfully deserves every bit of praise it gets. I could elaborate further, but in short, this game is a must-have for anyone who enjoys Metroidvania games and any fan who loves Shantae.

This is one of those instances where the sequel to a game improves upon every aspect. The story is in my opinion the best story of all Shantae games, involving you to team up with your arch nemesis to defeat an even darker power. You’ll still find the same funny light-hearted dialogue combined with music by legend Jake Kaufman the series is known for. Gameplay is smooth and very fair with an excellent balance of combat, exploration, and puzzles.

I’ve clocked in a little over 6 hours for my first playthrough with 100% completion. Playing the game in the New Game+ option is also very satisfying, because it gives you all your movement abilities to start with, letting you breeze through many segements. I have a few more game hours due to getting the speedrun achievements which aren’t very difficult and I urge others to give it a try. I also own this game on the 3DS and I can pop this game in any day and still have a great time. Even with the release of Half Genie Hero, which I've already completed, I still put Pirate's Curse as the #1 Shantae game out there, but it is extremely close. There is still content to come for Half Genie Hero so this opinion could change at any time.

28481982.review:
The game is broken and has been since I bought it like a year ago. The game runs stupidly fast on my curret computer and my old computer. It's not V-Sync or G-Sync, I've turned both of those off and the game still runs like the game clock was sped up 10 fold. Windowed or fullscreen it doesn't matter. 

Broken ass game. And I found a thread where the developers responded to the problem but it's still fucking there.

Considering the overwhelmingly positive reviews I'm clearly part of the 0.1% who can't play the game.

Should you buy the game? I don't know, how un-lucky do you feel? You could be part of the 0.1% who can't play the game and never will unless your next computer magically runs it fine and you're still interested at that point.

28440924.review:
И вновь Скаттл-тауну грозит опасность, и вновь полуджин Шанти должна встать на защиту родного города. И на этот раз ей придется действовать, кооперируясь с антагонисткой предыдущих частей - пираткой Риски Бутс,а вместо потерянной где-то по пути магии (вероятно, потерянной по сюжету предыдущей части, которую я не осилил) - используя вещи Риски.
Отличный платформер-метроидвания без навязчивого бектрекинга. По сюжету возвращаться на старые локации придется нечасто, но если вы решите собрать все спрятанные ништяки (осьминожки для апгрейда хелсбара и темная магия ради лучшей концовки), то конечно придется побегать. 
Платформинг хорош, есть пара зубодробительных этапов. Есть интересные ситуации, например пробежка со спасенной подругой на руках без возможности защищаться или бескровный стелс с прятками в тенях. Есть разнообразные враги, большая часть которых уникальна для конкретной локации. Есть постепенное обрастание новыми способностями - атака мечом в прыжке чтобы разбить блоки под ногами, атака с разбега позволяющая прошибать некоторые стены и проходить сквозь ряды врагов как нож сквозь масло, классика вроде планирования или двойного прыжка. Есть прокачка персонажа покупкой нужных предметов в магазине родного города (и поскольку атакует врагов Шанти копной волос, на прокачку идут шампунь и бальзам для волос)). Конечно, есть боссы, большие и страшные. Есть юмор в диалогах (чего только стоит разговор с одним из боссов, который расстраивается что ему опять выпала роль филлерного босса где-то на полпути к финалу). Есть пасхалочки и отсылки, большую часть которых я вероятно упустил, но с отсылок к Звездным войнам и Хи-мену посмеялся. Ну и приятная глазу пиксельная графика и уху музыка в наличии,да.
Структурно игра попроще предшественницы с ее дурацкой слоистой картой. Есть несколько островов, в конце каждого данж, в конце которого босс. Убили босса - получили карту, открывающую путь на следующий остров. И на мой взгляд это скорее плюс, чем минус, вторую я забросил не в последнюю очередь из-за неудобной карты и проблем с ориентированием.

В целом игра очень хороша, неравнодушным к жанру советую к приобретению.

ЗЫ: а еще на днях выходит четвертая часть, в которой авторы обещают вывести игру на качественно новый уровень. Ждем и надеемся.

28395745.review: Great Metroidvania style platformer. Cute characters and story, nice difficulty ramp-up and bonus points for an unlockable game mode with all upgrades available from the start.

28383509.review:
Shantae whips action into shape with this title, she trades her traditional "transform into animals" style into instantly accessible pirate gear that allows her to dance around her foes while bringing the beatdown. Definitely the fastest Shantae game yet and an all-around moderately sized game with good replay value including multiple endings and "Pirate-mode" which gives you your pirates gear as soon as the game starts for some incredibly fast and action-packed gameplay. I don't recommend you play Pirates Curse if you want to get a real feel for the gameplay (play risky's revenge or half-genie hero instead for that) but do recommend this for fans of metroidvania and platformers as the gameplay from here is one of the best in the series. 

I commend Wayforward for trying something radically different and succeeding at doing so, thoroughly recommended!

28344163.review:
超棒的横版卷轴游戏！
-虽然是低画素风格但是人物动作丰富细腻，风格各异的场景和骚想干的人物立绘[strike] shantaed肚皮舞真的骚	[/strike]
-跟随场景变换的超加分BGM,商店竟然没有soundpack卖！！！
-场景根据进度在几个岛屿上进行且可以随时传送，并标注了每个场景的收集品进度，收集品影响BOSS战和结局，推荐全收集后再打结局
-幽默的剧情和人物对白，游戏流程随着收集到的装备循序渐进，氛围也是轻松愉快
-巧妙的关卡设计绝对对得起类银河战士恶魔城标签

总的来说这游戏绝对值得一玩，画面音乐关卡游戏性均是上乘，同类型上次玩的这么爽还是ori。并且下一作shantae与半精灵英雄也快全平台发售了，画风从低画素变成了高清形式[strike] 不变的是骚想干的肚皮舞	[/strike]，真的十分期待。

28168456.review:
Este juego es uno de los mejores juegos de plataformas que he jugado, y tal vez el mejor, en mi humilde opinión, de la serie de Shantae. Lo he jugado más de una vez, incluido un speed-run y además de Portal 2, lo considero mi segundo mejor juego favorito en mi libreria de Steam. Aún si en esta edición Shantae ya no tiene los poderes de genio ni los baiiles y se basa más en las armas y herramientas piratas, la mecánica de juego es soberbia, el diseño de niveles y la variedad de entornos es excelente, con una duración perfecta (ni demasiado cortos, ni demasiado largos) y una historia interesante, en especial para quien siga la trama desde el primer juego del GBC.  Los puzzles de los niveles y como se unen a la mecánica de las herramientas de pirata están muy bien realizados.

Como bono extra, y como siempre, poseé varios personajes femeninos carismáticos y con potencial de 'waifus' (Shantae y Rottytops FTW!), y un soundtrack espectacular, como también es tradición de la saga.

Por algo nominé este juego en los Steam Awards en la categoría de "Solo 5 minutos más", ya que nunca me canso de jugarlo y siempre me termina enganchando como la primera vez. :)

28167969.review:

Pues como dije, está bien, aunque no es el mejor que he jugado de su género. Tiene una dificultad baja o media, excepto al final que me costó pasar los obstáculos en la torre para llegar arriba. Recomendaría el juego de edad de 13 años en adelante, ya que hay imágenes un poco provocativas.
Personalmente le doy un 7.6/10

27388198.review:
-Risky Boots!
-In the flesh!
——————————————————————————
十分优秀的作品。Shantae系列从GBC版到现在，核心还是一脉相承的：诙谐的风格，偏硬核的平台跳跃，类银河战士恶魔城的探索要素、收集、强化要素，可能还有喜闻乐见的人设。游戏本身阿拉伯风格的架空设定也非常有个性。总之完全是好作品的模子。第一部没有玩过，听说是生不逢时，第二部其实很糟糕，看似繁琐实则空洞，好像是因为开发计划的变更导致。这一部海盗诅咒可能才是真正体现系列本身应有素质的一部，开发组做的很出色。

根据剧情，游戏本身砍掉了前两部中主要的能力系统：通过跳肚皮舞变身。新的能力提升是通过寻找Risky使用过的海盗道具获得的，和前两部不仅看起来不一样，用起来也完全不一样。去除了变身动画以后的特殊能力可以即时的使用，而且可以相互组合，大大提高了Shantae的移动自由度。能力大多偏基础，例如浮空、多段跳，冲刺，使玩家有更多的方法通过同样的区域，很好的提升了游戏乐趣。和前两部相比，这样的能力系统显然更像是Metroidvania该有的，这才能在不断的backtracking中不至于无聊。至于地图本身，采用的是关卡式的设计，而不是和其他很多Metroidvania一样是一个整体，这个比较奇怪，但是无伤大雅。我感觉Wayforward可能就擅长这种关卡式的设计，也是挺老派复古的，实现的够好的话给人感觉也不错。

游戏的节奏也做的相当好，比如Shantae在七大海的冒险和Scuttle Town本身被占领改造双线并行，每次探索完一个区域，基本都要回到小镇完成一些小任务，进行剧情才能继续。探索中的遭遇剧情也是恰到好处，对很多NPC的性格和故事背景都是很好的补全，也深化了Shantae与损友Rottytop和相爱相杀的对头Risky之间的感情。上一部因为流程太短，人物并不突出，我觉得根本了解不到Sky、Bolo是个什么样的人。好结局非常令人满意，Boss战足够大气，结束之后的剧情处理不突兀而且温馨。坏结局我看了一下视频虽然差不多不过感觉比较莫名其妙，所以一定要打好结局。加上游戏本身无厘头的风格，流程体验非常轻松惬意。

音乐还是一如既往并且更加优秀，我感觉应该是复古的风格中带点异域曲调和活泼的感觉，和游戏一样很有个性。

总之，这是个非常棒的游戏，复古偏硬派的Gameplay，独树一帜的设定和氛围，一直不错的关卡设计和终于达到上乘的流程设计，以及点缀的不错的收集和隐藏要素，使Shantae和海盗诅咒成为一部质量很过硬的平台跳跃类银河战士恶魔城。当然喜欢立绘风格就更棒了。
——————————————————————————————————
新作Shantae:半精英雄马上就要发售了，脱离像素风走HD路线，如果今年能出大概是我今年最期待的独立游戏了，但是游戏本身又回归了前两部的变身设定，这次应该能做好。而且看比较老的试玩感觉系列一直很优秀的像素和立绘表情也没了，还是要捏把汗。

27257395.review:
2016オータムセールのSteamアワードに合わせてレビュー。

まずサンプル画像を見て分かる通り、絵が綺麗。
ドット絵はゲームの舞台が海に浮かぶ島ということもあり色鮮やかで、しかもよく動く。
キャラクターの立ち絵は今作は日本人のデザイナーに発注したそうで、
前作までのものと好みは別れるだろうが、概ねかわいい（男も異生物も）と言えるだろう。
音楽の調子もキャラの空気やフィールドによく合っている。

ストーリーなどの文面は全て英語。分量も多くスラング等もあったりするので、直接読み解くには苦労するだろう。
ストーリー全文を翻訳しているサイトがあるので探してみるといい。
分かってしまえば明るく単純で、ユーモアもある楽しい筋書き。
前作から引き継いでいる設定もあるが、「そういうものか」で理解には支障ない。筆者もここから初めた。

ゲームの方は各ステージを探索してアイテムを集め、クリアすると使えるアクションが増えていく、よくあるスタイル。
このアクションのそれぞれに爽快感があり、得られるごとに自分がうまくなったような気がして気分がいい。
難易度は実績を狙わなければ、アイテムでのゴリ押しが効くこともありそう難しくはない。
何度も挑戦することが前提のいやらしい地形などはほぼない(ラスボス前はやや難しいかもしれないが、最悪隠しテク的なものでスキップできる)。
最近のマリオシリーズを(隠しを除き一通り自分で)クリアできるぐらいであれば十分だろう。
やり込むならばTAやライフ縛りの実績がある。上手い人なら最初から縛ってちょうどいい難易度かも？
プレイ時間はゆっくりやって10～15時間、TAならば4時間弱。慣れてくると一部仕掛けをスキップして、サクサク周回できて楽しくなる。

難点は、やや距離のあるお使いイベントが幾つかあり、目的地も特に表示されないところ。
未調査点は覚えておかないと、虱潰しに探し回るハメになる。
この辺は日本語化されていないことも拍車を掛けている。完全日本語翻訳された3DS版が発売されているので、そちらの購入も一考。
ちなみに次回作は公式で日本語対応という噂……？

総じてよくできていると感じられる、気軽に楽しめる一品。
アクション初心者の挑戦から廃人の暇つぶしまで、幅広くおすすめできる。

ノミネートはオリジナルの”ディスプレイの向こう側へ行きたいで”賞。
キャラクターがかわいいのはもちろんのこと、ほぼ全員が楽しそうなので、輪に混ざりたい気分になる。
拠点が温和な島国で(途中乗っ取られたりもするが)、居心地がよさそうなのもポイント。

26799043.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is the game I have that has clocked the most in-game hours, and for many good reasons.

While it may have been a straight-up port of a 3DS title, nothing has been dumbed down, save for the 3D portraits, which isn't really something to lose sleep over anyway.

Now for the stuff that really matters.

Graphics are superb. No island, stretch of land, or dungeon gets away without a splash of personality and color. The many background layers set the bar even higher.

Combat is easy to get used to. Attack, attack, and reap the rewards of a hard day's work. Sometimes you will even have to use strategy against some of the tougher foes, for a basic hair-whip just won't cut it.

The map is huuuge. Divided into several islands to help not getting too lost, a palette of enemies and traps await your every next adventure. 

Last, but not least, the game is cute. Not much to say about that, but it is.

And that's all I have to say about my choice of nominating this for the Steam Awards. I wish this good luck.

26053943.review:
Grundsolide Fortsetzung für Shantae- und Genre-Freunde

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse ist eine gelungene Fortsetzung. Viele Mängel des Vorgängers, wie die kurze Spieldauer, der lasche Schwierigkeitsgrad und die grobpixelige Grafik wurden gerade gebügelt. Und mit dem Wechsel von der Magie zur Piraten-Ausrüstung wird obendrein ein neuer Spielflair aufgebaut, der die Serie frisch hält. Das Spiel gehört freilich immer noch zur Kategorie der Action-Plattformer im Metroidvania-Stil, auch wenn dieses mal ein stärkerer Fokus auf den Action-Plattforming-Aspekt gelegt wird. Leider gibt es einige Punktabzüge in der B-Note. Die Hintergrundgrafiken sind nicht mehr so liebevoll gestaltet wie im Vorgänger und der sprunghafte Anstieg des Schwierigkeitsgrades im finalen Dungeon ist mehr als irritierend. Und eine richtige Sprachausgabe ist ebenfalls überfällig. Die Shantae-Reihe gehört schließlich zu den textlastigeren Titeln des Hüpfspiel-Genres. Diese Mängel ändern aber nichts am grundsoliden Spielspaß und dem enormen Charme, den Shantae und Co. verbreiten. Man darf sich aufs nächste Spiel freuen!


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- kreative und niedlich-sexy Protagonistin
- tolle Charaktere und nette Story
- abwechslungsreiches Gameplay
- breite Movepalette und viele Gegenstände
- besseres Teleportiersystem als im Vorgänger
- schöner Soundtrack mit Ohrwurm-Faktor
- die Grafik ist nicht mehr so extrem grobpixelig wie im Vorgänger

Neutral
- Action-Plattformer im Metroidvania-Stil
- stärkerer Fokus auf Action-Plattforming als im letzten Spiel
- Durchschnittliche Spieldauer von ca. 10-12 Stunden
- bietet endlich deutsche Bildschirmtexte

Kontra:
- der letzte Dungeon im Spiel nervt mit überzogenen Schwierigkeitsgrad
- Freischaltung des guten und echten Endes erfordert wahrscheinlich die Hilfe einer Komplettlösung
- die Hintergrundgrafiken sind nicht mehr so detailliert wie im Vorgänger
- Pad-Steuerung beschränkt sich auf Xbox 360-Controller, Geräte von Drittherstellern werden nicht unterstützt
- immer noch keine Sprachausgabe (nur einzelne Wörter und Laute wurden synchronisiert)

25733021.review: A difficult game but a good game non the less, the last 2 levels were a bit overkill with the amount of bullsh*t on screen at one time be it spikes or tar ladies on the ground, ceiling, and jumping the hell around all over the damn place. Untill that point you feel really good dashing through levels at high speed listening to gorgeous music!

25730523.review:
A struggle to get through.

The main problem I had with this game was the motivation to keep going. I'm not saying this is a bad game, it's not. It's quite fun, however it simply lacks something there to drive you forward. Besides seeing each new pirate tool, until the end of the game you aren't given any payoff for doing anything. 

The save system needs to be looked over, as when you save, you don't also recover full health. This isn't a challenge thing though, as if you save and suicide, you respawn with full health. It just adds more tedium to the game. 

There are only 5 different upgrades to get and none of them feel unique. You get a weak long distance attack (never really worth using), a glide, which is very dull and adds very little bar sections that actually require the use, a pair of boots which allow you to do an equivalent of the Shine Spark from Super Metroid, except you need an even bigger run up and you just run forward, not fly up as well. A down attack, adds very little as the hair whip still can be more effective and only serves to kill a few enemies designed specifically to die to them and lastly a triple jump, which occurs very late in the game and only serves to make you go back and get all the items you saw in plain sight in previous levels.

The biggest problem however is that the game seems designed entirely around these items, rather than the world and the items being designed in tandem. 

I can't recommend this game. I did enjoy it, but it was a slog to get through.

25726466.review: 期待半精灵！说好的9月27日呢？？？

25721081.review:
Play Risky's Revenge first! Very much like the previous game, but improved on in many ways. Controls are smoother, graphics are much better, art design is clearly more advanced. It plays like Risky's Revenge but better in every way. Controls are far better, with proper native controller support. Though, I would still recommend tweaking the controls (at least remap some buttons) if you have a Steam Controller; overall no problems. It has voice acting! Partially, anyway. Most of it's reading, but the cast is excellent and it compliments the text dialogue well. Also has a very good soundtrack, with what seems to have some remixes from Risky's Revenge. Definitely worth $20, but it drops to $10 every few months.

Important notes:
- Monitor must be running at 60hz for the game to work properly. If you have a display that plays at higher than 60hz, you'll have to turn it down to 60 via the operating system.
- No support for resolutions higher than 1920x1080. (Though you wouldn't know it. Most of the sprites are pixely like in the screenshots, and those that aren't still look very smooth at 1080p.)

25673876.review:
Very good platformer with tight controls and an interesting story. Way better and more improved compared to Riskys Revenge.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

+ neat artstyle
+ the story is continued and fun to follow
+ tight controls
+ cool new powers and game mechanics
+ nice platforming parts
+ difficulty is spot on, not too hard, not too easy
+ a lot of collectibles
+ new game mode plus after completion
+ free roaming
+ the world is in 2D, they got rid of the 3D fore- and background mechanic, which is great
+ various items that will help you on your journey
+ fantastic music
+ took me 8,5 hours to finish the game
+ the backtracking is kept to a minimum
+ all the characters are colorful and great

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

- kinda story spoiler here [spoiler]the game ends on a cliffhanger, which I didnt like[/spoiler]

Great and improved platformer from the previous game. I loved the story and the overall gameplay. A great game with lots of content to enjoy. A must have for every Metroidvania fan.

25661168.review:
Terza puntata dell'eccellente serie di Shantae, che riesce a rinnovarsi ogni volta, e ogni volta si dimostra migliore del precedente... Una cosa più unica che rara!
Per chi non lo sapesse, Shantae è un platform stile metroid-vania con grafica old-school, animazioni stra-curate e una comicità innata. In questa nuova avventura dovremo fare i conti con un pirata ancora più pericoloso di quella gnocca di Risky, ritrovando piovre, thinkerbats mutanti e viaggiando per diverse isole fino all'immancabile scontro finale.
Un gioco d'avere assolutamente. Straconsigliato. ;-)
