25506168.review:
前作『Shantae: Risky's Revenge』の続編に当たる、シリーズ第3段。
一応ストーリーは前作と繋がっており、シャンティは魔力を失って魔法を使う事ができなくなっています。
そのため、変身ができなくなり代わりにリスキーブーツの海賊アイテムを入手し、
その海賊アイテムによって新しいアクションが可能になる、という風にシステムが変更されました。
魔法も使えなくなっていますが、一部の魔法はアイテムとして続投しています。

[前作との変更点]
・変身システムの削除、パワーアップ方式の変更
・マップ方式の変更
・メインキャラクターのボイス追加
・立ち絵などアートデザインの変更
・帰還アイテムの追加

主人公のシャンティがよく喋るようになりました。
フルボイス等ではありませんが、
状況に応じてメッセージに対応したボイスが流れます。
声優は日本アニメ・ゲームの吹き替えでおなじみCristina Valenzuelaさん。
Steam配信ゲーだと『Skullgirls』のセレベラ、『BlazBlue』の英語版複数キャラ、
『超次元ゲイム ネプテューヌ』シリーズ英語版コンパなどと同じです。

[ストーリー]
前作ラストで魔法が使えなくなったシャンティがライバル：リスキーブーツの元師でもある
海賊王「パイレーツマスター」の復活を阻止するべく、リスキーブーツの船に乗って
各島を周り冒険するというシンプルなストーリーです。

一応前作から引き続き登場するキャラクター、続いているシナリオという体ですが
今作内だけで完結するお話なので前作を遊んだことがなくても大丈夫な内容。

[操作性]
前作と比べるとかなりジャンプ周りの硬さが変更されていて、快適になっています。
元々PC用ゲームではないので、キーボードの場合はやや操作に使うボタンが多く
ややこしいかもしれません。
前作と同じく、X-input対応のゲームパッドで遊ぶのがやりやすいと思います。

特に終盤は複数のアクションを組み合わせて使う事が多いので、
キーボードだと思ったタイミングでジャンプしづらかったりします。
一応プレイはできますが、パッドがあったほうが快適に遊べるでしょう。

[難易度]
初見だと結構手こずるアスレチック要素が多いですが、
失敗してもライフが少し減るだけで手前からやり直しなのでゲームテンポは良いです。
最初苦労したアスレチックを新たなアクションを手に入れてから戻ってきた際には
簡単にクリア出来たり、もう一周した時に一発でぬけられたりすると達成感があります。

ボス戦も全体的に自然に攻略方法がわかるようになっていますが、
攻略方法がわかっていてもその通りに動けない場合があるドラゴン戦はちょっと苦戦するかもしれません。

[マップ]
前作のように中央に街があり、そこからマップが地続きになっている方式ではなく
街からリスキーブーツの船で各島へ連れて行ってもらい、各島を探索して
ダンジョンに入り、ダンジョンの最奥でボスを倒すという方式に変更されました。

前作では行き来が地味に面倒な部分がありましたが、今作では消費アイテムとして
照明弾が購入できるようになり、屋外マップであれば使用することで
即座にリスキーブーツの船まで戻れるので非常に便利になっています。

各マップの探索要素も健在で、今作ではライフの上限を増やすHeart Squidや収集アイテムの
Dark Magicを探してアクションを駆使する楽しみもあります。

次のダンジョンに進むのに前の島に戻って探索やイベントをこなして
戻ってこないといけない、という場面もあり（知っていれば事前に回収できるものもありますが）
その辺りはやや面倒かも。

[戦闘]
今作では魔法が使えなくなりましたが、相変わらずSpike ballはアイテムとして登場します。
なくてもクリアはできますが、Spike ballと攻撃力アップアイテムのMonster Milkの
組み合わせが非常に強く、うまく使えばボスを一瞬で倒せるなどの要素は健在。
海賊アイテムを使ったアクションが攻撃にもなるため、前作より戦闘中に
やれることの幅は増えています。

[ローカライズ]
Steam版は英語のみです。
重要ワードはハイライト表示される+そんなに複雑な話ではないので
読み飛ばしていても特に問題はない程度の文章量です。
3DS版などは日本語ローカライズ+3D対応だそうなので、
どうしても日本語版が良い方はそちらのほうが良いかと思われます。

[総評]
前作の良い部分を受け継ぎ、不便だった部分は便利に改変された一本。
クリアするだけなら難易度はそれほど高くありませんが、
100%クリアを○時間以内、体力上限を増やさずにクリアなど
コアゲーマー向けのチャレンジ要素といえる実績もあります。

パワーアップしたアクションで前に苦労したところをぶっ飛ばしていく爽快感もあり、
特にシミターを入手した後はメトロイドシリーズでいうスピードブースターのように
敵を蹴散らしたり、地形を大きく飛び越えながら突っ走れるのが気持ちいいです。
1周クリアすると最初から全ての海賊アイテム所持で始まる
「パイレーツモード」というモードでも遊べるようになるなど、おまけ要素もあり。

普段洋ゲーをほとんどやらない人でも非常に触りやすい作りになっているため、
2Dアクションが好きな人にはおすすめできる一本。

Fantastic action platformer that every fan of the genre shotld play.
Let me make a list of some of the reasons why this game is awesome:

25347968.review:
Very good "japanese platformer" game (they call it Metroidvania). 

Seems like a PC conversion of a console game, which was really decently performed. Full-screen action, very fluid moves, excellent retro music, nice 2-D high-res still graphics. Compared to the PC version of the former Shantae game, it's a great leap forward technically speaking.

It's a classic gameplay, but perfectly crafted. Perfectly. It's more jumps-oriented than beat-em-up, it requires some precision more than fast reflexes, but that's very pleasing. 

It's not "just an idie game": the studio here is a veteran of MetroVania games and worked on big console licences too: they fukken know their job. We don't have so many games of this kind on PC, so just buy it.

The gameplay is a little demanding: all controls respond very fast and smoothly, but you need to be precise in all. Over time, training takes place and you really enjoy it, but it seems odd at the beginning for a PC player.


CONS: you need an xbox controller, and can't reassign keys, although you could in the former game. Since it was developped for a portable console, most GFX are upscaled even though it remains very good overall. Too bad they did not redraw the main protagonists in higher resolution (will be made in next episode). Also, 19 € is a little expensive, but you can get way cheaper keys.

Excellent fan service too. Dialogs and story are funny. A bit lenghty at the beginning, but then action takes place. Characters and story are stupid, light-minded, but funny.


tl;dr: good console game, really worth trying, addictive in the end.

25317180.review: A great game to pick up if you do not have too much time to play games, the campaign should only take 7-9 hours and there is some end game content that can take you a bit beyond. Gameplay wise it feels smooth and generally natural. Plot wise it is light hearted and semi-flirtacious all around, and the quality character portaits have an added benefit for us male players (or female, I digress), appealing to the eye and fun to play I would definately recommend Shantae to any person looking for a laid back adventure, this is coming from a person who barely plays platformers and I generally get bored with them quick, but its pacing is good enough that it keeps you interest until the end.

25251808.review: After finishing this fantastic game, I really regret not funding Shantae half genie hero when that was on kickstarter (since I didn't know about it and am poor) so from now on I vow to fund every kickstarter project Wayforward will have in future.

25223246.review:
[h1]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/h1]

[b]Overall Vote: 8[/b]

This is one of the best Platform games I've ever completed. Developed by the same software house of DuckTales: Remastered, this game finds it's origins in the far 2002, when it was released on GameBoy Color. After 14 years, it has been renewed first on Nintendo DS, then ported on PC. And the result is amazing.

[u][b]GAMEPLAY: 8,5[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Gameplay easy and immediate, like old times;
[*]Various objects that you will enjoy to use;
[*]Funny story and very hilarious;
[*]Save Points well distribuited;
[*]Good exploration mechanics, which makes you want to complete it in every single part.
[/list]
[u][b]GRAPHIC: 8[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Amazing animations;
[*]Very good level design;
[*]Smooth and polished graphic;
[*]Sexy characters' design, but never vulgar.
[/list]
[u][b]MUSIC, SOUNDS, EFFECTS: 8[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Enjoyable soundtracks;
[*]Well made sound effects.
[/list]
[u][b]LONGEVITY: 7.5[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Probably the only big weak point, 10 hours to complete it and lesser time if you want to try the Pirate Mode (a.k.a. New Story+).
[/list]
So this is my opinion for what I consider a little gem in the steam store. I loved Shantae in every part and I'm sure I'll buy the sequel scheduled in 2017. Actually you can find Shantae and Pirate's Curse at €19.99, an acceptable price in my humble opinion. For achivements hunters, there is nothing impossible in this game, so you can feel free to play and master it. 

Have fun!!

25094118.review:
Pirates Curse is a good sequel to the previous shantae game. Although I did find that it was rather easy, and it seemed shorter/more compartmentalized than the previous one. Rather than having an 'open' map to explore, you're given seperate worlds, which I guess makes it seem smaller, even if it's about the same size. Still gives for a good length playthrough though.

The story is a good continuation, and there's lots of humour to be found in it. The art is very good, keeping in style. There are some good and some great music tracks to go with the levels.

Good game. In terms of your engagement, it may work as a standalone game, but probably works better as a sequel to the previous one (risky's revenge), given that the story and characters follow on.

Shantae and the Pirates Curse is a 2D platforming game staring the former half-genie, Shantae. Here are some pros and cons.

24445832.review:
I saw this game on sale and thought I'd pick it up because I saw the E3 trailer for the next installment "1/2 Genie Hero". I was expecting a cute little pixel game with a bit of that classic "Nintendo Difficulty" that I loved to be frustrated by in my childhood. This game was a joy to play through, even when I kept dying to the god damn spikes. A lot of people will tell ya that this game is very short and they'd be right considering that if you don't bother with exploration you blow through this like Huricane Katrina through New Orleans. However, much like an old NES or SNES game you'll wanna take your time and find all the little secrets. This game has a handful of collectables, one type of which adds several more phases to the final boss (who might I add was justified to the hype Risky built up). This game offers challenge that Metroidvania fans will appreciate, a wonderful soundtrack, downright adorable characters, and an impressive art style in both pixel and digital. I have yet to play through the previous games (The first game is impossible to find for less than three-hundred fuggin dollars (USD)) but the second game is available on Steam right now so I might pick it up when it goes on sale. Though, I doubt that the second game is as good as this one. WayForward is an impressive developer, taking up bigger jobs to fund their own series is admirable, and you can tell they put in the love and effort the games deserve. I cannot wait for the next game in the series, while diverging from a pixel animated art style to a full on digital, it still looks impressive. 20$ is asking just a bit too much however, as this game has nothing more to give after completing the game 100% (aside from the achievements for my fellow achievement freaks). Do give this game a try though, WayForward deserves more praise than they get, you won't regret putting time into this game.

24409107.review:
Mediocre, mudane, run-of-the-mill, uninspiring sidescroller that's heavily pixelated... I mean, excessively pixelated, far exceeding the healthy dose of my taste for retro aesthetics.

The controls/handling is rather mediocre too... there's no fluidity and character animation is simply lacking. Some enemies came straight out of the NES adaptation of the Aladdin cartoon; in fact when I think of it, the stage design also smells suspiciously of copy-and-paste and reflects the not-giving-a-merde on the part of the designers.

Simply put, how the series has managed to drag its feet and get praised so often is beyond me. So I got my refund.

If you are looking for a Metroidvania game with great aesthetics, responsive controls, wonderful music and overall fantastic production value, there're plenty of alternatives available on Steam, like, say, Ori & the Blind Forest.

Anyway, for this game and any other Shantae iteration? I recommend that you AVOID.

24403191.review:
After only putting in just a couple hours I can say this is a solid game and would recommend to anyone who likes side scrollers. The last and best time I had playing a side scroller was with various Mario games on the SNES before I was even attending Kindergarden. I am thoroughly enjoying the amount of thought the developers put into this game to make it a very enjoyable, well rounded experience, and I have zero complaints. The small things like the voice acting, the art in the cutscenes, the very tender foreshadowing used to introduce and build the game mechanics to the players - wonderful.

I have stayed away from side scrollers / 2D platformers because of how ridiculously boring and repetetive they are, but this game has given me hope, I never thought I'd find a 2D game with such quality in all aspects. Everything so far has been tight knit, I'm not running around endlessly trying to remember 100 different things going on, and nothing is too simplified either.

I'm now a fan and will be purchasing the game before this one as well as Half Genie when it is released.
If you like 2D platformers / sidescrollers, I would check this game out.

24397832.review:
Definitely a buy for any 2D-platformer enthusiast, sale or no sale. Action-packed from start to finish with satisfying upgrades that changes Shantae's moveset to allow for some tricky platforming towards the end of the game.

[b] Improvements	[/b]
Less clunky and more fastpaced compared to Risky's Revenge. Mostly because the special moves are bound to items instead of dance transformations which slowed down the action in RR.

[b] Cons	[/b]
Unfortunately some slight grinding is needed in order to acquire (buy) all item upgrades since not nearly enough gems are dropped while simply playing through dungeons/areas once. But since all upgrades are not required to complete the game it is not a big issue.

24387512.review:
"Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" is the latest and best game released of the Shantae series (so far). Join Shantae as she teams up with the pirate Risky Boots to stop the spread of an ancient curse. Use various pirate equipment and sail on a pirate ship as you explore several islands in Sequin Land. Battle monsters, upgrade weapons and search labyrinths for rare treasures and items.

Like the previous installment, the game stands out with great music, beautiful art, solid controls, lovable characters and a memorable story that never takes itself too seriously. Note that it has more content than the previous games, including an unlockable "Pirate Mode", multiple endings and enough achievements to challenge even hardcore players. The only significant flaw is the lack of transformation magic (and sexy dances) due to the events of the previous game.

I highly recommend "Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" to anyone who enjoys platformers like Castlevania or Metroid. Definitely look forward to the release of the next Shantae game!

24333200.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a fun and light-hearted adventure with great music, solid controls, beautiful animated sprite art, and funny reimaginings on common metroidvania power-ups and abilities.  I would call most of the game easier than the classics in the genre, but I would not hold that against it.    That said I found a few specific levels to be difficulty spikes and found them frustrating against the challenge level of the rest of the game.

As the third game in the series I do not recommend it as an introduction to the series;  Risky's Revenge is a better starting point.  Pirate's Curse doesn't really try to introduce any of the returning characters to you, which would make the story beats fly over a player new to the series' head, including that our heroine *had* magic abilities that she somehow *lost* before this game begain, and her history with series antagonist, Risky Boots.

Some folks might be turned off by the fan service.  There is a high number of female characters wearing outfits that show off clevage or belly buttons if not both, and there's an entire sequence poking fun at the "slave Leia" outfit.   To me the game came off as self aware about it as opposed to creepy or skeevy, but other folks may feel different.  I did find it refreshing to play a game where not just the heroine is female, but so are most of the significant cast members.  This is something I enjoy about the series overall.

Wayforward overall does good work, and Pirate's Curse is certainly another example of that.  I enjoyed turning to it when I wanted a pick-me-up with fun gameplay, good controls, fun story, and solid music.

Shantae is a fun and whimsical take on the "metroidvania" genre. The game has an excellent soundtrack that really gives the action feel that it is going for. The characters are well written and provide plenty of comedic opportunities. 

The gameplay isn't too difficult for the majority of the game. The last level the gameplay gets dramatically harder, and it’s for the better. The ending was a little anticlimactic and was obviously setting up the next game, but story is not the reason to purchase this game regardless. For a sale price, this game is worth every penny for I had a blast with it!

24157475.review: You never know what you want until you have it. I had no idea that I loved 2-D sidescrolling Metroid-Vania adventure games until I played this. Now I REALLY want it! This game had a little bit of everything; it was funny, 4th wall-breaking, cute and charming, as well as having incredibly difficult sections near the end that tests everything you know about the game's moves. The final boss is a joke, try to get through with 0 damage if you want a challenge. And the game has a habit of oversexualizing every female in the game (Excluding one but no spoilers) to a somewhat comedic degree (in a Lollipop Chainsaw kind of way) until I believe it's supposed to be making fun of games that oversexualize their females. And I enjoy that, I am open-minded enough to realize a joke when one is being made, although that fact is a little difficult to explain to my parents when they find out what I've been screaming at all day.

This time with the help from IntiCreates ( makers of Megaman zero, ZX , 9/10) , wayforward was able to show us what Shantae was really capable of. The first Shantae game well being the first one and being on the gameboy color had some issues , most of them caused by the console itself, it also didn't know what it wanted to be. The second game Risky's Revenge which you can also get on steam while improved upon a lot of things in the first game still had some design choices that made the game feel unfinished (the map , only 3 dungeons one being a gauntlet etc...) . 

With background out of the way lets look at this game.

Pros:
1: The music is amazing. Its energetic and memorable. Same guy who worked on shovel knight also a great game.
2:The controls are tight if you die its your fault and not because of some input delays.
3: The weapons you get are really useful and welcomed addition to the game. In previous games you had to hold buttons certain amount of time to dance and then transform  just to use the power you needed. However this time all you have to do is to just press the correct button and BOOM. It kinda reminds me of Symphony Of the Night in that regard.
4:The bosses are really fun and challanging and the best part is you can beat all of them withouth getting hit. Its actually not that hard. 
5: There are lots of dungeons (and 2 of them are secret bonus) and these are pretty fun. 
6:The writing is hilarious.
Cons:
1: You can't (to my knowledge ) assign the buttons on your controller. You can do it for the keyboard but not the controller.

..........And thats it , I can't really find major problems with this game.

I recommend Shantae and The Pirate's Curse to anyone who enjoys 2d platformer/metroidvania type of games.

23940453.review:
With a final playtime of 8 hours and 15 minutes, 100%ing the game after looking up a guide for the handful of collectibles I missed, SatPC is a little on the short side, but the overwhelming majority of those 8 hours are filled with an exceptionally solid platformer with an irresitibly bouncy soundtrack, enjoyable visuals and several absolutely top-tier waifus.

The difficulty is fairly nicely balanced and rises at a reasonable rate, save for when it skyrockets in the final two levels and sends the death count soaring. Regardless, you'll have hopefully had a good enough time with the endearing characters and enjoyable combat that it hopefully won't sour the experience. Definitely worth the sale price, and possibly even the full £15.

Also, Rotty is best girl.

23930979.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse takes place after the events of Risky's Revenge, Shantae, who at the end of the previous game lost her genie magic in circumstances which the game takes considerable care to not actually reveal, now has to team up with her former nemesis Risky Boots to prevent the resurrection of the Pirate Master, a tyrannical pirate warrior who seeks to return to the world of the living. In addition, the Pirate Master has started using Dark Magic to turn Risky's Tinkerbats into Cacklebats - horrifying mutated creatures which Shantae must defeat in order to cut off his source of Dark Magic. Honestly, I think the plot here is actually much better than in the previous game. Whereas the plot in Risky's Revenge is at times quite thin, in this game it doesn't feel thin at all - there always seems to be something going on and it's in general much easier to follow.

Gameplay-wise It's a Metroidvania-platformer like its predecessor, but the areas you explore have been expanded quite a bit. Rather than just Scuttle Town and the nearby areas, you have a multitude of different islands to explore, from the tropical Saliva Island to the zombie-infested Spiderweb Island and the icy Frostbite Island, which gives it much more variety with regards to the areas you explore and visit. Compared to the first game, Scuttle Town and the surrounding areas have also been shrunk massively, though in all honesty this is more to the game's overall benefit, since it cuts out a lot of the needless traipsing back and forth that the first game had. The multiple islands also help to mitigate the Metroidvania forgetting-where-you're-up-to problem by giving you much more of a sense of progression as you unlock the islands and defeat the Cacklebats found there. The number of undiscovered Cacklebats and Heart Squids, which you use to increase the size of your life bar, are also shown above each island in the hub screen, making the completion aspect of the game much more accessible too. Because of the way in which it's been redesigned it's also much easier to find your way around Scuttle Town since all the buildings are now clearly labelled, so you no longer have to guess which door contains what.

The base gameplay and graphics are very similar to that of Risky's Revenge, with a few notable differences. In this instalment Shantae is by default able to whip her hair back and forth much faster than before, and as a result from the get-go the action is much less rigid and more snappy and satisfying. The fact that they've also added Castlevania-style knockback is both a blessing and a curse, since it allows the action to flow a bit more, but on occasion can be quite irritating. Unfortunately, due to Shantae having lost her genie powers, her Dancing mechanic is missing, but fortunately this is replaced with a new mechanic in the form of pirate equipment that can be found throughout the levels, for instance a pistol that allows you to hit far-off switches and serves as a weak ranged attack, a hat which lets you glide over long distances, and a scimitar which lets you do a ground-pound attack. These new mechanics complement the Metroidvania gameplay much like the Dances did in the previous game, and arguably even do a better job, since there's much more of them and they allow for a lot more variety in the platforming puzzles than the Dances did. Not only that, but WayForward have also, it seems, managed to add a couple of new spins on the platforming too, with gameplay drastically changing in a couple of sections of the game as you play. One section has you running through the woods, unable to attack, and another is a Wind Waker-eqsue stealth section in which you're stripped of all your items and have to try and sneak out of the area - if you're detected by the guards they will march you back to the start. These serve as interesting, fun little breaks from the Metroidvania gameplay and keep the game interesting in a way that doesn't disturb the flow of the plot in any serious way. 

A drastic change from the previous game is the items system, which has been almost completely overhauled. Most of the Magic from Risky's Revenge is gone and the mana system has been replaced with time-limited, single-use items. You're no longer able to hot-switch between different items in quite the same way as in Risky's Revenge but what you can do is use multiple items at the same time - a feature which the previous game lacked. The overall range of items available is also wider and you no longer need to find Magic Jam to buy anything. There's some offensive items, attack buffs, "Fighter's Moves" - extra maneuvers you can perform in combat, some of which can come in particularly handy, and a massive, very variable and on occasion slightly humourous range of healing items (including the new Auto-Potion which activates as soon as you run out of health - believe me they will save your bacon on many an occasion). I found myself not using quite as many items in this game as in Risky's Revenge, but honestly there's nothing wrong with the new system. It's different, but it doesn't really detract from the experience at all and is just as fun to use as the old system.

A lot of the characters from Risky's Revenge also reappear in Pirate's Curse as do some new characters, major and minor, ranging from a new Baron to a walking He-Man parody, and they're all just as funny and interesting as they were before, perhaps even more so. You get to see a lot more of the other characters than in Risky's Revenge and you'll learn more about them as you progress through the game - and you'll be glad to know that the fantastic writing also makes a return, and in greater and even more humourous amounts. Sometimes it'll have you on the edge of your seat, other times every other line will have you giggling, heck, even SIGNS and some item descriptions contain their fair share of weird and wacky humour! All that and somehow you never really lose track of the plot. Suffice to say, this game's writing is top notch.

A fair amount of the sountrack is made up of remixed tracks from Risky's Revenge but most of them are original, and whereas its predecessor's soundtrack was pretty good, Pirate's Curse ramps that description up to "freaking fantastic". Every single track is even more riveting than in the previous installment, and the soundtrack in general seems to have much more "thump" to it than before. As a result it perfectly complements the action-rich gameplay and awesomely-written characters, and not only that, but whilst it does sound modern and upbeat some of the songs seem to remind slightly of its 16-bit forefathers - if you listen to them in the right way they sound a bit like remixes of songs from the days of the SNES era. I really kind of regret that I can't fit more songs from this game's soundtrack into this video, it really is that much of joy to listen to.

Another thing which this game has which Risky's Revenge doesn't is voice acting for some of Shantae's lines, provided by none other than Cristina Vee, who also played such high-profile roles as Homura Akemi from Madoka Magica and Compa from Hyperdimension Neptunia. Whilst at times her voice acting can be a teeny bit grating it certainly helps to build up Shantae's character a little more by putting more of a voice in her mouth, and Christina Vee's performance is pretty good. That said, it is a bit of a shame that WayForward didn't choose to go big and fully voice-act it, because that would have been downright awesome.

All in all, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is not just a great sequel to a great game, but also a truly fantastic game in its own right. The music is wonderful, the dialogue is stellar, the gameplay is smooth and enjoyable, the 16-bit graphics once again give it a fair amount of charm, and for what it's worth I can say that, even on its own, this is one of the best platformers I've ever played and certainly one of my all time favourites.

23895146.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a very good game with lots of interesting elements.

[b] Gameplay : [/b] Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is basiclly an action platformer that somehow feel like a fusion betwen megaman and metroid (more megaman than metroid). I'll start with, an odd point : the controls. The first time I have controlled shantae, something was odd, I felt like I couldn't control the caracter properly and I always took hits that I would have normally dodged. I felt this for, like 1 hour then the controls were perfect for me. So that's why I first thought that the controls were bad and I almost gave up, but in the end, it's just that you really need your time to adapt yourself I think (or maybe I was just stup). So the controls aren't bad. After that let's talk about the difficulty and the levels : It's very well done. In the middle of each island, you will obtain a new equipment item which grant you a new movement skill that will help you to move forward, and the level disign is perfectly done to use these item and make each equipments usefull. Also, the game is pretty difficult, some passages will make you die a lot but if you really can't do it, you can use items to help you (Do not always use items or the game will be way too easy, you can almost rush a boss without worring about your hp because you will kill him faster that he will kill you). 

[b] Art : [/b] The whole thing is well executed, the design and the backgrounds are beautiful and they fit very well to the universe of shantae, no bad point here, it's gorgeous. Also, you can obtein CGs in the game and that's cool.

[b] Musics and sounds : [/b] Well, the music are good and they fit very well to the art and the universe of the story but I am pretty sure I wont remember any of those song, it's not bad, but it's forgettable.

[b] Story : [/b] The universe is really cool, and the characters as well, they are funny and they are some comic elements. The story of your journey itself is kinda.... boring, you will clearly not play that game for his story,

[b] Glitch and issues : [/b] I had a pretty small issue but it's worth to mention. The speed of the game depend of your fps, it's nothing serious you will say since it's a retro style game and there is no way to have fps drop on this BUT the issue is somewhere else, there isn't a 60fps cap, so if you have a screen which can show more than 60 fps, your game will speed up ! I have a 144Hz monitor so the game ran at 144 fps and it was like playing with a x2 fast forward option, so if your monitor have more than 60Hz then you will have to cap your fps yourself. Nothing serious, just have to remember to change the fps cap before launching the game.

[b] Summary : [/b]

Pros :
- Good gameplay and well dosed difficulty (the first level is for baby but the last one is very hard)
- Well executed art and level designs
- Can be speedruned
- Support the french language

Cons : 
- The little fps issue I had
- Maybe a little short, it took me 7H and half to beat the game for the first time, there is a new game+ but it's more a speedrun mode because it's the same thing but you will have every gear unlocked from the start.

80/100 It's worth your money and your time, it's very fun yet perfectible on some points

23879854.review:
Okay, before you look at me like I'm a retard. Im just going to say, so you can prepare your pantaloons. I am going to rip, the living shit out of this game. This game is just pure garbage, by far the most unentertaining, 2D platformer I have ever played.

The only good thing about this game is the way it looks and the universe. I would have loved to explore the desert area more, but i couldnt take it. The garbage gameplay and pointless fluff just made the game to unberable for me and so I requested a refund after my 4th hour of play.

1) Movement. The movement controls in shanate keyboard or controller. Is bad. Input feels delayed and moreover the movement in general is clunky and doesnt have much control. There are some areas where I clearly landed on certain platforms only to fall right through them. You have to be ludicriously prescise in some parts. You dont have much control compared to game that are like idk 10 years older.

2) Combat: At my point of the game I got a melee attack and a Max ranked pistol. There is no reason to use the melee other than it's multihit properties. But it only works if the enemies are at the exact same level (height). If for example you are at a level below and an enemy is blocking your way at a level higher then you, well guess what your fucked. 

Shanate also has vital moves that you can learn that are locked by a GEM wall. So you baiscally have to farm gems in order to achieve all the good moves in the game. If you have an inventory system in this kind of game it's simply a cop out for shit design. Thats all im saying. If you like good quality platformers, like Castlavania, Metroid, Cory n The house, Mario, ETC. Avoid this game like the plague

23731217.review:
9/ 10

갓겜.

산테 시리즈는 원래 재밌었다지만, 이건 모든 시리즈중 독보적인 걸작.
스토리상 샨테 상징인 마법과 밸리댄스 변신을 잃었단 설정인데 어떻게 된건지 액션의 다양함이 마법있던 전작 시리즈 때보다 몇배는 위다.

악역이었던 리스키와 함께 파이러츠 마스터를 쫒는다는 내용에서 그 과정에 얻게 되는 리스키의 해적 아이템을 얻어 쓴다는 진행을 통해 샨테의 액션과 패턴이 파워업하는 형식이다. 특정지형을 이동가능하게 해주는 해적 장비를 얻으며동시에 전투도 다양해지고 강화되는데,

권총 낙하산 시미터 등을 얻으면 단순히 특정지역 이동용이 아니라 놀랄만큼 다양하게 써먹을 수 있고 전투를 흥미롭게 만들어주며 신발 대포를 얻으면 완전 딴겜 수준으로 플레이 가능하다. 특히 신발을 얻을 경우 생기는 초고속 돌진기는 게임스타일에 큰 변화를 줄 뿐 아니라 그 액션 자체의 손맛도 끝내준다.

휴대용게임기의 이식작 답게, 인터페이스나 구성자체는 심플한데 볼륨도 조작감도 게임의 템포나 타격감 등도 모든것이 만족스러우며 골 빈듯이 유쾌하고 무식한 스토리를 매력적인 캐릭터가 완성시켰다. 샨테 시리즈는 원래 조작감이 부드럽고 안락하지만 이 게임은 템포면에서 좀더 스피디한 맛을 넣으며 조작감은 한단계 더 파워업 했다.

맵구성도 쾌적함 자체, 진행을 방해햐지 않는 깔끔한 필드 자체구성과, 신호탄이란 귀환아이템도 있어 이리저리 갔던 길 또가게 만드는 지겨움을 최소화 시켰다.

단점이 없는건 아닌데 적다.
-이식작이라 낮은 그래픽 해상도 
-한글 없는데 언어애드온도 없어 언어장벽으로 인한 몰입감 박탈
-체력회복등 소모품사용이 너무 자유로워 다소 낮은 난이도 설정
-별것없는 보스전

단점은 이정도밖에 보이질 않는다.
그러나 횡스크롤 찾는 사람중엔 하드코어 유저가 많아서 낮은 난이도란 문제는 확실히 사람에 따라선 걸림돌일수도 있겠다.  록맨 원작시리즈 정도의 난이도에 익숙한 올드유저라면 1~1.5점 더 까야 할 듯하다.

스팀에서 구한 다양한 횡스크롤 게임중 가장 재밌게 한 게임 중 하나.
속편이 곧 나온다고 하니 더없이 기대된다.

23714070.review: Эта игра просто великолепна. Я не играл в предыдущие части, а эту получил в комплекте Humble Monthly Bundle. Современные платформеры мне не особо нравятся, они все одинаковые или просто скучные. Но эта игра вернула меня прямиком в 90ые, когда ты будучи ребенком и держа контролер от сеги или денди получал дикий восторг от платфомеров. Здесь очень приятная и яркая картинка, простой геймплей, который укладывается в пару кнопок - беги, прыгай, убивай врагов, все очень просто. По ходу игры открываются новые способности, можно купить на заработанные очки разнообразные улучшения. Есть даже сюжет, который хоть и прост, но все равно цепляет. На удивление в этой игре очень круто нарисованы персонажи, почти все они девушки и не раз у меня нехило вставала шишка ( рейтинг 12 лет Sex от пеги себя оправдывает). Музыка великолепна, она бодрая и запоминающаяся - найдите трек из игры под названием "The nightmare woods" и вы поймете о чем я. Вообщем если вы соскучились по ярким, добрым и веселым платформерам, которые просты в освоении, то эта игра обязательна к покупке. Сам особо не играю в инди игры, но на прохождение этой потратил почти 10 часов и прошел за раз, а так сильно зацепить не каждый платформер сможет.

Ну вот я и добрался до The Pirate's Curse. 
Поервым делом бросается в глаза, что Шантае теперь человек и у нас отобрали нашу магию. В замен дали нам расходники с свойствами скилов. Я подумал, что теперь надо будет расчитывать и запасатся расходником. Не тут то было! Дело в том, что с мобов падает по одному кристалу и не 100%. В итоге местный дроп сделал из меня Скруджа МакДака и покупал я только небходимые предметы, такие как усиление урона.
К вопросу об апгрейдах они довольно слабые. ...и не берите удар ногой. Как он выполняется я так и не понял, а выполняется он на туже кнопку что и выстрел. 
Мобы... Как же меня бесили русалки в Risky's Revenge, но тут они оказались переработаны. Это порадавало. Оооо!!! Как же я заблуждался.
Если все уровни оригинальны и непохожи друг на друга. Уровень Mud Bog Island мало того, что набит бесячими врагами, так ещё и дизайн самого уровнявызывает отвращени. Враги, кстати, просто вылитые симбиоты из Spiderman...
В конце игры разработчи видимо думали, что они делают Angry Video Game Nerd Adventures. Вы не захотите перепроходить его.
Бесячий финальный босс, вы будите каждыраз смотреть заставку перед босом, будите смотреть на его трасформации, будите смотреть на то как он прокастовывает все свои атаки. В это время вы бить его не може.

Воооот.... А так весёлый, отличный платформер, с весёлым сюжетом, с уникальным квестом в каждом уровне (да, даже в Mud Bog Island). 
Непонятно только зачем разработчики напихали всё выше описанное, такую вот ложку дегтя.

23657192.review: Aside from a handful of trial and error sections, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a very fun and well put-together Metroidvania-esque platformer, with great pixel art and great music to round out the package.

23633770.review: A fun little platformer that will remind you of its contemporaries while still retaining a unique identity.  Nearly all characters have a charm to them and the story is filled with humerous moments.  Playing the previous games are not necessary to comprehend the story.  The music, illustrations, and pixel art are both very well done.  I'm not sure I would recommend this for young children due to some of the character art, but to paraphrase someone in the forums it's no different than taking your child to the beach.  People who grew up playing things like Mega Man, Metroid, and Duck Tales ought to find a nostalgia fix with appreciable difficulty here.  I recommend playing this with a controller but keyboard and mouse support is here too.

23555030.review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es una autentica maravilla de los metroidvania, un juego con una historia simple pero que propone un cierto humor y una jugabilidad muy sólida. Esta mítica saga desconocida se merece muchísimo más reconocimiento por los grandes títulos que dispone.

En este juego iremos obteniendo habilidades nuevas según avancemos y que nos desbloquearan nuevas zonas que antes no alcanzabamos. Esta característica es una de las principales por las que me encantan estos tipos de juegos, y es que te dejan con el gusanillo de que habrá en aquella zona que no podías ir antes, y ahora que puedes vuelves a esa zona para inspeccionar ¡y suele merecer mucho la pena!

La verdad es que me alegro mucho de haber conocido a tiempo esta saga, y se la recomiendo a cada una de las personas que conozco, porque para mi es uno de los metroidvania más solido y con mayor experiencia en el género, que con su toque desenfadado y divertido lo hace un título altamente recomendable. No dudeis en compradlo merece hasta el último euro de su precio!

All of the characters have cool personalities but the only downside is that if you haven't played the previous games you might not understand of some things they're talking about. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a HUGE stepup from Risky's Revenge.  The game pretty much has all the goodness of the prequel + more and some things done better. 23278105.review:
这是一款很好玩的日式横版过关游戏，是《Shantae》系列的第三作，本作有ACT游戏有的优点，也有自己的特色，是少数的女主人翁游戏，我就得横版过关最重要的就是手感和操作，本作的操作比较简单，特殊技能释放简单，基本2到3个键便能完成技能释放，手感很好，操作完美，动作流畅，差不多是我玩过这类游戏里最好的了。立绘精美，美工相比前作进步相当大，天气光影相当到位。人设塑造的很好。游戏节奏、剧情无缝衔接，不拖泥带水，章节之间有密切关联，还有一定的探索解密要素，随着新装备的获得，之前章节的未知区域也会被一一打开，从而慢慢收集起黑魔法和小章鱼。音乐方面，在小镇上的阿拉伯风格音乐十分带感，摘出来可以单曲循环，随着剧情的发展BGM也随之变化，最后boss战的BGM也我听过的最好的boss战BGM之一，不同章节有不同的风格的音乐，使用不同的攻击音效也不同。女主的配音也是赞的不行，除了基本的对话中的配音，在攻击、使用武器、连招时也有配音，显得更具打击感。
  这是一款被埋没精品，一款佳作，真心推荐，期待下一作！

动作苦手的我，居然3DS版也快通关了，回头写一下感想。
* 作为metroidvania，这个游戏相比恶魔城，还是偏银河战士。每个迷宫都有一个新道具，而且我很欣赏在拿道具的场景同屏立刻可以用新拿的道具练手这一点。

* Jake Kaufman的音乐真是神作。就像是在海边吃烧烤，[b]孜然和海盐味[/b]混杂在一起的美妙感觉，舌头简直停不下来。另外不出所料很多曲子都有恶魔城风。

缺点么。。
* 有些任务的交代一两句话就带过，如果漏看了就很麻烦。尤其是到了那个Propeller Town怎么继续那里费了点心思。
* Wii U和Steam版的像素风我倒不反对，不过不是点对点显示有点遗憾。铲子骑士是你的榜样。
* Steam版似乎没有（或者没做好）垂直同步？偶尔能看到画面撕裂，比较遗憾。

我会到处安利别人玩这个游戏的~

23162420.review:
Parece que los de Wayforward sabían en qué falló su anterior juego (que yo resalté en mi anterior análisis) y han explotado las buenas cualidades de Risky's Revenge: los personajes tienen más diálogo y tiempo en escena, los sprites ahora son el doble de bien hechos (no en vano Kinucakes ayudó con la animación) , backtracking mucho menos tedioso, las magias innecesarias eliminadas, mejoras que SÍ tienen multifunción y no solo romper X bloque, sistemas de teletransporte que no apestan, jugabilidad mejorada...este es EL juego de Shantae, el que todos deberían probar. 

Es un gran plataformas, y un gran metroidvania: entornos variopintos y divertidos de jugar, jefes finales llamativos, un final verdadero como dios manda, una trama que desarrolla ligeramente mejor a los personajes, humor lleno de doble sentido para los malpensados y sobre todo una dirección de arte sin igual. Además, viene traducido al español ( con ligeros fallos ) así que tienes literalmente 0 EXCUSAS para no probarlo. 

Mi única queja es que si consigues un par de corazones más y usas objetos, se vuelve muy fácil...pero siempre puedes NO hacerlo y tendrás un desafío decente. 1000% recomendado

22959308.review:
Итак, пишу обзор после прохождения игрули на 100%.
Можете не соглашаться, но Pirate's Curse - лучшая игра во франчайзе Shantae. В ней на высшем уровне выполнено почти всё!

Сюжет таков, что на Скаттл Таун опять нападение (привет первой части). Только на этот раз со стороны Ammo Baron'а. Мэр по тупости продал ему город. После этого появляется Риски Бутс без своего снаряжения и команды и обвиняет Шантэ в их пропаже. Последняя недоумевает. Риски показывает запертого пирата в мастерской дядюшки Мимика. Из ниоткуда возникает темная магия и превращает пирата в мутанта. После победы над ним, Риски рассказывает про некого обозленного Хозяина Пиратов, на которого раньше работала, а после его поражения от джиннов увела его оружие и команду. Вот так вот Шантэ объединяет усилия со своим заклятым врагом и отправляется в новое приключение, чтобы спасти мир от нечто более ужасного...

Геймплей не изменил жанр с любимой серией и мной лично метроидвании. На этот раз для достижения ранее недоступных областей используется не магия танца (ведь в конце Risky's Revenge Шантэ лишилась своей магии), а пиратское снаряжение Риски Бутс - пистолет, шляпа, ятаган, ботинки (самое забавное, что в оригинале они называются Risky's Boots) и пушка для выполнения четырёх прыжков вместо одного. Стартуем на этот раз с двумя сердечками, которые можно прокачать до 10 путем сбора не одного какого-то апгрейда, а 4-х на сердечко Heart Squid'ов, которые затем надо расплавить в кузнице Скаттл Тауна. Всего Squid'ов в игре 32. Для лечения, кроме зелий, также теперь можно использовать несколько типов еды. Магии может быть и нет, но две формы шипастого шара в игру вернулись в виде расходуемого предмета. Вместо зелья магии появилось монстр-молоко и супер монстр-молоко (временное увеличение урона). Также появилось полезное авто-зелье, которое автоматически восполняет здоровье, если оно опустилось до нуля. Но есть и слабые стороны даже у такой продуманной игры - специальные движения:
Back-dash, доступный изначально в Risky's Revenge, теперь надо покупать, но он не используется по большому счету из-за тупо медленного исполнения, в отличие от предшественника (после получения ботинок вообще становится бесполезен). Мув-лист Шантэ пополнился и двумя новыми движениями: восстановление в воздухе после получения удара (единственное хоть сколько эффективное) и пинок, который наносит 10 очков урона, но опять же почти не используется из-за низкой скорости атаки (нет серьезно, полная прокачка ятагана даст столько же). Эффективнее будет избить врага стандартной волоснёй.
Что же насчет мира игры, то теперь кроме Секвина доступно еще четыре не особо больших острова (без учета последнего) с такими незамысловатыми именами - Saliva Island, Spiderweb Island, Tan Line Island, Mud Bog Island и Frostbite Island. Последняя локация Lonely Grave вообще содержит только ОДНУ комнату без учета причала для корабля. На каждом из островов обитает пачка Heart Squid'ов, Cacklebats'ов (мутировавших пиратов Риски) и босс со своим логовом. Путешествовать на острова мы сможем с помощью корабля Риски, найдя перед этим карту острова. Тут мы подошли к еще двум вещам: пиратская сигналка, которая вне помещений мгновенно вернет к кораблю и темная магия, выпадающая с Cacklebats'ов. Всего в игре 20 таких порождений тьмы и, соответственно, единиц темной магии. Для прохождения игры вся темная магия необязательна, но для полной концовки игры она необходима. Всего, кстати, две концовки. Про геймплей вроде всё сказал.

Про музыку, написанную всё также Джейком Кауфманом, нечего сказать, кроме как шедевр. Отлично слушается даже отдельно от игры, хотя лучше всё-таки наслаждаться музыкой именно в игре.

К графике я вообще никогда не придираюсь. Нормальная графика, с учётом платформы-первоисточника - Nintendo 3DS.

Итог: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse - это великолепная игра, одна из лучших в жанре и лучшая в серии на данный момент. Ведь как можно не любить множество отдельных веселых и серьезных моментов, которыми она насыщена и которые сопровождаются отличнейшей музыкой. Одна из последних музыкальных тем - A Troublesome Trek, которая является ремиксом ночной темы 2 из оригинальной Shantae - вообще стоит на третьем месте в моем личном ТОПе-10 лучшей музыки из игр. Я ставлю игре полностью заслуженную 10/10.

22822422.review:
Ahoy! WayForward's trademark heroine is back with a new adventure that will see her join forces with her sworn enemy Risky Boots, and swap her (half-)genie moves with a brand spanking new pirate arsenal.

Much like its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/277890/]predecessor in the series[/url], [i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is a casual adventure platformer with a charming cartoonish design. As per usual, the new abilities you unlock as the story progresses go hand in hand with increasingly challenging foes and level design. Although some backtracking will at times break the linearity, the game follows a stable pattern of unlocking new areas one after another, each of which will feature some sort of maze-like dungeon where you'll earn a new skill and fight a boss.

Although the difficulty increases with each new area, it remains relatively easy on the whole, meaning you'll probably clear this ten-hour adventure without much frustration (only the final dungeon has a few brutal screens). If you've done a good job of amassing health upgrades, the boss fights are pretty straightforward and a wise use of the healing/shielding/offensive items will help keep you alive. None of them are hugely challenging, although the achievements for defeating them without taking damage are another story.

With the gameplay relying on rather classic action platformer mechanics and only posing a moderate challenge, its true highlights lie elsewhere. The cartoonish design is just delightful, most notably in the dialogue scenes where the character art is all kinds of cute. The writing is tons of fun, with heaps of absurd comedy, mild innuendo and occasionally breaking the fourth wall, all the same ingredients that had already made the previous episode so refreshing. Last but not least, Jake Kaufman's soundtrack is absolutely lovely, with a bunch of energetic, catchy tunes that will stay with you long after you've quit the game.

tldr Recommended as f

22667433.review:
https://youtu.be/1GikBNbcVYs

[h1][b]Geschichte[/b][/h1]
Dieses Spiel schließt an die Geschichten der vorherigen Teile der Nintendoreihe an. Hier wurden wir unserer magischen Fähigkeiten beklaut und versuchen diese wieder zu erlangen und die auch die Stadt vor dem Bösen zu bewahren. Durch das Spiel lernen wir viele Charaktere, Freunde und Feinde kennen.

[h1][b]Grafik[/b][/h1]
Für dieses Spiel ist die Grafik perfekt finde ich. Schön animierte Effekte und detailierte Umgebung sowie schöne Illustrationen bzw. Bilder der Charaktere. Es  errinnert mich an einige Spiele vom Nintendo DS. 

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Mit einem Controller lässt sich dieses Spiel sehr schön spielen. Im späteren Verlauf bedarf es etwas an feingefühl die Fähigkeiten die man erlangt hat zu kombinieren aber man kommt schnell rein und wird schnell in den Bann gezogen.
Ich kam für meine Verhältnisse gut mit der Steuerung klar.

[h1][b]Sound[/b][/h1]
Die Musik ist auch hier sehr schön in  Szene gesetzt und passt sich immer den Situationen bzw der Karte/Umgebung an. Teilweise wurden hier auch Stimmen verwendet für die Charaktere was diese noch authentischer macht. An einigen Stellen merkte ich das Effekte-Geräusche fehlten, aber sonst wurde alles gut vertont.

[h1][b]Wiederspielwert[/b][/h1]
Durch die Erfolge und die verschiedenen Enden  und sogar den 2. Modus, spielt man dieses Spiel  gerne ein 2. oder sogar 3. mal.

[h1][b]Herausforderung[/b][/h1]
Manche Stellen im Spiel sind schon sehr Nervenrauben und schwer, da man mit einem kleinen Fehler oft den Kartenabschnitt neu  machen muss. Bei den Endbossen muss man manchmal auch die Mechaniken erstmal herausfinden aber kommt auch gut voran. Es ist also nicht zu schwer.

[h1][b]Fazit[/b][/h1]
Wer ein gutes Action Jumb&Run sucht, welches nicht nur eine schöne Geschichte bietet sondern auch Humor und Herausforderung, dem kann ich dieses  Spiel nur empfehlen. Mir hat es viel Spaß gemacht, dieses Spiel durchzuspielen.

22464901.review:
This game has made me tremendously sad. I am sad because I have finished it, and I weep for there are no more worlds to conquer.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a rock-solid middling-to-hard Metroidvania platformer. A Metroidvania (or IGAvania, or exploration platformer) is an open world game that provides you with a huge environment to explore. As you travel through this world you gain strength, power, and -- most importantly -- special abilities that let you overcome obstacles you couldn't before.

The game opens with Scuttle Town being sold off by its childish mayor to the Ammo Baron, who plans to turn it into a military base. Shantae, the town's Guardian Genie, manages to defeat him, only to be arrested for attacking the town's lawful owner. While extricating herself from the situation, Shantae runs into one of her old enemies, a Tinkerbat, who's been possessed by dark magic. Shantae's nemesis, Risky Boots, warns her that the dark magic heralds the potential return of the Pirate Master -- the near-godlike entity responsible for the disappearance of most of geniekind. Shantae and Risky are forced to put aside their enmity to team up against the greater evil.

That's the storyline. The game itself is largely linear; Shantae and Risky arrive on a new island, encounter a series of comic mishaps, and in the course of exploration Shantae discovers the entrance to a "Den of Evil" (dungeon). Each dungeon contains enemies, puzzles, a boss fight, and one piece of Risky's missing pirate equipment -- these last items grant Shantae increased mobility, giving her a downstab, multi-jump, etc. Defeating each boss also unlocks the next island.

In true Metroidvania fashion, it's completely impossible to obtain everything just heading straight through the game. There are tons of hidden items and secret exits that can't be reached unless you come back to earlier areas with equipment from later ones; some of it is skippable, some of it isn't.

The first Shantae game was a decent length, with five dungeons and a large overworld, but the second game was pathetically short, with only two actual dungeons and a very short completion time, and since the second one has a PC release and the first doesn't, people assume it's characteristic.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse again has five full dungeons, as well as a few overworld areas that are large and convoluted enough to serve as dungeons themselves. In addition to the usual heart containers, Shantae can collect "Dark Magic" from specific, well-hidden enemies; the vast majority are hidden in fair, guessable locations. (ROT-13 Spoiler: Fbzr Pnpxyrongf nccrne jura lbh penfu vagb fcrpvsvp jnyyf.)

Combat works well; Shantae has a lot of options, especially in the late game, and I rarely found myself blaming the controls. Aside from one boss (and anyone who's played knows exactly which one) fights are mostly about knowing what's coming and developing tactics to beat it, not raw dexterity or luck.

The platforming starts easy but takes the kid gloves off somewhere around the fourth island. While the later levels are full of one-hit-kill traps, you can nearly always see them coming -- and, in an innovation I'd like to see more of, one-hit-kills and falling off the screen don't mean game over. You just take damage and respawn at the start of the room, Zelda style. I haven't seen this in platform games before.

One pet peeve I have in platform games that let you explore in every direction is how it's often hard to tell whether falling off the screen means dying or just going to a new area. In Shantae, pits that will kill you are always marked with skull-and-crossbones symbols. No guesswork. I like it.

I refrained from using a guide until the last "clean up" sweep for missing hearts and magic, and got easily about 12 hours of gameplay. Since some of this time was spent searching and/or being stumped by puzzles, using a guide all the way through would probably cut this to 7-8 hours, respectable for a Metroidvania.

THE GOOD:
* Longest entry in the series
* Well-designed dungeons
* Characters are engaging
* Jokes are actually funny
* Good difficulty curve, decently challenging by the end
* Configurable keyboard and gamepad controls

THE BAD:
* Iffy replayability
* One deeply unfair boss fight
* No clues about certain collectibles
* Graphics a little pixelated for a modern game

(And yes, I know what the other thing people associate Shantae games with is. I enjoy it -- I'm human -- but I don't think it either improves or detracts from the quality of the game. Unless you've got some kind of hangup about women in bathing suits, almost all of this game is fine for kids -- the running gag in "Run Run Rottytops!" is a little over the line, but it'll probably just go right over most kids' heads.)

22418428.review:
shantae and the pirate's curse is a 2d action platformer where players assume the role of the titular character, the adorable half-genie shantae. in this game, she teams up with her rival risky boots to save the world from a looming threat, the return of the (in case you couldn't already tell from the title) master pirate, who was defeated and sealed away by the guardian genies years ago.

unlike the previous game, which takes place in just one island, meaning a single interconnected world, this game is divided into different, separated levels, with shantae exploring five islands (not including the first one, where scuttle town is located) in a more or less linear way: the level design itself is fairly linear, but the player will often need to return to previous islands, either to perform some action that will allow the story to progress, either to get some collectible that was previously inaccessible and that you can now obtain thanks to abilities that have since been acquired; this way of organizing the world, making the player move back and forth between islands, is why shantae and the pirate's curse is considered a member of the metroidvania group of games.

the collectibles mentioned in the previous paragraph are divided into two categories: 1. dark magic, in the form of tinkerbats that have now mutated thanks to it and that you will need to defeat to seal said magic inside your lamp, and 2. squid hearts, which can then be melted in groups of four and transformed into extra health by the "squidsmith". 

the aforementioned scuttle town, where the game begins and the town of which shantae is the guardian genie, will serve as a hub, to which she will often return, either to perform some necessary action (often in the form of interactions with npcs) or to acquire items and upgrades.

in each of the remaining five islands shantae will find a den of evil, a place from where the master pirate is obtaining the dark magic that is allowing him to grow stronger; these dens of evil bear a strong resemblance to the dungeons in the legend of zelda series: in each one of them you will find a new ability, which will allow you to explore previously inaccessible areas (both inside and outside the dungeon) and that will be used in some way to defeat the boss of the dungeon in question.

speaking of bosses, they are fairly easy to deal with: this game as a whole is not maddeningly difficult, but i wouldn't say it's easy either, so it comes as a surprise that the bosses fall so easily, at least if you choose to use the arsenal at your disposition. they pretty much will never be a problem, unless you are trying to get the no-hit achievements, but even then they won't be a huge headache. i don't see it as a big problem, but to some it might be disappointing.

shantae's main weapon throughout this adventure is her signature hair whipping, but pistols and a scimitar will be added to her arsenal as the game progresses; other weapons, which on the previous game used the (now gone, for story reasons) magic meter (like the pike balls) became consumable itens. controls are very tight and responsible, a pretty important thing in this kind of game (well, an important thing in any kind of game, but especially in games that ask for precision like this one).

the game's tone is very lighthearted and humorous, with a good selection of charismatic and excentric character, as well as some fairly funny moments; the anime-influenced art style, while obviously not as good as one that's purely anime, is nice too.

there are a few problems here and there: you can't check if you already got all of the collectibles in an island without returning to risky's boat (being able to access this info on the menu would have been very useful, as it can be hard to keep track of it) and a (considerably long) insta-fail stealth section, which is not a big deal once you beat it, but will probably get on your nerves the first time. additionally, it can be somewhat difficult to know what to do next in some points (funnily enough, i didn't really have any problems with this, but i can see some people hitting a wall that will keep them from progressing, which can be very frustrating, especially when this wall comes from the game not giving you much information), although i think this is massively improved over risky's revenge.

these complaints, however, are small when compared to the game's achievements, and i think it's fair to say shantae and the pirate's curse is a very good videogame that deserves to be played by anyone with an interest in the genre, especially considering how cheap it is.

22416520.review:
While [i]"Shantae and the Pirate's Curse"[/i] is a lot like [i]"Shantae: Risky Boots' revenge"[/i] in some ways it's also unlike it in a lot of ways as well. It's ultimately still a platformer and a skill-attaining game that opens up more areas, but instead of an overworld you are given stage select screens. And instead of magic you have pirate items.

The first impression I had when I started playing was that the game was confirming the magic is no longer a thing due to the events of the last game (Risky Boots' Revenge). Honestly Shantae's transformations were a big part of what I found to be entrancing about the previous game. The fact that it was gone for good left me feelign liek there was a little hole in the heart of the game that wouldn't [i]quite[/i] be filled by the new skills. And really they didn't fill that hole but they were still decent game mechanics.

Shantae's friends played a more active role in this game than they did in the previous game which I totally approved of. In "Shantae: Risky Boots' Revenge" Rottytops, Bolo, Skye, and Uncle Mimic were ultimately just there to exist - they did nothing and were as forgetable as any town NPC save for the fact that they had unique appearances. In Shantae and the Pirate's Curse they actually take part as plot devices throughout the story. They're more like characters and less like decorations - very enjoyable characters too. 

On that note I was kinda meh about the whole teaming up with Risky Boots concept. When the only thing Risky does is sit at the dock and drive you from one stage to the other she becomes decoration. She does have her own part in the story of course, but she's given reasons all the time for why she cannot participate in anything which waters down the whole "teaming up" concept. I think a more interesting way to handle it would be to give Risky the pirate gear and leave Shantae some magic and transformations. It would have required different stage setups, but I feel it would have added something (pirate skills and a true teaming-up concept) without taking something (the enchantment of the transformations).

The items Shantae finds are all pirate items [spoiler]that were owned by Risky Boots before they were taken from her[/spoiler]: 

The [b]pistol[/b] is mostly only good at hitting distant puzzle switches unless it's tuned up to max level. The pistol basically replaces the fireball spell from the first game (1-damage). With no limit to bullets there's nothing stopping you from slinging all the bullets you want out there but it's still slower to shoot 5-8 bullets than it is to just go up and hit someone once with her hair. When maxed up (5-damage) the pistol is actually pretty okay as a weapon. 2-3 shots will kill most minor enemies.

The [b]hat[/b] feels kinda dumb in all honesty. It's basically a parachute or a glider depending how you use it. I feel it's just dumb that a hat is given noriety as a pirate item belonging to Risky [spoiler]and the Pirate Master[/spoiler] but all it does is catch wind like a parachute. As far as game mechanics go it's alright. When you get the cannon you'll never use it again except for the puzzles that require you use it. I will give the animation credit though; it looks adorable.

The [b]scimitar[/b] is simply a down-thrust while in the air. This works really well in combat as well as opening passages under Shantae's feet. You can also see the scimitar when using the boots which I think adds a little more flavor to the item than a one-trick pony (realistically a sword feels like it should be usable as a weapon but it is what it is. There are a few enemies that are much easier to fight when down-thrusting above them.

Risky's [b]boots[/b] are only usable on specific situations: primarily when there's enough flat land for running (technically you [i]can[/i] do a back-and-forth run and it'll still count as the building speed phase but no secret areas seem to be level with any of these areas I've tried it on which makes me think the developers might not have actually intended the back-and-forth movement to be a viable way to activate the boots). Once activated Shantae rushes in one direction dealing damage to anything that touches her and tearing down secret hidden walls. It's gimmicky as far as combat goes. You'll only end up using it when the stage was designed for it to be used since it requires prepping to pull off.

Risky's [b]cannon[/b] is basically this game's double-jump (though technically you can use it three times per jump). While in teh air the cannon will fire downwards and propell Shantae upwards. Once you get the cannon you'll use it a lot simply for the overwhelming convienence compared to Risky's hat. In combat it's okay but really Shantae's hair and scimitar take care of most things combat-wise anyway - it's good for avoidance though.


There were also certain skills you could learn from a shop in town:

The [b]Back Dash[/b] makes Shantae slide backwards just like the first game. You'll never use it. If it were a particularly fast slide it'd have merit but it slides her backwards at the same exact speed you could just move her in that direction. The animation put into it is lovely though.

The [b]Back Flip[/b] can be a life saver. typically if you're hit hard or hit at all while in the air you'll be knocked back and fall until you hit the ground. If you back flip you'll hop out of that state and be able to control yourself. I found this particularly importanbt when jumping from rope to rope over pits. Backflipping and gliding with a hat or double jumping with a cannon back to a rope kept me alive a dozen times or more.

The [b]Power Kick[/b] is just straight up stupid. It's a slow melee kick that does barely any better damage than the hair. The hair will do about 8 damage and can be spammed. The kick will do 10 damage but you'll take about a half second to do it. That's not even considering the button combo you have to do to pull it off. It is also shorter range if I remember right. You'll buy this to try it (because your curiousity will force you to) and then you'll never use it again. It's a badly implimented mechanic.

The level design - and the story surrounding each level - throughout Shantae was pretty cool all in all. It never took itself too seriously but it kept me enraptured all through the game. It even managed to make a filler boss battle feel like more than it was. The Shantae games seem to excel at this through sassy comedy and sexy-cute visuals.

I don't mind puzzles as long as they don't stop my progress. For the majority of the game this was okay. I was never hung up on anything long until the very last level. I'm of the belief that any game that has life bars or HP counts in them should stray away from including any instant killing factors (aside for bottemless pits anyway since that's just how it goes with pits). The final level is literally full of things designed to kill you in one hit. You'd probably think "well the last level is suppose to be hard, right?" and you would have merit to think this. But at the same time this game has you putting forth a lot of exploration and effort into finding heart squids to increase your HP. What is the point of this if when the final level comes you'll just die in one hit anyway? Is it challenging? Yes. It's also bad design.

Ultimately I did enjoy this game. The animations were sexy, adorable, and happy. The puzzles were mostly moderate or easy. The story was silly and fun. It didn't have quite the same flair as Risky's Revenge (the loss of magic really hit the alure), but I still recommend it.

22309133.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8GdHEn3ybG4
[h1]Great 2D Platform Action with decent price[/h1]
I´m new to Shantae series and this was my first try at it. At first i thought the gameplay wasn´t complex enough, but as you progress through the game you will unlock different stuff that will get you abilities such as triple jump, cutlass/pistol that give you some cool functionalities. 

There is also unlockables in the game which are the Squid hearts and Dark Magics, collecting all dark magic will give you the "Good Ending" essentially and longer final boss fight so i recommend doing that. The Music is pretty neat and the characters offer lot of fan service and fun dialogue throughout the game. Shantae does share lot of similarities to Ori and the blind forest on its gameplay mechanics and similar setting where in the beginning of the game you don´t have that much things.

As you complete the game through first time you will unlock Pirate Mode which enables you to pretty much speedrun the game and get all pirate gear in the very first level.

[h1]The Better Side[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Around 18h of Gameplay among NewGamePlus so theres lot of replayability too
    [*]Great Platform Action & Fan service
    [*]Item System is very refreshing element to a platform game
    [*]The Characters have great designs and are very likeable
    [*]Great Level Design & Music
[/list]
[h1]The Worse Side[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The Games last level raises the difficulty quite alot among the last boss
    [*]Game doesn´t always tell u what do you need to do next, even the game is rather linear
    [*]Wish there was more audio dialogue, but i guess that doesn´t fit this type of a game in first place (Rather personal request)
[/list]

Quizá algunos se podrían dececpionar de que en este juego no tienes un mundo completamente interconectado sino que son varias islas entre las que puedes viajar cuando llegas a un puerto, pero a mi en lo personal me pareció que supera a su antecesor por mucho.
Tiene el mejor pixel art que he visto en un videojuego, con excelentes efectos de iluminación, una jugabilidad impecable y un muy buen ritmo de juego.
A mi no me gustó Risky's Revenge debido a un montón de pequeños detalles consecuencias de ser un port(como la falta de una opción para ver el mapa con sólo presionar un botón, el par de barras negras verticales omnipresentes, o el hecho de que el botón de cancelar en los menús tuviera que ser forzosamente el botón de salto), tengo el gusto de confirmar que Pirate's Curse no tiene esos problemas.
Le recomiendo este juego a cualquiera que busque un buen juego de plataformas o un buen metroidvania, y eso creo que aplica a todos los que se interesen lo suficiente en el juego como para leer este análisis.

21982857.review:
Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse is a fairly easy 2D action platformer. You play as Shantae, a half-genie who is now just all human.

Oddly for a platforming game, there is actually a fair bit of story here; Shantae and Risky Boots, your sidekick/captain, are both reasonably well characterized, and the game makes a lot of call-backs to previous games… which I haven’t played. While the game IS comprehensible, I have no idea who any of these people are so the little side-stories which feature them lack meaning for me. That said, the game is full of funny dialogue, and Squid Baron in particular made me smile with his fourth-wall breaking rants. The game doesn’t take itself too seriously, and he was a particular highlight of that, but on the whole it worked reasonably well, even if it did rely a bit heavily on lampshade hanging for its humor.

Graphically, the game is reasonably attractive as well; the 2D Sprite graphics look pretty good, and the larger character portraits which appear while the characters are chatting look great. The game’s comedic style extends to its art, with the characters having amusingly exaggerated expressions. The game’s art is somewhat sexualized – the artist clearly loves voluptuous women, and the hips of the game’s female characters don’t lie – but it wasn’t to the point where it bothered me, and it is often played for laughs, particularly given one of the characters is an attractive female zombie. Plus, let’s face it – a lot of people like looking at pretty ladies, so that’s really probably a plus for a lot of folks. If that sort of thing DOES bother you, though, this is likely a game which will trigger your distaste, as several of the female characters are a bit bouncy.

Squid Baron, again, really shines here – his sprite is amusing enough, but his character art is great, and his hyper-exaggerated expressions really help sell his silliness. 

As for the gameplay itself, the game is… well, okay. It is a reasonable 2D platformer, but frankly, it is quite easy for almost its entire length. The game, unlike most such games, grants the player an inventory menu containing 12 items, each of which the player can carry 9 of – and this includes vast numbers of healing items, as well as items which block projectiles, damage enemies passively, and greatly increase Shantae’s attacks. You accumulate them over the game, you don’t really need to use them too frequently (especially once you get used to the way the game plays), and by the later portions of the game you will have acquired vast numbers of them, to the point where nothing can realistically challenge you. There is an in-game shop as well, selling items in exchange for gems dropped by pots you break and enemies you kill, allowing you to further top-up on stuff, as well as buy upgrades for your attacks which allow you to deal more damage.

The net result of this is by about halfway through the game you run out of upgrades to buy and pretty much end up with gigantic piles of items in your inventory which you don’t even need to use. I started using some in the second-to-last dungeon just because I had so many, but I still had enough gems to be capped out by the end. I did use the damage-enhancement items on the bosses because there is absolutely no reason not to, and it makes getting the various no-damage achievements that much easier.

Honestly, the achievements are the most challenging part of the game; beating it is almost trivial, and beating some of the bosses without taking damage is quite simple, while for others, it is moderately more difficult. This sort of thing – along with a few other random optional achievements – are likely to contribute almost all of the difficulty the game holds. It is only in the final two dungeons that the game really starts trying to challenge the player, and while the final dungeon does contain some pretty challenging portions (and a sharp difficulty spike), the final two bosses are strangely easy, with only the optional form of the final boss posing any real challenge to the player.

That said, the game isn’t that short. While it seemed short while playing it – and the ample save points made it easy to get out of – the in-game timer said it took me a little under 9 hours to 100% the game. I’d guess it probably took about 10.5-11 hours including the time spent getting the side achievements. That said, if you’re looking for a really substantial experience, this probably isn’t it – a lot of the time in-game was spent doing relatively unchallenging things, and there was some backtracking involved in gathering various collectibles. In terms of fresh content, you’re likely looking at 6 hours or so of gameplay, maybe a bit more.

All in all, this is a decent but not amazing game. I recently played Strider, and that game felt a lot more satisfying to me than this did. Not to say that Shantae was bad, but it just wasn’t exceptional; it is a decent filler game, but if you’re looking for a high-end platformer, you’re better off looking elsewhere. This is middle of the road; it probably won’t be disappointing, but it won’t impress you particularly either.

Ok, there's no need to lie, but boobs made me want to start playing the game, but stayed for the platoforming, which is really responsive, progression of the story and the level exploration is intuitive, a  fair variety of powers, sometimes new unlocks will require you to revisit places. 

I have not played the previous titles, but the story was easy to understsand and it was quite enjoable, filled with humor and twists. 

The difficulty raises gradually with the progression, the boss battles are enjoyable, there are plenty of save points to not be required to replay big chuncks of levels. The artwork is amazing.

Would have liked more voiceacting than just a few words and moans (don't get me wrong, I can't get enough of those, I would have even enjoyed more, ppl walking in the room hearing the sounds coming from speakers might have considered I was doing something else). The soundtrack is ok. 

I would recommend this title for both casual players and hardcore platformer gamers, the learning curve is a bit more on the easy side in the beginning but might become difficult near the end.

P.S. Need to thank GreaT for the game, which can be easily be finished in a day or two if played intensely, I finished it in a weekend.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse seems to strip almost every recognisable mechanic out of the first two games - and is a far more enjoyable game because of it.

21833795.review:
J'ai beaucoup aimé ce jeu. 

Il surpasse le précédent jeu de Shantae en tout point. Les environnements sont beaucoup plus diversifiés et il y a plus de monstres différents à combattre. Le seul petit défaut, c'est peut-être le niveau final, qui me semble beaucoup trop difficile si je me met dans la peau d'un enfant qui réussit à parvenir à la fin. J'avais l'impression de jouer à un jeu difficile comme Castle in the Darkness plutôt qu'à Shantae!

En ce qui concerne le gameplay, les pouvoirs de Shantae, cette fois-ci, ne sont plus des pouvoirs des transformation, mais plutôt des armes de pirate. Ces dernières ne sont pas seulement utiles pour accéder à de nouvaux endroits, mais également lors des combats contre les ennemis et les boss. Plusieurs armes sont également importantes pour augmenter les chances de survie lors des sauts de plateforme en plateforme. 

En ce qui concerne l'histoire, elle est banale et elle contient une certaine dose d'humour, sans jamais pour autant être trop vulgaire. Le visuel, de son côté, est très bien. Tout est coloré et a un style dessin animé. Finalement, la durée de vie - une dizaine d'heures - est très raisonnable pour le style de jeu, surtout qu'elle n'est pas augmentée de façon artificielle contrairement à ce que l'on voit dans d'autres jeux. 

Je donne à ce jeu une note de 9 sur 10, ce qui est deux points de plus par rapport à ce que j'avais donné pour le précédent jeu de la série Shantae. J'espère que le prochain jeu sera tout aussi bon!

21655631.review: The first two Shantae games were charmingly designed, but a bit of a mess gameplay wise. With Pirate's Curse, WayForward seems to have drawn what made people fall in love with the idea of these games and jettison the clunkier parts for a streamlined and breezy experience that serves as a tidy little cap to the series. The basic gameplay retains the Zelda II/Castlevania formula of side-scrolling exploration and power-up collecting, while ditching the more tedious map traversal of the first two games in favor of a simple level select hub. For plot reasons, the transformation dances are replaced with pirate relics that handily map to your controller's various buttons. While the core platforming and boss battles are still tempered by a near endless well of health items, there's enough meat to the level design and platforming to keep it from feeling like you're blasting through the game with little resistance. And the impressive sprite work, soundtrack, and, ehem, signature sense of humor that have come to characterize the series are all intact. While I wouldn't say WayForward necessarily knocked this one out of the park, Shantae and the Pirate's curse is a respectable RBI.

優點：
1.相較於Shantae: Risky's Revenge，操作有了很明顯的改進，跳躍曲線也變的更好操作
2.雖然取消了傳統的變身系統，但特殊道具的運用卻比變身更直覺，而且不需要變身的前置動作（跳舞），意外的反而讓整體流程更爽快
3.音樂極佳，前作音樂已經很不錯了，本作的音樂亦是更出色，尤其是Saliva Island的BGM真的很棒
4.地圖設計變的更雷同於Super Metroid的補格子設計，使整個探索流程可以說是更順暢
5.未收集的要素會直接標示於地圖上，不需要再地毯式搜索
6.總之各方面相較前作（Shantae: Risky's Revenge）都有飛躍性進步，如果喜歡前作的玩家基本上不會失望

缺點：
1.如果可以把地圖設定成單鈕開啟可能會更好
2.手把鍵位似乎是不能更動，但前作Shantae: Risky's Revenge卻可以改....
3.零星的幾個部份解迷提示略少，但基本上算不上什麼問題

總結：
優質的探索類動作遊戲，而且相比前作確實的感受到進步
同時明顯的可以看出系統方向更偏向Metroid，不僅僅是地圖的方面，有幾個部份更是讓人有刻意致敬（？）的感覺
例如衝刺技能一樣都需要助跑距離才能加速，Tan Line Temple的潛行橋段也有點神似metroid zero mission
甚至主角在最終boss戰跟Super Metroid一樣有爆氣演出
如果是不熟悉英文的中文使用者可能會在劇情道具的交付上卡關，但基本上迷宮內的機關都不會太複雜，解迷相較於前作是比較簡單些，應該是不會太讓人挫折
總個來說是完全對的起這個價位的遊戲，平衡上也是恰到好處，不會讓玩家覺得太難，或是簡單到可以無腦過關
大致上是沒有太多地方可以挑惕的遊戲，期待WayForward的下一款Shantae: Half-Genie Hero可以做的更棒

另外讓人疑惑的一點是，從收藏庫內點選Shantae and the Pirate's Curse→右鍵→內容
可以看到這款遊戲是有語言選項的，而且是包括日語、法語、德語等多國語言，但即使調整了遊戲內語言也不會更動
難不成是還在進行其他語言的製作？
